Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: SCgigi_12
Reviews.Content: My first time at the Fairmont and was not disappointed. I was there for business and had everything I needed. Good service and nice accommodations. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “still wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MFHLouisville_KY
Reviews.Content: Elegant hotel on Nob Hill convenient to everything. Rooms in tower (TOWER) on a clear day and from higher floors have one of the most beautiful views in the world. If you can swing a suite, the view is even better with the corner window. Trolleys (California and Powell Street) intersect behind hotel outside garage. No concierge floor, as in some other Fairmonts, but of minimal significance. Use Starwood a lot (and lover their SPG program) but cannot bring myself to try St Regis, W, or The Palace because of the view and overall ambiance in the Fairmont!

Reviews.Title: “First Fairmont Visit”
Reviews.Author: spinecutter
Reviews.Content: This is an elegant and extremely customer oriented hotel with a spectacular location though if you plan to walk to too many places where good hiking shoes. The hills leading up or down from the hotel are a touch steep. The rooms are magnificently comfortable, the staff helpful and courteous, and the food in the Tonga Room was wonderful. The gym is also quite adequate. I would encourage you to join the Presidents Club of the hotel as it then gives free standard access to internet and to the gym. Ready access to Union Square shopping, and some lovely little cafes down the street for meals if you want to eat out of the hotel proper.

Reviews.Title: “Grande Dame Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim2458
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Fairmont for a business meeting was a wonderful experience, though just shy of a top rating because of technology, which I will detail after raves about every other aspect of this well-maintained landmark. My room on the second floor was just off the elevators. I was concerned about noise but did not hear a thing. The room was twice the size of my home's master bedroom with a walk-in closet larger than some NYC apartments. The king bed was extremely comfortable, the desk substantial, and the bathroom well-stocked with beautifully fragranced Le Labo toiletries. Check-in was easy and the staff were polite, adding my President's Club number after the planner forgot to include it, ensuring I would get free phone and wireless, and access to the health club. Housekeeping was immaculate. A buffet for the 500 people attending our meeting featured a wide variety of well-prepared "Around the World" foods and drinks. The meeting room was comfortable, including the temperature, which in many hotels is either too hot or too cold. Had I known portions at the Tonga Room, a throwback to the old tiki bar and restaurant days, were so large, I would not have ordered an appetizer. The food was good. The Tonga Room was loaded with tourists who took photos during the quarter-hour indoor rainstorms, and the band in the floating thatch-hut stage was quite good, as was the food. The breakfast buffet in the Laurel Court Restaurant and Bar was pricey, but worth it, with ample offerings including omelets, pancakes, french toast, a variety of pastries, fruit smoothies, yogurt parfaits with granola, and excellent juices and coffee. Service was very efficient without being intrusive. What keeps me from giving the hotel a five "star" rating? Two channels on the flat screen digital TV did not come in at all or were pixelated and unwatchable. I'm not talking about the Golf Channel -- it was the San Francisco ABC and NBC network affiliates. I also could not access the wireless service at all and used my aircard, which brought up another issue. Probably due to the city's hills, Verizon and AT&T service are not the best at the hotel. Being a pre-tech property, it was difficult to conveniently plug in my phone, laptop and iPad, though housekeeping would have no problem plugging in a vacuum, as the receptacles were all inches off the floor, but not near the desk. It took a significant amount of time for the hot water to make it to the second floor, but once it got there, the shower was marvelous. Spa treatments were limited to facials, a couple of back and body scrubs, waxing, and sports, Swedish and deep tissue massages. I hoped for more variety in the massages. Yes, that last point is probably nitpicking. Would I stay here again? Most definitely. There are two cable car lines serving the hotel, and if you're ambitious, you can walk downhill a little over a mile to Fisherman's Wharf and a little further to Ghiradelli Square. Take the cable car back (for $6). I'm glad my company chose the Fairmont for its meeting. My only regret is that I only spent two nights there. One tip: take the shuttle back to the airport. At $14, it was a bargain compared to the $55 it cost for my cab ride into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Jene74
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for a conference and the hotel was absolutely beautiful! Very historic and charming and very clean. Our room was huge. The service was also fantastic and everyone went out of their way to help. I would highly recommend it. The Tonga room in the hotel is really fun as well. The Hotel is not far from many points of interest, but it is at the top of Nob Hill so if you plan to walk to those places, be prepared to walk back up a very steep hill or hail a cab. The Street Cars will also drop you off at various points of interest though and they run right by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel in the city!”
Reviews.Author: texasswerve
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to San Francisco 7 times in the last 2 years due to our son being in college at Berkeley. We have tried many of the top hotels in the city and have found our new favorite! Everything was absolute perfection from check-in to check-out. Our room was beautiful with a gorgeous view of the city. The bar downstairs in the lobby was a wonderful place to gather and relax. All of the staff were very friendly and had that can do attitude. The location is perfect within walking distance of most portions of the Financial District, Nob Hill and Union Square. Even though it's within walking distance of many attractions, it is very quiet! Not anything like staying right in the heart of Union Square or off of Market Street , both of which are very noisy! So if you like a beautiful hotel with wonderful service in a quiet location, this hotel is for you!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel ... Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CJMTraveler
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an elegant alternative in San Francisco, be sure to check out the Fairmont. Set in the Russian Hill area, it's easy to get to all the tourist attractions but set away from a lot of the craziness of the city. Hotel features large, well-appointed rooms. Plenty of food and beverage outlets to choose from if you decide to dine in the hotel. Polished, professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Historic Property”
Reviews.Author: jacksocm
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Fairmont San Francisco for a conference. The hotel is beautiful with loads of history (check out the photos with captions on the wall going from the lobby to the tower). My tower room with city view was very nice and very clean. My only complaint is the hotel's location-Nob Hill. The views are great, but dining options are limited. Unless you're in fantastic shape, walking up the hill (and for some, down the hill) is challenging. If you're traveling with an individual with limited mobility, I'd recommend staying at the Wharf or near Westfield Mall. Both have many accessible dining options. On the up side, the Fairmont sits right on the cable car line. The downside; the cable car is expensive ($6 each way), slow, and very crowded. Taxis are a much better option. All in all, I enjoyed this property, its history, and the view, but I'm likely to try a different property on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Full of character”
Reviews.Author: C---cumber
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in Nov 2011, just as the Gingerbread house was being built. It is fascinating and you see how much work is put into it. The lobby area is extremely grand and welcoming. We stayed in a standard room and found this to be comfortable with all standard amenities. I think happy hour at the bar was from 5-7pm and offered some fab cocktails. I didn't have too much interaction with the staff but they were helpful when called upon. The location is great although after a day or evening out and about it can be tough walking up the hill to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont was fair at best”
Reviews.Author: 09cas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont for a conference. During check in and check out the front desk clerks were very rude and not the least bit friendly. The room I was given was smaller than average with huge ceilings. I found multiple hairs on the sheets upon my arrival. The lobby was grand and nice. I returned to my room one afternoon to find three messages on my machine claiming I ordered breakfast which I did not. Wildly strange because when I called down to check on it they had no record of it either. Upon checkout, they attempted to charge me $20 for a USB Flash Drive which I did not take from the refreshment center. That's always nice. Parking was $61/night which is a little steep. Restaurant on site wasn't much. No vending on site. If you want a Coke you have to purchase it from the gift shop before 10 pm and they charge $4 for a 20 oz. Coke. The hotel is simply too rich for my blood and I would never choose to stay their on my own. The hallways are dark. Mattresses and pillows left much more to be desired in the way of comfort. The doors are paper thin. You can hear everything in the hallways and vise versa. In the mornings you can certainly hear the hot water scream through the pipes to service the rooms above you. However, other than hotels outrageous prices it is not any fancier than any other hotel I have stayed at. Historic charm for some but it just felt like an old outdated house to me. Oh yeah, there is no swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Classical Room”
Reviews.Author: Allan S
Reviews.Content: Beautiful classical room but not very comfy... Was invited to stay here courtesy of Amex. Given a beautiful classical suite. Amazing Views. BAD bed.... Apart from that everything else was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm”
Reviews.Author: finallyavacation29
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. Due to it's historic nature this hotel stands apart. It's filled with history going back to the Congo Room. It's not centrally located and will require a taxi for most to get around. The hills are steep in the Nob Hill side of town. But if the price is right you should stay here. Reminds you of the shining with the old elevators and carpet. We had a suite with a balcony and the views were amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: nyo2007
Reviews.Content: ...but also in need of a little updating. It's very old school elegance, I think it's a beautiful place to stay. I love the Nob Hill area, I lived in SF for 10 years but never spent much time in this neighborhood. It's close to Union Square, but be warned the walk back is all uphill. The Tonga Room is also located in the hotel, and Top of the Mark is right across the street at the Mark Hopkins. We snagged a special holiday rate and stayed a couple weeks before Xmas. The hotel had a huge tree in the lobby and a giant gingerbread house display, it was very festive.

Reviews.Title: “As expected but very expensive for food and drinks”
Reviews.Author: phadreus
Reviews.Content: This is obviously a great hotel but we felt that 4 drinks for 79 dollars was a bit much given the amount we paid for an pretty good (but not the greatest) room. The best value is the Cafe on the bottom floor - reasonable and very good for breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Weekend on Nob Hill”
Reviews.Author: mikeyyz
Reviews.Content: After a journey up to the top of Hob Hill, you know youâ€™ve arrived somewhere special. We were planning a special weekend to celebrate an anniversary, and after a recent visit to SF where I wasnâ€™t convinced that we should stay in the SoMa and Union Square areas. The Fairmont San Francisco is only a few blocks away, but feels a world apart. The stunning building is a beauty to see, especially lit up at night! Walking into the majestic lobby felt special every time we returned to the hotel â€“ lots of history was made here! There was no line for check-in, and it was friendly and efficient â€“ we were off to our room within minutes. We stayed in the Tower Building, a short walk from the lobby but home to some of the best views in the hotel, as it extends more than 20 floors â€“ much higher than the historic building. If you have the option for a discounted upgrade during booking or check-in, itâ€™s definitely worth it to upgrade to this tower since the views are extraordinary from atop the hill â€“ much better than anything Iâ€™ve experienced at the Westin, W, or St. Regis during previous stays in the city. I used one of my Fairmont upgrade certificates for this stay. The rooms have great bathrooms â€“ we like the new Rose toiletries that Fairmont has switched to. The living areas are traditional and well-furnished - representative of the â€œcasual luxuryâ€� that Fairmont is known for. The bed was extremely comfortable. The fitness centre is well equipped with modern equipment â€“ and a steam and sauna. I would have liked for it to be open past 7pm on the weekends, but we had evening plans anyways! Signing up for free with Fairmontâ€™s Presidents Club program gets you free Internet and the option of getting a reebok gym outfit to use during your stay. We had a great breakfast at Laurel Court on Sunday â€“ it was reasonably priced at $30 and I was happy that they had gluten free options! If you feel like an adventure, go down to Market Street to Dottie's True Blue Cafe - where we went on Saturday. I'd agree that it's the best breakfast in San Francisco, but it's a pretty sketchy area - we were harassed by at least 5 people walking down the street. We arrived by 8am to avoid a 1+ hour wait. The Tongo room in the basement looked like a really unique place to dine â€“ we didnâ€™t get a chance to make it down there. For a special dinner, head 2 blocks away to Keiko a Nob Hill â€“ one of the best meals of my life and very reasonable for the quality of food you will get ($85 for 7 course tasting menu) A lot of people mentioned the parking costs, so I planned to return my rental after dropping off luggage, but Avis nearby didn't allow after-hours rentals. If you have a rental car and arrive too late to return it before the morning, there is garage just one block up California which is $34 for 12 hours. But once you get past 12 hours, almost everything I saw for parking is $50+

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel to host a conference”
Reviews.Author: LanceFan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont SF in late February to attend a conference my company was hosting. We used a fair number of the hotel venues - the Crown Room, the Tonga Room and many meeting rooms. I have to say, of all the conferences I've attended or helped plan, this hotel is at the top of the list. The facilities are gorgeous and the service staff are unbelievably good. Every single request we made was honored quickly by anyone we asked it of. The food was unbelievable too. I didn't mind the walk at al up/down the hill to get to Union Square or even the Moscone. If it's not raining it's a great way to slip in some exercise during an otherwise busy day.

Reviews.Title: “If walls could talk...overall great stay in this historic location in majestic San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: kit628
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for business in March. I did encounter some negatives, as other reviewers pointed out- $65 overnight parking, expensive breakfast/room service, no coffee in room unless you request it. But, I planned for this...requested coffee in the room the first morning after my arrival, didn't order room service or eat the breakfast buffet. We rented a car for one afternoon from enterprise on Mason street just a few blocks away to avoid the $65 overnight parking, and walked to most other places if needed. But what makes this Hotel exceptional is the history, the grandeur, the location perched at the top of Nob Hill, and the Fact that every u.s. president since Harry Truman has stayed there. The service was good from the moment I pulled in. The hotel is away from the hustle and bustle of Union Square, even though you may have to walk up and down the hills to see the surrounding sites. If you have time, meander through the hallways near the Tonga Room where they have old pictures and restaurant menus of the hotel from the 1920s through the 1960s. Don't forget to check out the outdoor garden. Take a morning stroll and get some great pics of the city. We will definitely return, The positives outweigh the small negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Kieiffsst
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of our honeymoon .... What a disappointment. The room was Distinctly average, no free wi fi, no free water, no tea/coffee making facilities. (had to ask a surly receptionist for this) not impressed by the lack of amenities or level of service received. ( a smile doesn't cost much) would visit San fran again but would not stay at the fairmont!!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Luxury is still the best!”
Reviews.Author: s n
Reviews.Content: High up on the hill overlooking San Francisco is this grand dame of San Francisco. This is where "I left my heart..." was first sung. I loved everything about my stay at this hotel and hope you will too.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: thanirs
Reviews.Content: I was here on business last month. I love San Francisco (used to live here few years ago) and this was the first time I stayed here. The hotel is absolutely beautiful. The rooms are decent and quiet. Bed is very comfortable. Did not try any restaurants in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the City”
Reviews.Author: kaycee2117
Reviews.Content: Fairmont SF is a beautiful hotel located on top of a hill. We usually walk around during our vacations and did the same in SF. We walked to the shopping mall, Chinatown and to Fishermans Wharf during our 3 day stay in the city. Be warned it is very hilly so just wear comfy shoes or opt to take the bus/cable car. Hotel has an amazing lobby - everything is very grand. Room was spacious and comfy. Only thing was when we checked in, we walked our room and a vacuum was blocking the entry way. A housekeeper was in there still cleaning up. She told us she was almost done cleaning so we waited in the hallway with our bags for about 5 mins. Not a big deal, but we found it odd that they gave us a room that wasn't ready yet. Not too many restaurants within walking distance, but there is Nob Hill Cafe with very yummy food. good for lunch. Downside is there's no swimming pool/sauna/hot tub located on premise. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and won't mind staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous View!”
Reviews.Author: ljmzta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont to celebrate our 23rd wedding anniversary. I booked a tower suite after reading the room/rate differences thinking that would be best for us. I opted for $25 extra for a higher floor if available at checkin and $20 more for early checkin seeing that we arrived at around 11am. The front desk gentleman and the bell service were very polite and helpful with our needs and questions. We were booked in the Tiburon Suite which was amazing! The room was huge with a corner view of the city, we could see the bay bridge as well as the Golden Gate from the 20th floor. The room came equipped with a telescope so you could read even the street signs far below and plan our route to Chinatown. This view was so wonderful that I never turned on the 2 flat screen TV's, opting to only enjoy the beautiful city instead. The bathroom was nicely appointed in marble and granite. The towels were great, the robes were great, the bed was comfy. Their were 2 air temp control buttons in the room, 1 for the living room and 1 for the bedroom. There was a mini bar which we did not use but no fridge to add our own items. If needed, I'm sure the hotel would have brought us one. We dined in the Laurel Court Restaurant and Bar twice, once for dinner and once for breakfast. The staff was engaging and very polite. The food was very good on both occasions. For breakfast one day I sent my husband to the El Centro cafe for pastries and coffee and it was good also. We used the Hertz service to get a rental car for a day to head out to wine country. I thought the gas rates were crazy, gas costs $1 higher in San Francisco than home but that was not Hertz or the Fairmont's fault of course. They brought the car straight to the hotel garage and we had to return it to a place 6 blocks up the street and catch a taxi back,(don't poke fun of me for not walking 6 streets, it's all up a steep hill!) it's a shame they didn't offer a ride back to the hotel considering what we paid for the rental car ($127 including gas.) Don't park at the hotel because they want $62.50 per night for parking! The lobby and the walls of photos and history were beautiful and interesting. This is one of the nicer places I've stayed (not counting the S. Pacific for obvious reasons). I would definitely recommend it to anyone coming to San Francisco. If you come here, join the club ahead of time, we were granted free wifi and access to the work out facilities though we never used that work out room. Membership is free. We did experience a 4.0 quake while sleeping on the 20th floor at 5:33am. It didn't even wake us. We found out about it by text 30 minutes later from my mother in law.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay at the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: alm0st50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Fairmont Hotel to celebrate a special occasion. We were very disappointed! We had been looking forward to our stay after staying at a lovely Inn in Yountville where the service and food were impeccable. Upon arriving, we had to ask twice for a bellman to help us with our luggage. The check-in clerk was friendly, however, recommended a very touristy restaurant, after we specifically asked for a non-tourist place to celebrate our special occasion. We then asked 2 concierges to help us with restaurant reservations. They were not helpful at all considering this is supposed to be a world class hotel. One was new and had no experience, the other wasn't interested in helping us nor did he seem to know much about SF restaurants. We were shocked at the lack of service provided. We ended up doing everything on our own and even got in to a restaurant that both concierges said we'd never get in. The guest room itself was small, stuffy, and smelled bad. The bathtub had hair in it. We went to the Tonga Bar however, didn't stay. We just wanted to have a glass of champagne and it was too crowded and noisy. Our brunch the next morning for 5 was good and the service at Laurel Court was also good. Upon check-out, the blond European woman was unfriendly and rude and just handed us our recent without smiling or saying anything. Overall, this was a big disappointment and we wouldn't stay here again. The hotel just felt dreary and uncared for. I have been here before and this was nothing as I remembered. Hope they can take care of the problems and bring it back up to it's former standards. It is a great location and used to be the grande old dame of San Francisco. What a pity!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel on the hill”
Reviews.Author: tricdn
Reviews.Content: and boy what a hill it is. No matter where you are coming from getting to the Fairmont is a hike - but that effort is worth it, especially with the views that come from its perch on top of Nob Hill. The hotel is well laid out encompassing the entire block. It has everything you could want in a classic old hotel. In the main building, a beautiful lobby with wonderful staircases, good sized rooms with large closets and in the tower, nice sized rooms with wonderful bathrooms. The hotel also has a very good gym, a great bar in the Tonga Room, a good lobby bar that makes a great Manhattan and very friendly staff. I will say that their convention catering is only mediocre though - but with such good eating in San Francisco there is no reason not to enjoy the good dining that is just around every corner. BTW - if you walk you will never need to use that gym - the hills will give you all the exercise you need

Reviews.Title: “Very historic, warm and charming.”
Reviews.Author: DanTheTravelerFromNC
Reviews.Content: If you like the older, historic charm of San Fransico, then this place is for you. Just a few blocks from the Wharf and China Town, this place has great amenities and provides a great taste of the area. Great food and wine and the service was great. The onsite Hertz counter helped a bunch.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty standard luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigdiddy
Reviews.Content: If you are staying for pleasure i think the hotel is in an excellent spot. For business it is a long walk down the hills to the office buildings. I thought they did everything up to quality standards, but nothing over the top. Just a solid hotel for typical SF prices. Well appointed and tasteful. Clean spacious rooms (mine anyway). Large clean bathrooms. The lobby bar was nice although the tiki room or whatever was closed for an event. The valet did take care of a shoe shine right away when asked. Would definitely visit again for business, not sure i would pay the prices though if traveling for personal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Weekend”
Reviews.Author: travel_nut_1960
Reviews.Content: Normally when I visit SF, I stay with friends. This visit I wanted to spoil myself and splurge on a nice weekend at a grand San Francisco hotel. At 106 year old, The Fairmont is the Grande Dame of San Francisco and was the obvious choice. I wasnâ€™t disappointed! I reserved a main bldg 2 room suite for a 3 day weekend get away, Feb 24-27. I found the rates reasonable for what you got and the location, for a suite I paid $390 + 55 tax per night. The hotel upgraded me to a Tower Suite on the 23rd floor. The views were incredible. No hotel in San Francisco can come close to views from The Fairmont Tower. Period. Views of The Golden Gate, Alcatraz, Coit Tower, The TransAmerica Pyramid, the Bay Bridge and the entire skyline. Sunrises and sunsets are amazing. Each room has a telescope to see the sights. From my suite I could even see what people were drinking at The Top of The Mark. The suite was huge, beautifully decorated with a gorgeous marble bath. Everything in the room was in perfect order. I was able to check in early at noon and check out 2 hours late with no problem. Geoffrey, at the front desk was fantastic. The entire staff was friendly and eager to help. The lobby is incredible and the roof gardens are a sanctuary in the city. Every morning, I ate the breakfast buffet in the Laurel Court Restaurant. The food was very good with a lot of variety. The omelet chef even remembered what I liked after the first day. All my local friends joined me at the hotel for breakfast. At $30, itâ€™s a bargain and convenient. I doubt you could find brunch for less. Plus I never ate lunch because of my big breakfast. I also had room service twice for a late supper; the food was fast and tasty. The cost was no more than going out to eat and so much easier when your tired. I also took advantage of the spa and had a great massage. Itâ€™s nice to spoil yourself. If you havenâ€™t been to SF, it is expensive. Everything is. If you donâ€™t need a car, donâ€™t bring one. Parking is not cheap. However the in/out valet parking at The Fairmont is cheaper than other Nob Hill hotels. The in/out privilege means you wonâ€™t pay extra to actually use your car. You can rent a car for a day trip at the hotel or off Union Square for less than the price to park one. Cabs are generally available and reasonable but they can be hard catch away from the hotel district and slow to come when you call. You can reserved a Town Car though several services (like Quicksilver or Ubercar) for not much more than a cab and you have a guaranteed ride in style. Also get a Munipass so you donâ€™t pay $6 each time you ride the cable cars. You can catch all 3 cable car lines at The Fairmont, the only place in town they all cross. Take the California Cable Car down to the Ferry Building (the view is incredible) to shop and the catch the F line trolley to Fishermanâ€™s Wharf or to the Castro. Location is so important when you travel; The Fairmont is close to everything. The Fairmont is beautiful grand hotel from a different time where the staff takes pride in this grand icon of San Francisco and the privilege of working there. In a nutshell, I had a perfect stay, loved it and canâ€™t wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “This Sad Hotel Misses Everywhere”
Reviews.Author: emily w
Reviews.Content: Well, Ok, the Lobby is supposed to be beautiful, and it is, but when no one opens the door for anyone it's just not that cute anymore. For $359.00 per Nt. Tower Room, I thought there would be more than just a view through my puddied shut window in this room. They are small, and non-ventilated. Our safe did not work, the TV barely worked. 2 small robes in room, but no slippers. The furniture is sold old and nicked up that I was embarressed for this place. Went to the Laurel Court and the atmosphere is dreary and tired and the service and food apathetic. When we called and told them our safe did not work they offered no solution. We asked for 1 hr. late check out and were told "we NEVER give late check out" In an empty hotel.... I must say however if you do come to San Francisco, check out the Tonga Room if nostalgia is your thing...but you don't have to torture yourself by staying here. The checkout is the usual minibar charges for things you didn't have, because you touched the silly cheap refridgerator. Also you have to get your own ice down the hall, like Motel 6. The people who work here seem to be all very unhappy, from the surly maid to the front desk. This is a 3 star hotel, and never should be considered if you care about service, food, and a good nights sleep. It is quite clear this hotel thinks it has to do NOTHING but be perched on top of Nob Hill, What kind of management do they have with such poorly trained and apathetic staff.???

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not great for the $$.”
Reviews.Author: HKaidms
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 2 nights in the tower suites with city facing views. Paid approximately $300 per night NOT including daily parking fee....I'll get to that. Overall it was a pleasant enough stay. The location was great. The lobby was beautiful. My check in was fast and easy. We got there very early and feared we wouldn't be able to check in for a few hours but they let us get our room at 11am. I think this exception was made bc I signed up for the "President Members" program or whatever it's called before my trip (it's free -do it if you are planning on staying at a Fairmont Hotel). My room wasn't as big as I thought it would be but according to seasoned San Fran travelers the Fairmont has some of the bigger rooms in the city. Even so, felt a tad cramped but this wasn't a big deal. Grief #1 - we had dinner reservations in town first night and needed a cab to take us there. Got down to lobby 20 minutes prior to reservation. It took the doorman exactly 20 minutes to get us a cab. A lined approximately 16 people deep formed (and I was close to the front of this line) and the Fairmont staff failed to get additional doormen or staff to assist the mounting line in getting their transportation. For a hotel with this type of service reputation I would assume management would act to triage the situation such as this. Sadly, nothing was fixed and the lone doorman was left fighting to get guests cars from the parking lot, greet arriving and returning guests as well as trying to flag down Taxis all at the same time. Needless to say we were late for our dinner but gladly our reservation was still honored. Grief # 2 - my wife and I went to the Laurel Court bar for a pre dinner drink the second evening. Making sure we didn't make the same mistake as last time, we arrived in the lobby a full hour prior to our dinner reservations. Well, wouldn't you know it took about 15 minutes to even place our drink order. Mind you there were only 5 other patrons in the bar....total. Next, after we got our drinks it took another 20 minutes for our waiter to even check on us. By now we had to get our check. Thankfully the check arrived quickly. I guess they wanted us out of there rather than serve us. I would have had another drink had the waiters cared to check on us. But I guess they were pretty busy chatting to each other behind and around the bar instead. Oh well. Grief # 3 - this one I can't really complain about but I am including it here for your education. It will cost you about $60 per day including taxes. Thankfully I had done my research first but had I not it would be safe to say I would have been a bit upset. This parking fee is a tiny little footnote that is hard to discover when booking a room here at the Fairmont. All in all I would say that while nobody at The Fairmont was mean, quite the contrary actually, I would classify some aspects of the operation as unprofessional. You can have a winning personality and a never ending smile but when you fail to take care of a paying customer it's still unprofessional. My only staff compliment goes to the parking garage attendants who were extremely professional and helpful at every moment. I found myself calling upon them for my car and going straight down to the garage instead of the front because my car was always waiting and they always had great recommendations and were very helpful and prompt. Kudos to whomever manages that part of your hotel operation. Otherwise, I received service overall comparable to a Holiday Inn. Wish I had paid Holiday Inn prices. Im not a traveler who complains about costs otherwise inwould have added Greif # 4 to $80 breakfast pricetag for 2 at Laurel Court restuarant at the Fairmont (i get over it bc it's an "upscale" hotel). But i do expect a certain level of professionalism to accompany the costs rather than just everyone being so nice. But hey, the location is great and apparently the rooms are bigger than most other hotels....so I've been told.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ThatGirl_77627
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at The Fairmont... The hotel was beautiful and everyone was very helpful. We enjoyed the beautiful view from our room and we loved being able to walk the streets of San Francisco. Our room was very clean.. The Tonga room was great, but we didn't like that it took so long to get in and really didn't like that we had to pay for the band since we were staying at the hotel. Our only complaints were the cost for hotel parking -- we had to pay $54 a night, plus 14% gratuity and tax. I felt that was ridiculous. Also, paying gratuity on every meal at the hotel (for just my husband and myself) was a little much. We spent $74 on breakfast buffet for 2. In the future, we will check into things like this before making any decisions on hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel away from the bustle of Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Trojan4Life
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here the weekend before Valentine's Day for a little getaway. I usually stay closer to Union Square but decided to change things up and choose the hotel that Anthony Bourdain stayed and featured on his new show the Layover. The location of the Fairmont Hotel is about 5 blocks from Union Square "up the hill" and about 3 blocks from Chinatown. Checking in was a breeze and the hotel was very elegant. The room was a good size considering it is in San Francisco. There are two main elevators to get to your room and was quick and efficient despite it only holding 10 people per ride. When I made reservations, I was given the option of "early check in" which was an additional $25. This allowed me to check in at 10am rather the regular 3 pm which I would recommend anyone visiting SF to do so. Unfortunately, being that this hotel is quite old and a lanmark, the plumbing seems like it was stuck in the 1920's. The bathroom in our room didn't flush very strongly and efficiently and resulted in it clogging up on our departure date. Nonetheless, I would recommend staying here if its for a special occasion and would like a good work-out walking to and from Union Square and Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “A vacation only 55 miles away”
Reviews.Author: mamakakes
Reviews.Content: Last night we stayed at the Fairmont Hotel in San Francisco. We live in Santa Clara,only 55 miles away,but we didn't want to drink and drive. It was our grandson Allen's 19 birthday and we had reservations at the popular Tonga Room for dinner.What a fun night! In the middle Of the Tonga Room is a pool,in the pool is a boat with a band in it. Every half hour it rains and there is thunder and lightning and you feel you are outside .The band plays great music and you can dance on the dance floor shaped like the deck of a ship. The food was great. Our room on the 19th floor of the Tower had a view of...The Golden Gate Bridge,Alcatraz,Coit Tower,and Trans-American Building.Everyone in the hotel made us feel welcome,well be back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved that I could open my windows, and it was quiet!”
Reviews.Author: SaraFV
Reviews.Content: There were also blocks so i couldnt open them far, I'm sure for safety reasons. My room was clean, although slightly worn rug and furniture. The bed bath linens were clean and in excellent condition. The room was an interior room, so it faced a courtyard, and it was not noisy, which was fabulous. Many locations' reviews had noise complaints. The service and dining, as always at the Fairmonts, was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service really lacking”
Reviews.Author: JLP1989
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were quite excited to stay at the Fairmont San Francisco. We have stayed at Fairmont hotels in Canada and have never been disappointed. However, i must say that the only good thing about this hotel is the lobby. The customer service was very poor in the restaurant and lounge. Our room was cozy, but had no view of anything because it was an inner room. The walls were paper thin - so thin we could hear exact conversations on the other side of the wall. We were especially disappointed that the room had no complimentary water or coffee or tea. When we had coffee in the Laurel Court Lounge we were charged $12 for two lattes and lousy service. I will never stay at this hotel again. Instead, when we head back to San Francisco, we will stay at one if the Hyatt hotels, which never disappoint! I think the Managment of this hotel could learn a thing or two from Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Dan R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best places I have ever stayed in. Service was great, no problems with a request for a late check out and really no problems at all. It is a pricy hotel, but in this case you get what you pay for. If you have a chance, check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Historic and elegant”
Reviews.Author: Creepela
Reviews.Content: I'll admit it, I'm a sucker for Fairmont Hotels. They are always historic sites and the service is superb. This one was no exception. I got a complimentary upgrade to the Bombay Suite. Fantastic. This hotel is classy and classic. Great location, great views. Make sure you join President's Club for free internet service.

Reviews.Title: “nice but old”
Reviews.Author: daya9
Reviews.Content: We were in Fairmont in February 2012 and had a room in the tower with a beautiful view on Alcatraz. We had paid 360 $ just for the room without breakfast. The location was not the best, it is not very central, it is on top of the hill, blocks away from union square. The Lobby is beautiful and was at one moment years back a 5 star hotel, but for the room rate the hotel was a bit old and needed some renovation. The breakfast for 30$ per person was not of a high quality. There is a cafe cintra in the hotel, where you can have better coffees and plain good bagels.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and perfect for san francisco”
Reviews.Author: indiantrotter
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with brilliant location. Nice spacious rooms with big bath area and a walk-in wardrobe! The staff was friendly and the reception is warm. Opt for the tower rooms if booking in advance and register for the Presidents club for complimentary internet access. I would recommend this hotel for business / leisure travellers to San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: BRnurse
Reviews.Content: Great location and accomodations with beautiful view. If your thinking about staying somewhere else because it's cheaper, don't. I'll only stay here in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Stay”
Reviews.Author: Eve26
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont when I travelled to SF for a conference. As noted the hotel is beautiful with a grand lobby and sits atop the famously steep SF hills in Nob Hill. The staff was warm and friedly. I did not have a Tower room due to the cost though I was very tempted as mentioned to the person who made my reservation. You can imagine my delight to learn on check in, that I had been upgraded from an interior room to a room overlooking the garden! This gave me a very lovely, serene view what a pleasure to gaze upon this view as a preared my presentations or relaxeed at the end of the day. The room itself was spacious and comfortable, unfortunately there was no coffee maker in the room and the coffee shop didn't open that early (perhaps 6:30 or so) and was packed as soon as it opened as there wasn't much in the area. On vaction this would not have even been an issue. The small and nicely qpuipped gym did open early. I was thrilled to be able to work out prior to beginning my work day, bewteen that and the hills I felt able to eat all the seafood the fine SF restaurants had to offer!! All of the conference rooms were comfortable and many had great views the views from the Towers were spectacular. The restuarnt and bars were a bit expensive but the high quality service, overall ambience and elegance made it worth a splurge. The hotel was well situated, it is a brisk 15 minute walk from Fisherman's Wharf in one direction and a steeper but shorter walk to downtown in the other. Don't underestimate the hills, by the evening they seem to get steeper. There is a cable car line that runs right by the hotel, which is a plus, if not used to them (like myself) do be careful I am much more used to dodging NYC taxi's and buses ! Overall I had a wonderful stay and highly recommned staying here as long as you are a walker as there is very little within the immeadite hotel area .

Reviews.Title: “As one would expect.....”
Reviews.Author: SandwedgeonRye
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference the night of January 19- outstanding desk staff, outstanding room and a panoramic view of SF from the BofA building to Civic Center. The only issue- the restaurant staff the following morning (several older gentlemen) assumed I'd have the breakfast buffet. When I ordered from the menu they seemed to be put out. Overall a very fine property.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Nob Hill”
Reviews.Author: reesepieces2002
Reviews.Content: My husband and I started our California vacation at the fantastic Fairmont. I am not a huge San Francisco fan because I find the city rather depressing when the weather is lousy (grey and cold in early Sept) and it's rather dirty with a lot of pan handlers, etc. So to return after a day of touring to the gorgeous lobby and peaceful room, was a real treat. I loved the sense of history and grandeur in the hotel. Everyone who worked there had a smile on their face and the service was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: fiona c
Reviews.Content: We loved our time in The Fairmount, we were on our honeymoon and when we checked in the guy behind reception was lovely and upgraded us!!! The view from our room was superb and our bed was huge and comfy. We did not eat in the hotel, but the lobby and overall the whole hotel we thought was lovely and clean. Would love to return to this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Luxury as it should be”
Reviews.Author: davenid
Reviews.Content: Wow, we were impressed with this historic hotel, keeps the history alive. We visited around the Christmas holiday, the hotel and surroundings were decorated with charms and atmosphere, absolutely beautiful. Location was convenient, I walked out and took the cable to most places while my husband went off to work. The bellman service was impeccable. The room was comfortable but a bit small, only because there was a king size bed in a room probably more suited for a queen size bed. Love the over-sized bath room and closet. Could use a little more counter space in the bathroom and definitely have plenty of space for a lady's vanity for make up. After I lay out my make up and day/night cream, using the hair blow dryer became awkward. Interesting thing is they don't have a coffee / tea maker in the room, I supposed they want you to go down to the cafe for stuff like that. Breakfast was wonderful and very expensive, menu was impressive for the vegans and vegetarians alike, only in San Francisco! Love it. Walking up to Nob Hill was something, but then after a great meal in one of the walking distance restaurant, a stroll with your loved one back to the hotel is so worth it. One down side is that the old elevators tend to need more attention than others, may be they were lacking of attendants at holidays time, it took some time to put it back to working order. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!!”
Reviews.Author: msfunk
Reviews.Content: I was in town for the football game and stayed at this beautiful hotel for a couple of days. Situated at the top of a hill and right next a trolley car route made this hotel not only attractive but convenient as well. Just head down the hill and you're at Union Square for shopping and dining. Our room was on a high floor in the new tower. We didn't have a view of the Golden Gate Bridge but it was nice just the same. The room was spacious and the bed was heavenly. The bathroom amenities were very nice and a great size too. Everything was clean and well cared for. The lobby was spectacular to say the least. The coffee shop was really good but far from the lobby. The Tonga Room Restaurant was closed so I didn't get to check it out. I heard it was pretty neat to see with a live band over the water! Overall this hotel is classic elegance. I fell in love with it the moment I walked into the ornate lobby. I will definately visit again!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful lobby but very thin walls- too noisy!”
Reviews.Author: ArtnLaura
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very expensive usually but we got a deal so decided to splurge. It is located on Nobb Hill, near all the action of down town shopping and great for walking most places if you like hiking (hills are steep and hard on knees). That being said, we were disappointed in the stay mostly because the walls were so thin that we heard music and talking in the room next door as well as talking in the hall all hours of the night, and sirens driving by the window in the am hours. For such a top rated (by trip advisor) hotel we expected better! Bedding was very nice except maids did not change sheets and we stayed for 3 days! We ate at the famed Tango Room for $100 plus dollars for 2 and didnt think that was anything special either.

Reviews.Title: “FIVE STAR”
Reviews.Author: Victoriaangel1
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels in San Francisco. The service was unbelievable! What ever you want! If they don't have it.. They will get it! They aim to please. Loved staying here. Balcony rooms are beautiful and spacious!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, expensive..”
Reviews.Author: popskunk
Reviews.Content: Lovely property, impressive lobby, great location...yes, but....service is better in a motel 6. This is a premiuim hotel and therefore you are willing to spend the bucks on it, but in return, you expect attention, courtesy and an illusional feeling youÂ´re better than home during your stay. This does not happen. Not a smile, not a single time the door was opened for me (I know I can do it for myself but itÂ´s the "good morning" and the smile that comes with it is what I miss). If you pay for a premiuim price, I expect premium service and not cold food that comes in when I order room service. I write this review because I have a fair point of view on rating this hotel, because one week before I stayed in the Seatlle Fairmont: Same chain, different attitude, different rates, different service. Hope it helps you, because I am not returning to this location.

Reviews.Title: “Historic property with great ambience”
Reviews.Author: anamcara1004
Reviews.Content: If you don't say, "Ooh!" then you first walk into the lobby, I would be very surprised. Very lush and opulent - I felt like I should have had a corset & a hat with a large plume. The service was tremendous and my room was quite lovely. Spacious with enough room to work. I slept pretty well too. I think the main things to keep in mind with The Fairmont is that the views are unparalleled being that it is at the top of Nob Hill. And that you better be in pretty good shape if you don't want to take a taxi everywhere. I walked up and down Nob Hill, am in average shape and both were strenuous. Down strenuous to not fall over; up b/c it has to be close to a 45 degree angle. I had to take short breaks after every two blocks going up (on the steepest sections). That being said, there are always taxis around. I didn't try any of the in-house dining or spa, unfortunately so I can't speak to those. But overall, I had a very nice visit and I'd love to stay there again and try more of the in-house amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, lives up to the 'Snob Hill' jibes”
Reviews.Author: C G
Reviews.Content: The 5th and final hotel on a 2-week California roadtrip. Meant to be a luxurious end to our stay, but it was the biggest disappointment of the trip. Not outright bad, just a big disappointment. Firstly, we were greeted by a very rude valet parker. I prefer to self-park, not just a cost thing, but I still have all my faculties, so am capable of parking my car myself, plus I prefer the convenience of self-parking - come and go as you please. At the Fairmont, it's valet parking only, at the cost of $62 per day (the most expensive in the neighbourhood). At least they don't charge extra for the greeting we received from the valet - the rudeness comes for free! When we checked in, they didn't have the room we expected. When we had booked 6 months earlier and enquired about a family room, we were told to book a twin, which would have 2 queen beds, so would be OK if our 2 daughters were happy to share a queen bed. When we arrived, the receptionist said that not all twins had 2 queens, some had much narrower beds and this was all they could offer us. We requested a more suitable room, but we waited so long with no word that we gave up and headed out to explore Union Square (we only had limited time in San Francisco). By the time we came back that evening, it was too late to move rooms, so we accepted the solution of a rollaway bed for one of our daughters and stayed in the same room. Big mistake, as the guy in the adjoining room kept us up all night. The following morning, I spoke to the old guy at the concierge desk (reception was busy with checkouts), who promised to sort things out while we were out sightseeing - by arranging another room and/or speaking to the noisy neighbour - but when we returned that evening, nothing had happened, the front desk was completely unaware of our complaint. We persuaded them to arrange another room for us but, when we walked in to the room, there was a lady already there, just beginning to unpack her luggage! So back to square one. Throughout this, the front desk manager was determined not to give us a room that was in any way better than what we already had, which was why our options were so limited. It was only when I started to cause a scene - as my frustrations finally boiled over - that she at last found us a suitable room, this time in the tower. The room was ba lot smaller than our previous room, but much less tired, with 2 queen beds and with no noisy neighbours. So after more than a day of frustration, we at last had the level of room we thought we'd booked. At this point, the front desk manager suddenly became friendly and offered us something by way of apology, such as a bottle of wine. This wasn't really our priority, but she told us to think about it and let her know. The next day, we returned from our Alcatraz trip (and climb up Nob Hill) in need of refreshment. Therefore, instead of an expensive bottle of wine, we just asked reception for a pot of tea and a couple of cookies for our daughters. The manager from the previous day was not around and had not told her colleagues about the offer of apology, so the guy on the front desk was reluctant to help us. When he did eventually agree to send a pot of tea to our room, it took over an hour, because he forgot to tell the room service people. So any goodwill that this small gesture of apology should have generated was lost. We have stayed at many 5-star hotels and the staff usually make us feel like kings. Here, they made us feel like dirt, so we began to understand the 'Snob Hill' jokes of the tour guides. None of our complaints were treated seriously until I lost my cool, and I shouldn't have to do that on holiday. Nothing was ever passed from one member of staff to another, the communication was just dreadful. I would recommend sending the staff to some of the top Asian hotels, then they would really know the meaning of customer service. Now for the positives: (i) great location, if you like walking, it's 30 minutes to Fisherman's Wharf (at least with children), around 15 minutes to Union Square and convenient for the Hyde-Powell cable car; (ii) great views if you're in the right rooms; (iii) tower rooms a bit newer than the older wing; (iv) even if the rest of the hotel is tired, the lobby is very nice, especially at Christmas time.

Reviews.Title: “nice surroundings but annoying fan system”
Reviews.Author: KarlOA
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Calcuta suite - beautiful but the noise from the internal fan system was extremely annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful stay in a suite”
Reviews.Author: TravelingWren
Reviews.Content: We had the two bedroom Sutro Suite for a celebration of two birthdays - mother and son - 80 and 60. The view was spectacular, we could see all three bridges and we figured we were seeing at least a 270 degree view from all the rooms together. It came with a formal dining table for 4 which worked so well for room service breakfast which was included - and we liked it so well we ate lunch there too. This suite has two bedrooms and two baths, separated by a small foyer - very good privacy - it locks off from the hallway and all doors can be keyed alike. Expensive but worth it for a celebration!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, friendly people.”
Reviews.Author: Sators
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are very friendly and welcoming. The rooms and accommodations are top notch and simply makes this hotel a worry free relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a View!”
Reviews.Author: chalessa
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel. I didn't know what to expect when I booked an over night stay in the city. Walking into through revolving door was like something out of a movie set! The furniture in the lobby was beautifully arranged and the decor is fabulous. I was greated several times before getting to the front desk to get my room key for the 24th floor. Loved the it had a second bank of elevators and even the view from the hallway was fab! The room was almost royal, with plush bedding and a large window view of the San Fran skyline. Though the price point is a bit expensive (it got a Groupon deal), it is trully worth the stay. I also found out that the Bachelor filmed one of its episodes there!

Reviews.Title: “All of the luxury you would expect at a 5 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KiwiExplorer87
Reviews.Content: Great service, great food, brilliant xmas decorations and perfect location in the heart of a beautiful city. Couldn't fault a thing, enjoyed the gym etc

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mahdishams
Reviews.Content: Well located in at the top of Nob Hill, the hotel offers one of the most impressive lobbies I have ever seen, a truly piece of art and design. The rooms are well maintained and clean, no state of the art amenities but it does the trick. I would recommend staying there on a romantic getaway of sorts, since the ambiance is well geared towards that. The food at the restaurant is very well done but a bit pricey for what it is. The service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: HobokenGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: On a recent November stay at the Fairmont we were upgraded to the Crocker Suite. Wow! The living room was spacious, elegant and very comfortable with phenomenal views of Alcatraz and the bay; the vintage-looking telescope was a fun touch; you could zoom in on the boats on the bay. The bedroom was nicely put together in tranquil colors with a huge picture window, king bed, all the necessary amenities and plenty of closet space. The only â€“ minor â€“ downside was the bathroom. It was very large but it lacked vanity and counter space so it was a little awkward for two people to share. We set up the ironing board at one end of the bathroom and used that to store some of our things. Service at the Fairmont was excellent. The lobby lounge bar was a nice place to meet friends for a drink and the Tonga Room was a hoot with funky tropical dÃ©cor and a rainstorm. The terrace on the lobby level is a lovely oasis in the city. If you can handle the hills, the location is great for walkers otherwise the cable car or a taxi will get you up and down the hill. All in all a great choice in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury. Good location, great views. Definately you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Boysalsa
Reviews.Content: Right at the top of the hill, but only a few blocks from Union Square and great shopping. The rooms were great with the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Bathrooms included separate shower and bath. Room had a desk and amazing view if the city. Staff were great and helpful. I was there as part of a conference and the food we had was very good even when catering for a lot of people. If you are staying there, it's worth getting a travel pass for the trolly's as it's a steep walk from union square, but a great location to explore from. The Tonga Room is a must visit with great entertainments and drinks, even if our not staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: ggke
Reviews.Content: As expected, a good location to walk down to Union Square, or take any cable car. The main building is a bit dated, but the tower is a bit newer. Our family of four with two young daughters stayed four nights. The downside is that there is no pool. Also, parking is a bit pricey, so we returned the rental car and took taxis when necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Time For a Reboot”
Reviews.Author: sbajb
Reviews.Content: Growing up in the City, the Fairmont was the Grand Dame of hotels. My family threw many large receptions there. My Grandmother thought it was the "it" place. Weddings, Anniversary---Birthdays- Over the years we have had occasions to reserve hotel rooms there, and quite frankly recently I have always walked away disappointed. It used to be that nostalgia was a key component of the experience. The Tonga Room, and Hurricane drinks, Blums in the lobby, the doorman, The Laurel Court, The hair salon in the lobbyâ€¦A poodle here and there. Fairmont, Iâ€™d love to see you go back to the grandeur and concentrate less on "Facebook, and Twitter."

Reviews.Title: “Chilly San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Canada209
Reviews.Content: We traveled in august to San Francisco and were greeted by very chilly weather with strong wind and foggy days. It did clear out eventually and we enjoyed the city but we really loved this hotel. It is one of the most beautiful hotels we ever stayed in and true to the old fashioned Fairmont style. The lobby is magnificent, the rooms are beautiful and the view of the harbor breathtaking. We had the buffet breakfast in the morning, which was lovely but expensive. All in all we loved the hotel and it's location. We would not hesitate to come back and love the whole Fairmont chain. All the hotels we stayed in are worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “An 'old dame' still holding up atop Nob Hill”
Reviews.Author: RKT163
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights there recently over the New Year into 2012, with room assigned in the original (old) wing and glad I was there. High ceiling and extra wide hallway for sense of space and originality apart from today's contemporary but often squeezed hotel layout. Spacious 'double double' room with deep, rectangular walk-in closet 'room' for your luggage and hangers good for a year's clothing! On 5th floor yet literally overlooking Nob Hill. Very efficient, good and friendly (not because they were pretentious) FO / Concierge staff service . However, beware of the electronically controlled minibar and the 'extras' placed in a e-controlled tray next to the TV. It is neither kid-friendly nor adult-frinedly in sense that kids attracted to that or accidentally knocking off items sitting in that tray will end up having parents paying for it and will for sure get a lecture or penalty of sorts from the paying parents - once item is off from the tray base for minutes, the item charge will automatically be billed to the room even if you put it back later on (after x no. of minutes nothing will help reverse that not unless you reason with and prove it to the front desk that the original package still exists intact). I asked HSKP to remove that tray without success / action response. Vanity counter far too small for a luxury hotel. Could not have renovated to include a separate shower. Bedding into wobbling state as apparently far too many heavyweights have been sleeping in those beds over the years without hope of a replacement mattress. Like many hotels in the U.S. but particularly those in SF and LA, they appear to be either ignorant or "couldn't-care-less" about Asian travelers / customers as nothing in this hotel or similar class reflect any measure of thought to Asian guests needs especially the menus anywhere in the hotel. Otherwise, a comfortable experience in a great location though one must be prepared to walk some steep slopes up and/or down for those mere few blocks to the city centre core where a world of fascinating shopping, dine-outs and attractions await!!

Reviews.Title: “Beuatiful building but rooms need a little work”
Reviews.Author: Adam C
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful old building with great views from the high floors that face externally. My room was nice but had that smell that old places do sometimes. Also, the toilet seat in my room looked like it was 100 years old (peeling, scratches, discoloration). I would have expected better from a Fairmont. When I called to complain, the person on the phone seemed sort of put out and never apologized. It was replaced the same day though. Otherwise, the service in the hotel was very good.

Reviews.Title: “A great pre-holiday stay”
Reviews.Author: texaslisa
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. It was totally decked out for the holidays. Lights, flowers, trees, you name it. Valet is so fast and efficient here. Bell hop had our luggage in our room before we could get there! The rooms are outstanding. Bright marble bathroom. We had a great view overlooking the bay. I could sleep all day long in their beds! Just a great place to walk the city streets and wrap up our 6 day wine country vacation.

Reviews.Title: “another great experience at the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: bubuNewyork
Reviews.Content: My family loves the Fairmont hotels. We stayed in their hotels in Banff, Bermuda and now SF. In SF we stayed 3 nights over Thanksgiving break. It is one of the few hotels that gives you connecting rooms (not 100% guarantee but 99%), which for us is a must because we have 2 children under 11. This time it didn't work out that well the first night... BUT to their credit, starting the 2nd night and for the rest of our stay, they upgraded us into a suite for free. That is a great customer service! The location is very central, service and breakfast are very good, the view from the rooms is fantastic. I also love the "old style" interior decoration. Their restaurant tonga has great food and is very kids friendly (decor, service & music)

Reviews.Title: “Classic Fairmont, location not that good”
Reviews.Author: MrSharma
Reviews.Content: - Stayed for 14 nights - Good, clean room - Good view of the bay from the room - Located somewhat away from Union Square, Market Street - Close to Chinatown (walkable, though it's a climb back) - Free WiFi with a membership of the Fairmont President's Club

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont San Francisco - Fabulous in everyway”
Reviews.Author: Juanita46
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at The Fairmont San Francisco this past November. What a beautiful place to stay, with great service from everyone. This hotel is situated on top of a hill, that is no surprise as San Fran is full of "top of the hill" views. They were building their gingerbread house during our stay-amazing. The grand staircase was stunning. Rooms are spacious and very clean. Concierge staff went beyond what was expected of them. China Town, Union Square, great shopping, North Beach restaurants are all within walking distance. Would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to San Francisco. Most enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont is, once again, the Grande Dame of SF hotels”
Reviews.Author: MsEllsworth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Hotel the weekend of New Year's, and it was a treat. The hotel has had a makeover since our last stay, and it was decorated beautifully for the holidays. It just felt special, from the walk-through gingerbread house and giant Christmas tree in the opulent lobby area, to the very comfortable (and nicely appointed) rooms. The TV was a bit wonky, as it was hard to change channels without going through a whole process, but that was a minor irritation. The air conditioner wasn't working very well (not much air circulation, etc), but it was remedied quickly after we called for assistance. Some advice: join the Fairmont President's Club, as there are nice perks (free internet service, free use of the Club One workout facility on site, etc). The location at the top of Nob Hill is perfect, as we either walked or took the cable car to Chinatown, Union Square, Ghirardelli Square, the Embarcadero (where the fireworks were displayed, although we actually watched from a terrace area at the hotel...). The downside is a problem at all SF hotels ~ many added fees and taxes, and the parking is expensive. All in all, we were glad that we decided to return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Charm”
Reviews.Author: richterradical
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed with another couple at the Fairmont for NYE 2012. The hotel had everything you could ask for with the service to match. Black tie to casual jeans cruising the lobby and shops. We stayed in the balcony suite which was fantastic and really made our trip. They put our friends next to us essentially turning our room into a 2 bedroom suite. the balcony is huge with incredible city views and staying in was almost as desirable as going out. Tried Tonga Room but it was too busy and they are reservation sticklers, not too into that place. If with your parents or family it's a great, lively diner. If with friends, head out to the city and soak it up.The old rooms were part of the charm.

Reviews.Title: “Good views and old world charm!”
Reviews.Author: Maverick013
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Fairmont for 3 nights on 3 week summer trip in the states. When looking at the Hotels I found it very difficult to choose in San Fran, so I went with the Fairmont for the views as it was my wife's birthday that weekend and cannot go wrong with a good view for a special occasion. Well the good views of the bay are specific to the room you choose, (see room recommendation) I would recommend this Tower signature suite as it is a good size and had a fabulous bay view. Things to consider with the Fairmont are that is not ultra luxurious in terms of modern terms but is more of a grand dame, and has lots old world charm. I have read that some people say the large hallways are spooky but I think it gives the hotel all it's charm and if you realise this at the time of booking you cannot go wrong with this hotel. Housekeeping was great noticed no problems during our stay. We valet parked our car which is expensive at $50 a day but that is consistent with other hotels in San Fran, that said the valet staff were excellent and very helpful. We were still on UK time zones so I did coffee runs each morning to the onsite illy coffee store which is great and very convenient. Is located on on a very steep hill which is very pleasant to walk down but going up could be a problem for some. Has a tram stop right outside the coffee shop at the one corner of the building which is very convenient and should negate the need to walk up the hill as the trams are really great. Book here if you are looking to be removed from the hustle, also if you are are not on tight touring deadlines. Also do not expect all the new bells and whistles expected newer 5-4 star hotels. Join Fairmont programme for free wifi and possible upgrades. I will be returning soon already booked for June 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, VERY CLEAN, STAFF VERY HELPFUL CLOSE TO CHINA TOWN UNION SQUARE,”
Reviews.Author: iritb
Reviews.Content: Best location, very clean, staff very helpful, booked trips with them, concierge is great, close to China town, union square, and shopping, rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place Ever”
Reviews.Author: Itouch2
Reviews.Content: I love the Farirmont hotel. It is so pretty at Christmas time or anytime but it was amazing. They had a real gingerbread house that you could go inside. It was amazing. If you go to San Francisco stay at the Farirmont hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel...treated like royalty!”
Reviews.Author: traveljack1
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for NYE 2010 and had a wonderful time. We were exhausted upon our arrival due to the time change from EST to Pacific. We arrived during the late morning for check in and as President Club members we were treated like royalty. The bellman had already moved our bags to our room and suggested we stop at the concierge desk to find a place for dim-sum as we were starving. We stopped at the room to change clothes and left for dim-sum. I cant remember the name of the restaurant, but left stuffed to the gills and very impressed by the outta the way place that did offer dimsum and drinks right on the edge of Chinatown. As a matter of fact the Concierge(the very experienced one with the gold keys) was phenomenal. He was never short on great suggestions for dimsum, french pastries early in the morning or just an umbrella for my long walk through to Pacific Heights! The hotel was still decked out from the Christmas week with the Gingerbread house and entrance to the restaurant was gorgeous as was the rest of the hotel. Additionally, and even more fun was watching the house staff deconstruct the candy and cookie house on New Years Day! It was akin to watching construction and heavy equipment. Just chilled in the lobby and that was nice for quite a while. We also decided to be treated like queens on New Years Day and decided to get room service. The service was great and the food was too! Room walls were surprisingly thin so we got an earful of someone elses romantic evening, but otherwise hotel is gorgeously decked out for the holidays and as Presidents club members they rolled out the red carpet! Would stay again as room was spacious, comfortable, and with a great view at the top of the hill of the bay and the GG bridge. thanks SF Fairmont!

Reviews.Title: “A Christmas treat”
Reviews.Author: KingsMountaineer
Reviews.Content: We came for one night after seeing the Messiah at nearby Grace Cathedral. The lobby was beautifully decked out for Xmas with a huge, two story gingerbread house, a glorious (though fake) tree, and nice lights over the reception area. It had a lovely holiday feel. The halls were decorated with pictures of celebrities who had stayed at the Fairmont--they were fun to look at although a bit reminiscent of The Shining. We were placed in a room on the 18th floor that was large, comfy and clean. On the down side, the bar service was slow and we were also disappointed that there was no bar food available after 10:00 when the concert was over. We were fortunate to have had spectacular sunrises and sunsets that made the room particularly romantic--I guess the Fairmont can't promise that to all customers.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be a bit more customer sensitive”
Reviews.Author: Damichan
Reviews.Content: I just don't get hotels like this. We were a party of five and arrived after a flight from DC at 11.15. We were informed that the bar had closed and that if we wanted a beer we had to use our mini bars in the rooms. We were told there was a bar open three blocks away. The barman was still there but simply refused to serve us. Eventually we managed to get someone to serve us as a group in the lobby on room service. The rooms did not have any coffee making facilities. In my world, a hotel of this assumed international calibre serves its customer needs by keeping the bar open for their use and by providing coffee making facilities. What is even more galling is that they were very proud of a huge gingerbread Xmas decoration, the cost of which could have probably paid for the additional wages for the barman for a year.

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont is spectacular.”
Reviews.Author: GinnyN417
Reviews.Content: Staying or visiting the Fairmont Hotel in December is a MUST. The Fairmont is located at the top of Nob Hill across the street from the Mark Hopkins (the Top of the Mark is there). The Fairmont has decorated their lobby with the most enormous and beautiful tree, the sweeping staircase is gorgeous with holiday decorations and the gingerbread house is life size. There is also a children's area where they can write and leave a letter for Santa. There is a wonderful Tiki Lounge with great food that is downstairs and you may not even realize it is there. The gift shop also has lovely jewelry at very reasonable prices. The staff is attentive and friendly, and I got a terrific rate online, so check for deals. The staff made sure I got a room with a view even though the rate was so reasonable. I noticed that my bill included a charge for an $8.50 bottle of water and after several calls, they explained that the sensor in the refrigerator is sensitive and if anything moves off of it, it goes on your bill and they gave me a credit. So, just a heads up. Also, Grace Cathedral is 1 block down and it is also a "must" on your trip to San Francisco. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel.....convenient yet quiet.”
Reviews.Author: MrLuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: Although I'd lived in the SF Bay area for many years before, this was the first time I'd actually stayed downtown for more than a day; 3 nights at the Fairmont. I'd done a great deal of reading up on the different hotels downtown that would be convenient for me to get around, yet quiet enough to get some sleep at night. I'd read many other reviews about guests being woken up or kept awake in the middle of night due to the homeless yelling, people partying and getting drunk, traffic, etc. which got me a bit worried. Not so at the Fairmont! Nob Hill is a beautiful area and the Fairmont is a large and very grand old historical landmark hotel. What amazed me during my nights there was the total silence....I truly slept like a baby!....I'd also add that the incredibly comfortable beds, sheets, and pillows made it doubly wonderful! I stayed in a Tower room can say that they keep the place very clean and well maintained. I never had time to check out the gym, but I heard it was off site, which is a bit of a negative for me. I don't think there's a pool either. What I liked is it's location....far enough from the hustle and bustle, but close enough to walk to Union Sq. or Chinatown. I actually enjoyed the walk, but trekking back up the pretty steep hill may be a bit of an exercise for some. Then again, the trolley is right outside and there are plenty of cabs waiting, so it's very convenient. Talking about the trolley....this may be the first thing you hear in the early morning that may wake you up, but it's not that bad. Be careful of the little cafe (Cento?) located on the Powell St. side of the hotel. Yummy pastries, teas, and coffees.....thank goodness for the steep hills you can work it all off later! Since this was my first hotel I'd ever stayed at in the downtown SF area, I can't say that I'll be back right away as I'd like to try others too, but it's definitely on my KIV list.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an update”
Reviews.Author: Lauren502
Reviews.Content: The lobby area of the hotel was nice, but that's where it ends. My room was small and I am pretty convinced it used to be some type of storage closet. When I went in other rooms of the exact same type, they were much larger than the one I was given. The TV was all the way to the left of the room and not even close to being in front of the bed. The decor was dated and dark. The shower was so powerful that half of the water ended up all over the bathroom floor. I've never seen anything like that. Lastly, the ballroom we were working in must have been next to all of the garbage for the entire hotel because it smelled like trash in there. The Tonga Room in the basement is a site to see. It is cheesy, but really neat. Also, we had a chance to go up to the penthouse. It was amazing and the views were spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: 298Lolita
Reviews.Content: I have always loved the Fairmont during Christmas time .I have been going here since I was a kid.so for a rare overnight getaway from the kids we of choose the Fairmont. We came on a weekday and the crowd was perfect and not too busy. As always the lobby was decorated beautifully.The gingerbread house and the traditional huge Christmas tree were spectacular.
