Upon check in we decided to get an upgrade for a room w/a view .The total came to almost $550 w/tax. The room was spacious,bathroom had a beautiful tub and the panoramic view was to die for. Just a couple problems.. We did notice that an electrical outlet cover was broken and half of the plastic was missing. Just a little eyesore and so simple to replace but no big deal. We then opened up the refrigerator/honor bar and noticed that the previous guest had left behind some half eaten fruit in a ziplock bag (which was stuffed on top of the canned nuts) not very appetizing to say the least. There was also crumbs left inside the cabinet. On our way down to dinner we let the receptionist know and she apologized and said it would be cleaned immediately. Ok great . We returned several hours later after having wonderful dinner downtown Our room at night was lit up by the beautiful city. lights and was truly breathtaking. My husband once again decided to go in the honor bar there it was ...the old bag of fruit. Yuk! housekeeping never came to dispose of it.I understand housekeeping can miss something but to not fix the problem is not acceptable. Did housekeeping even get the call from the front desk?? They never did come to clean it up and after complaining again at check out we were told sorry again . A little too late .I sent off a note to the management and have yet to hear back. I expect a little more from The Fairmont. To walk into my room and for the room to be clean and if there's a problem I expect to have it addressed.Too bad our memory of that beautiful room w/a view is clouded by the memory of the rotting leftover fruit in the fridge.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco at its best”
Reviews.Author: chuck s
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 days on business. Housekeeping was excellent. Wish I could speak spanish. Hotel is well kept. Clean. Well located for downtown business. Restaurants are fast. Good hotel. I will return. I love the pictures and old style interior

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: LB879
Reviews.Content: Always.i come here every six moths and always the bets experience, so far. One only complain. Room 552 has the bathroom which is really cold!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room!”
Reviews.Author: ocean35
Reviews.Content: Excellent! Stayed here two nights for work. Fantastic lobby, nicely decorated for Christmas. Corner room on the 16 floor with view of the bay. President's club members get treated nicely. Very nice Fairmont quality bathroom with separate shower. Did not eat here at all, so can't comment on that. It's a hike to Union square, but doable and fun at night after a day of long meetings. Like always, the missing coffeemaker is the only let down.

Reviews.Title: “LAST PORT OF CALL ON WORLD TOUR.”
Reviews.Author: Burton595
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as our last port of call on our world tour and we were not dissapointed. Lovely grand approach to the reception, especially impressive this time of year with Christmas decorations.Good rooms in old part of hotel, although restaurant did lack some atmosphere. Staff a little distant, did not expect that of America. Location of hotel not for the faint hearted if walking is a problem, its at the top of Nobb Hill which is very steep!, you have to rely on Cable Car or Taxi, excellent views. Food and drink expensive, especially in rooms. Good all round hotel for short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not my kind of hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lovecraft
Reviews.Content: I admit that 3 stars is only my opinion, for other people probably might be better. I've booked this hotel as part of a package (flight + hotel) from British Airways. First of all, location is not the best unless you have a car or use a lot of taxis. It's an elegant area, and yes, it's at walking distance from Union Square, and even The Embarcadero, but once you add the hills, it's not that easy, going up is almost impossible. The building is magnificent, and the lobby is greatly and classically decorated, maybe a bit too much for me, I prefer a more modern and minimalist approach. The corridors are seemed a bit creepy to me, so high and wide, dimly lighted and almost always deserted. Our room was on the third floor, facing the front of the building. Too noisy at the early evenings, with all the traffic and the whistling. We arrived around 7pm and we were desperate to have some rest after a 10 hours flight and 8 hours difference from London (it was like 1am to us), which proved difficult with all that noise. No double glazing on the windows. The room was big, but poorly decorated in my opinion, the high ceiling and the wallpaper colour plus the old-style furniture, gave a old, depressing tone. There was also a big closet including safe and iron, that was a plus. The bathroom was also big, with a smallish tub, but the shower system was kid of weird, and not in the best state. Water took a long time to drain, and the tub would be partially filled while showering. Water pressure and temperature was excellent. I found an old towel and some hairs right next to the tub. Another problem was noise coming from the bathroom next door, we could hear the toilet or the shower as if we were there, and that is really annoying if your neighbour takes a shower at 6am. In room wireless internet was fast and reliable, and free if you are a member of their club, so I recommend everyone to enroll before staying so you can have internet access for free. Even though we hadn't much contact with staff (check-in and out was a breeze), they were very attentive and friendly, although when we asked for an extra blanket we had to wait for about an hour for it. As I said, not my type of hotel, probably I would have liked the tower (which is a modern building) much more, for people looking for very classic, old-fashioned property, it might be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: teinegirl
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is wonderful. The lobby was absolutely beautiful with all the Christmas decorations. Checking in was a breeze and even though we checked in early, our room was ready. Our room was in the tower and very spacious. We stayed here five years ago and if anything, it has gotten better. The service throughout is top notch. The breakfast was so good that we ate there every morning. That is really something for me as I usually just have coffee and maybe some cereal. The Fairmont made our three-day stay a pleasure. By the way, they are dog friendly. I'll remember that on our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: iscreenwriter
Reviews.Content: Opened an SF branch for my business and chose to make this hotel my home. Great lobby, gift shop is perfect for last minute items. Rooms are nice and beds are very comfortable. Not to mention best views in the city! Can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Home in SF”
Reviews.Author: Murphntuck
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Gift shop and great lobby. Best view in the city

Reviews.Title: “Landmark hotel but incredibly expensive!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler526
Reviews.Content: I was here for work in January, and though it's probably one of the most beautiful hotels I've ever stayed in everything was so expensive including internet ($14/day), bottled water ($7) and the restaurant was overpriced too (croque monsieur was also incredibly salty). Luckily, I was able to get a government rate so it wasn't as expensive, but probably wouldn't have stayed here otherwise. Lots of history in this hotel hotel though and everyone has stayed here from Prince Charles to James Brown--I would definitely recommend taking a stroll down their Hallway of History.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alohacraig
Reviews.Content: I stay at this legendary hotel at least once a year. This is my favorite hotel in SF. Nob Hill location great suites and a outstanding sfaff. Make sure you you have the Pancakes Oscar in the morning.... They are the best....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and a real San Francisco landmark”
Reviews.Author: TheAviatorUk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont for a business meeting in November 2011. When in San Francisco previously I have usually stayed at one of the Fisherman's Wharf hotels but decided on this occasion to try something different. The first thing that hits you is the lobby- extremely grand. Check in was fast, friendly and efficient. My room was huge - on the corner of the 3rd floor with views out on two sides, towards the Bay and the city. It had two king sized beds, a walk-in wardrobe bigger than some hotel rooms I've stayed in and was spotlessly clean. Even better, it had an iron / ironing board (a personal gripe of mine is when hotels refuse to lend you one for "safety reasons" but will happily rip you off for ironing). When wanting to book a restaurant via the concierge, the guy at check- in spotted I'd been waiting for a while, called me over and did it himself. Great service. Overall, I'd highly recommend this hotel when staying in San Fran, but be prepared for a fair walk down what felt like a vertical street to get to the city centre....

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tatyana Z
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel three nights in the end of August. We drove to SF from San Diego, so it had been a long trip and Fairmont was our final destination. Before coming to the hotel, we dropped a rental car at the SF airport and took a cab to the hotel. When we arrived and got out of the car, we were told byb the concierge that he will get our bags from the cab and would bring them to our room. In half an hour or so the concierge brought our bags, and half an hour later I noticed that two bags were missing. One bag had our evening outfits (dress, suit, shirts, etc), and the other bag had all toileteries. We immediately ran downstairs and informed the concierge that we were missing two bags and he said that they will need to watch a video tape to find out what cab company we used and to identify a cab. We sat in the lobby for an hour hoping that they will find our bags, but noone came to us. We asked a for a manager, but he was unaware of our situation, so we had to repeat what happened. Each time we asked about a status of our lost bags, they were not aware, as if Fairmont staff doesn't communicate to each other. It was already late evening, no bags, we were tired, and the hotel staff didn't even offer us ANY toiletries - we had no tooth brush, no tooth paste, soaps, flosses, perfumes - all was gone. Only after I approached a concierge (1000's time) and almost broke in tears he brought some toothbrushes and toothpastes. Whatever... Note: NOONE yet apologized to us, nor anyone was updating us of their search results. The next morning we had a planned trip to Alcatraz - imagine that we were in a terrible mood. By that time we already told the staff approximate name of the cab that brought us, but they kept telling us that they were investigating. Apparenttly, the video tape was blurry so they could not see clearly the cab number (what is the purpose of such video tape then??). However, at least they could see how many pieces of luggage were taken out of the cab trunk - which proved that we weren't lying. But their favorite version was that we forgot the bags in a rental car. I clearly remebered checking that we didn;t leave anything behind when we dropped a car in the airport. We tried to reach that cab company but without success, as it was just hard to find a person to talk to at the cab company. In the early afternoon we didn't hear back from them yet (!!) and my husband called and insisted on speaking with a head of Fairmont security. He told him about everything (again). Security guy said that he would look into it. When we came back into the hotel - around 2-3 pm, noone told us anything again, I bumbed into a concierge who left our bags in the cab - not even a sight of apology - "I understand mam...We are doing doing everythiong we can...". Happy end: when I finally decided to go shopping for a dress, because we were going to a wedding next day, and got in a cab, I got a phone call from security informing me that they found these bags. When I picked them up I was told that a cab brought them back (apparently hotel had nothing to do with finding these bags). I was sooo happy to get my staff back that I didn't even say anything, but later we realized that NOONE apologized or offered anything complimentary (at least a free drink - as a token of apology) to us. NEVER again I would stay in this hotel. If anything like this happens, you feel humuliated because you almost have to beg for their attention, everything is "high road". I understand that staff happens, but it is just soo hard to deal with people who does not accept their responsibilities. It also tought me a lesson that we should not trust anyone with my things! You agree, that it contradicts with the hotel reputation if you refuse the help of the concierge and bring your own bags to your room!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant, Great Views from Tower Room”
Reviews.Author: TMLLeedsUK
Reviews.Content: All in all a very pleasant experience, the History of the place and feel of the reception were definately worth the stay. Fabulous views from our top of the tower bay view room, again worth the extra. Pleasant roof garden and half way between fishermans wharf and union square. As with everything in that part of San Franciso the hiklls are not for the feint hearted, great local coffee shops and close to China Town (do walk through and see the shops, they are great) and Little Italy. Fell in love with San Franciso and we are sure The Fairmont played its part it that too. Would recommend just for the sheer history, room quality good, room service efficient, though coffee was average at best.Visited at Easter 2011 and weather whilst still a little cold was sunny and bright most days, always makes everything seem better. Would stay at Fishermans Wharf Area in the future as that is where we spent much of our time so the Hills were tedious.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay but could have been so much better”
Reviews.Author: pineapple_coconut
Reviews.Content: For a five star property, we expected a lot. Perhaps our expectations were set way too high after coming straight from the Bellagio in Vegas to stay in the Fairmont. We stayed here in November 2007. This hotel is really "old world glamour", the lobby is very chic. When we got to our room, we were disappointed as we were allocated a room with a connecting door with a view of the courtyard, something which really annoys my fiancÃ©. The bathroom also was quite small. We requested a change and they moved us to a room at the front of the hotel so it had a much better view. The only thing was the toilet in the bathroom had a bit of a wonky flush - it didn't really work properly. They had to send someone up to fix it. The breakfast was disappointing as it was very small and ridiculously expensive for what you got. We had breakfast there the first morning but we didn't eat there anymore. I was actually shocked at the price of the breakfast. We were disappointed because of the small little issues so I hope they have improved since then.

Reviews.Title: “Very average room... Not best location”
Reviews.Author: MWTuff
Reviews.Content: I was a tad disappointed with this hotel.... Lobby= beautiful... Actually stunning.... But to to room, which was supposed to be big enough to fit a portable bed if we decided we (friend & I) didn't want to share a bed, as they had no twins available... But getting back to room size, we could barely fit extra rack for suit case let alone another bed....as for Location, well it's a lovely view, perched on top of "snob hill", but makes exploring a chore because the road to it is soooooo steep (had to take heels off walking down as it's that steep!) so not a handy, easily accessible location.... I would have perfered bottom of hill near Union Square, cheaper, less impressive lobby... Service was ok but hardly worth the $$$ for the tiny room... Oh did I mention window in room looking at wall?

Reviews.Title: “Classic”
Reviews.Author: JohnPaul77
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 3 nights in October. The hotel is old, but in a good way. You can feel the history of the place. The room we had looked out over the bay and the North Beach area which was stunning at sunset and sunrise. I would imagine some people would find the rooms a bit dated, but the hotel is over a hundred years old so we felt it just added to the overall vibe of the place. Our room had everything we needed, the bed was extremely comfortable and the shower was superb. The lobby and main hotel bar is stunning and probably hasn't changed since the hotel was built. The bar is a really great place to sit and have a quiet drink at night and there is the Tonga Room bar/restaurant in the basement which is a bit tacky but good fun. This was our first trip to San Fransico but we thought the location was ideal. Its a nice straight walk downhill to Fishermans Wharf and a similar downhill walk to the Union Square area. The walk back up to the hotel is obviously a bit more of a challenge but the Fairmont sits on a street which is serviced by the trolley's and you can easily get a cab so it wasn't a problem. I personally loved this hotel because of the history of the place and its location. If you don't mind rooms which are not ultra modern then I'd highly recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “What's happened at the Fairmont SF?”
Reviews.Author: ToniPaterson
Reviews.Content: We are Bay Area locals and stayed at the Fairmont last Saturday following an event at the hotel. The bellman told us the room did not have air conditioning and we should open the window to the noisy street below; incorrect but it did take quite a while to cool the room. The hotel must be on an austerity plan: no robes, no cotton balls or swabs, no sewing kit and the shower cap was tiny! And to top it off, Housekeeping woke us up at 9 am the next morning! There are lots of great hotels in SF... the Fairmont should be one of them and it is very disappointing to see the cuts.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite Luxury”
Reviews.Author: DrBob-cs
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights with my wife in the tower (newer) wing of the hotel while on business. The room was large, quiet, with a very comfortable bed and lovely linens. It was what I expected of a luxury hotel, except it had only four small drawers in a dresser for clothes, the bath had only one sink with very little space for toiletries, and the desk was small with only two electrical outlets, not enough for a computer and two cell phones. Food at breakfast was average for a large hotel, nothing to get excited about. The hotel is in a residential area atop Nob Hill, one mile and 400 vertical feet from the financial district, the shopping area near Union Square, and the Embarcadero. This means there was very little within walking distance. No one attending our meeting wanted to climb 400 feet back up to the hotel after going down to Union Square. The streets leading to the hotel are very steep, and the cable cars are an expensive $6 one way. A taxi is cheaper if two people are going together. If you are driving, remember parking is expensive, and we heard several complaints that drivers and even pedestrians are ticketed for minor violations.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel in truly pristine condition”
Reviews.Author: W_on_the_Road
Reviews.Content: Really impressive hotel. Head and shoulders above the hotel across the street, in my opinion. Spotlessly clean. Gorgeous property.. seemingly old world and brand new all at once. Was especially impressed because I didn't like the first room they gave me, and they immediately moved me -- I thought they'd be hesitant because I was paying their bargain basement rate. Not so -- they moved me right away. Only negs -- no coffee maker in the room, and during peak hours, there was like a 25 minute wait at the coffee shop in the hotel. Also, like many hotels in SF, rooms over the main entrance are noisy because all of the bellman use this loud whistle to call cabs for people.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: cfilmcat
Reviews.Content: Great hotel at the top of Nob Hill. The area is quiet at night, yet only at 10 minute walk to China town, Union Square and the Ferry Building. All the cable cars run by as well.I will always try and stay here. It is hard to get a room, usually fully booked

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with the historic feel”
Reviews.Author: MarieBJK
Reviews.Content: Such an amazingly beautiful hotel. You could spend most of your visit in the hotel if you wanted. Service was friendly and responsive. Housekeeping was consistent and timely. The era decor was well preserved and updgrades to modern amentities seem well planned. Elevators run very slow and there were often long wait times but given the age of the building it was expected but I don't think it took too much away from the experience. Just make sure to allow yourself a little more time to get out of the hotel. The garden is also beautiful and a great place to have your morning coffee or lunch or just to get out and get some fresh air. The view of the city also great. We weren't disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome balcony room”
Reviews.Author: hmdespo
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights for our anniversary in the city at the Fairmont and booked the balcony suite. Found a discounted rate on hotels.com but it was still very pricey. Balcony rooms are not too common in San Francisco so it was a treat. We enjoyed cheese and wine on the balcony and would return to this room again. We were also able to check in super early (11:00 AM) before heading to the Giants game which was great as we did not have to rush back or leave bags in the car, etc. One important item to note about this room and why I have given it four stars is when we booked the room we booked a King bed suite as we are very tall and apparently there are only queen beds in all of the balcony suites. Super important detail depending on your travel companion or height. That was the only drawback (and the hills) of the hotel. This is an old hotel so you should be aware of that when booking. That lends to the charm and everything is updated anyhow. The bathrooms are clean but small. The location is great as we walked to Union Square and the the edge of Chinatown. We decided to have dinner at the Tonga Room which I have not been to since a high school prom and we enjoyed fantastic service, great drinks, dinner and music. The atmosphere was fun as there was dancing and both families and couples. While there are numerous fancy restaurants in San Francisco the "rain" over the lagoon (pool) with the boat filled with singers cant be beat for a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: dcrouton
Reviews.Content: Spent four days in August at the Fairmont. The location was pretty convenient. It was at the top of Nob hill but near major bus and cable car lines. I did not appreciate the hills but the cable cars and buses really took the pain out of walking up. As for the hotel things were really good. We were able to check in early with now problem. The concierge helped us with some directions and reservations. The rooms were extremely large and well appointed. No issues their. What gets me about the entire Fairmont chain is the need to charge extra for WiFi. These days it should be standard. For business it is not a big deal but for tourists it is an extra unnecessary charge. I would recommend this hotel if looking for a nice stay in a hotel. While it is short walking distance to China town and Union square invest in a muni pass to avoid the up hill walks.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: KrystalEdwards
Reviews.Content: We just arrived at the hotel for our stay, this is the third time we have stayed at the hotel. We we arrived at noon the line to check in was 30 minutes long so we dropped our luggage and headed out to enjoy the city! When we came back to the hotel we were in great spirits and checked in at the front. The man checked us in (Scott) had absolutely no personality and was not amused by our excitement to be in the main tower of the Fairmont. Once we got into our room we got settled and went to get ice, however our ice bucket had water and a diet coke, which tells me the room was not cleaned properly. I called down to the desk and the lady was, once again not very amused and asked if I wanted to be connected to the house keeping manager.(really?) how about, "I apologize and will have that taken care of for you" strange. Now I sit here and a room service rep comes and doesn't know what to do with our ice bucket. I am just not impressed and hopefully out stay will improve. Wait it just got better! One glass in the room to make a drink! I suddenly feel that I am at a ramada inn.

Reviews.Title: “Class & Style”
Reviews.Author: NiteTour
Reviews.Content: We love SF, and always stay at the Fairmont hotel for business and pleasure. if you liike old sophisticated classy hotels, this is it. My wife and I always stay in Fairmont hotels around the world and we love the ambiance. The highend Suites are a little dated, but roomy and classy...if you get a chance and you are in Banff, Alberta Canada, stay in the exclusive Spa Suites they are worth every dime you pay!

Reviews.Title: “My home in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: RKW206
Reviews.Content: I first stayed here with my parents almost 60 years ago. Now I stay here once or twice a year and still love it madly. Staff is the equal of any hotel in the world, consistently bending over backwards to ensure a great stay. Laurel Court bar is a fine place to hang out. And the Tonga Room...you would have to be a very cranky person to not be happy and well fed in the Tonga Room... Room service food is excellent. Wi-Fi & Ethernet is strong. Parking is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the ugly...”
Reviews.Author: Kent A
Reviews.Content: It is a shame the owners have allowed this magnificent property to decline to the state I found it in. The good: Great location, decent sized room, big walk-in closet, professional and friendly staff. The bad: Stained carpet and furniture in my room, dirty in the corners, tired decorating and peeling paint and wallpaper, small bathroom, slow elevators and not enough of them, plus they are dinged and scraped up. The ugly: Expensive hotels are known for nickle and diming their guests and this one is no exception. Everything extra costs extra, like the excercise facilities, internet service and no coffee maker in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont holiday”
Reviews.Author: klsmackay
Reviews.Content: Four days in the Fairmont in San Francisco with the most wonderful view over the city, 21st floor. A truly beautiful hotel in the mould of Gleneagles or the Balmoral in Edinburgh and all staff were fantastic especially the reception and cocierge desk and all doormen who made our stay so memorable. Cant wait to return as we plan to visit in 2014. The Mackays St Andrews Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Insight for the business traveler staying the San Francisco Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: ptbrk
Reviews.Content: Lumpy bed. Noisy. Avoid rooms with connecting doors. WiFi is excellent (I found they placed a router right in the cabinet that used to hold a fax machine). Chair is uncomfortable but lighting is really good. TV allows iPad/iPhone connection with the proper wire. I have been staying at Fairmonts lately and this one not up to speed with the one in Boston or even Toronto (which was not my favorite either). Bring your own toiletries unless you want to end up smelling like grandma on Sunday. Service at the restaurant was poor. Chinese server could use a rosetta stone English course because I could barely understand him. Food was average. My parents used to rave about this place and I think the grandeur of this hotel is back in the 60s. Will not come back. The Palace on Market Street is comparable and a much better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm at the crossroads to the best of San Fransisco”
Reviews.Author: adoola
Reviews.Content: Rooms were in need of a little TLC, but overall our stay was comfortable and enjoyable. The lobby is absolutely stunning and the reception staff couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. And what a location, some of the best of San Francisco is within walking distance (though save enough enerfy for the walk back up the hill!) - North Beach, Fishermans Wharf, Chinatown, Financial District etc. - or hop on a California Line cable car. Parking is expensive (about $60 per night), but there are cheaper public parking lots within 1 or 2 blocks of the hotel. We found the Grace Cathedral parking on Taylor Street to be the cheapest at $27.00 max. per day - the garage is open Sunday through Thursday from 6:30 a.m. to midnight and Friday and Saturday 6:30 a.m. to 2 a.m. (you can park overnight, you just won't' have access to your vehicle outside of the opening times).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmt1961
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for my 50th birthday trip with my husband. From the minute the taxi pulled up to the front entrance I was in heaven. The decor is elegant but not so fancy that you don't feel comfortable sitting in the lobby to wait for your car. All the staff seemed friendly and helpful. Our room #2207 had the most amazing view of the city and the bay and we were fortunate enough to have clear weather for 2 of our 3 days there. The hotel is located in a fairly central area and we found it easy enough to get around using the public transportation. We did take a cab a few times when the thought of climbing got too much! We ate breakfast at the hotel one morning and that would be my only slight complaint. I ordered from the menu and was happy with my frittata but my husband had the buffet and it was lukewarm at best when you're paying $70 for breakfast w/out tip you don't want lukewarm food. One thing to be aware of is Caffee Cento listed as a breakfast option is actually accessed from the street as well as the hotel and although the coffee and food was good it is very, very crowded and the lines are long and there is not really any seating to enjoy a sit down breakfast. That being said there are plenty of other places to eat in the area so it wasn't a problem,

Reviews.Title: “Someday I'll live here...”
Reviews.Author: miniorange
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont San Francisco is historic hotel charm with superior customer service (and the lobby smells amazing!). I have been fortunate to enjoy the hospitality here several times and each visit the Fairmont exceeded my expectations - large windows with sills large enough to curl up in and read a book, a bed so comfortable I took mine apart to see who makes it - and location, location, location. Blocks from Union Square, Dottie's True Blue Cafe, North Beach, The Wharf... and filled with Nob Hill's own cafes and attractions - check out the labyrinth in the cathedral across the street. Chinatown, only blocks away, offers dining and shopping like you won't find at home.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: swnyrawel
Reviews.Content: You wont be disappointed with this hotel, excellent

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Girls' Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Bobcat 12
Reviews.Content: A girls' weekend is always a great time, but our time at The Fairmont made it so much more wonderful! It is a beautiful historic hotel with a lovely lobby and common areas. We were upgraded and had a corner room with a great view of the city. The room was huge and had a walk- in closet! The bathroom was functional....not lots of vanity space, but plenty of outlets in other places...so it works! Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Talk about on- time service...we ordered breakfast, as well as bell desk services and they were not even one minute off.....unbelievable! We had cold oatmeal with breakfast and it was cheerfully removed from the bill. If there is a down-side....it's a steep climb from shopping back to the hotel...but it ia a good calorie burn! Parking was included in our rate...but can run up to $55 with taxes...just good to know to factor in! Would be happy to go back for our next adventure!

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable classic”
Reviews.Author: Thomas R
Reviews.Content: I'd always wanted to stay in the Fairmont ever since my salad days as a "casual" worker in SF. The opportunity came with a recent conference and I decided to bring along my wife for a three-day stay. Stately and well-kept is how I'd describe the building and it's lobby. "Classic" and clearly of a different time are the rooms. The service is toward the top-end, friendly staff who try (and succeed) in being helpful in many ways. The grand lobby is just that: grand. The bar can seem a bit dark and cold but once tucked into your own cocoon on a banquette, it makes sense. A little peeve is the "touch-me-and-you-will-pay" display of bottled water and goodies meant to tempt you. Likewise, I wish hotels like this would just include the internet charge in the room instead of adding the $13.95 daily fee. Nevertheless, if another conference offers the Fairmont at a reasonable rate, I'll return.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: thefriedlands
Reviews.Content: Undoubtedly on one of the best locations in San Francisco, the Fairmont at the top of Nob Hill is a stately hotel with old world charm, but modern conveniences. The staff is extremely friendly and attentive to all guests' wishes. The food in the hotel's restaurants is excellent and up to the Fairmont's standards. Not only is the food delicious, but so are the beds!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Oliver002
Reviews.Content: The Grand Old Dame of San Francisco. Wonderful atmosphere, great service and excellent location! We will be back Fairmont!

Reviews.Title: “Easy, opulent, and perfect”
Reviews.Author: doctort
Reviews.Content: A complete review with video is on our site EatPackGo.com - Suffice to say that this hotel has the perfect location. The unknowing San Francisco traveler will note that the hotel is at the top of Russian/Nob hill - those of us who know SF, know that you want to be here- because it means you can get anywhere you want to in the city- easily, without the traffic that those who stay along the bay. Do not try to walk up the hill to this hotel- take a cab. And cabs from the hotel are easy- without long lines. Want to check in fast, join the Fairmont Hotel's President club, and with that you get great lines, and better service. This is a grand hotel, that goes out of their way. You can see our example in our video blog at EatPackGo.com

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont San Fran”
Reviews.Author: ToonTownFarmer
Reviews.Content: spent 4 days for a business trip. 2nd time there and just as good as the first. rooms are very nice even though hotel abit older but that is the unique attraction. very clean, great service, nice beds and pillows. Someone told us everything is downhill from the Fiarmont and they were true - its a good hike uphill to the hotel no matter which way you go - yikes my poor feet. staff is great, bar was fun. their recommendations for food was OK but do some of your own research as we veto most of their suggestions. would be back anytime and we have stayed at so very excellant places over the years

Reviews.Title: “Classically Beautiful with a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MissFranberry
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Fairmont a couple of times in the past 15 years and I am always impressed by their stellar customer service, comfortable rooms, and classically beautiful design. A nationally recognized historic hotel, The Fairmont is mostly up-to-date with great beds and a decent amount of space (for Queen and King rooms). We had no complaints during our 4-night stay except for their business center which is run by someone else (print-outs were costly). The location of this hotel is super convenient for walking to Union Square, Chinatown, and other popular SF locations-- and if you're up for it, it's a good walk all the way down to the Ferry Building and Financial Districts, too. Several cable car and Muni lines are located across the street from the hotel making this a good place for those looking to explore the city without driving. Good for business, pleasure, solo trips, and couples. Do note that the property does sit on a hill.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Elegant”
Reviews.Author: SashaCamille
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Fairmont was very pleasant. We booked 2 rooms, and were very roomy, large bathrooms and walk-in closets. The service personel were great and commodating. The hotel has cable cars stops around their property. The property is on the top of the hill. It is walking distance to Union Square but when you go back is a walk up the hills unless you take the cable car trolley. The hotel is pricey but it was worth the stay and would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dillyma
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Fairmont for two nights on a business trip. I found it to be an absolutely lovely hotel. The lobby is very beautiful, as are all the public spaces. This is a grand old hotel and takes you back to another era. I had a room on the 10th floor in the "tower" section, which had a fabulous view of the city. The room was spacious and well-decorated. I found the bed to be very comfortable. Loved the bathroom - big room, separate toilet and large glass shower. Very nice! The staff was also very friendly and helpful. We stopped at the conceirge desk the first night and they were very helpful in directing us to a restaurant within walking distance. The only drawback was that the thermostat in my room would not go any lower than 65 degrees. It was warm while I was in San Francisco, and I like it chilly at night, so that was a small issue for me. I would definitely stay at the Fairmont again, and would recommend to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury San Francisco Old Marvel!”
Reviews.Author: simonr78
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont San Francisco is a truly remarkable historic property, a fantastic luxurious stay made the trip to this wonderful city even more special, from the moment we entered the lobby it was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Fabulous Fairmont!”
Reviews.Author: Ian M
Reviews.Content: We've travelled to California every year since 2006 and for the five past years, we've stayed at the San Francisco Fairmont. What more can you say about a place that's already regarded with so much fondness and affection? From the moment you enter the fabled marble halls until the time that you check out, you will have a Hotel experience like no other, anywhere in the world. This is luxury with a massive big "L". We've been very fortunate in that every year we've had a room in the Fairmont Tower which allows you the most spectacular of views over the Bay - every morning as you pull back the drapes, feast uyour eyes on the panorama of the Golden Gate Bridge, Russian Hill, admire the Coit tower, and the two-tiered Bay Bridge, and don't miss (how could you?) the small jewel floating in an azure sea, the island that is Alcatraz. There is no view like this anywhere else in the world. The bedrooms are spacious, clean and like the whole hotel, very well maintained. The restaurant and bar area which sit adjacent to the massive reception halls have been revamped and redecorated over the past twelve months and are comfortable and relaxing. The Fairmont breakfast is a must - don't miss out. All kinds of berries and other fruit by the bowlful, toasts, croissants, bagels and breads of every description, smoked Maryland bacon, to go with freshly cooked eggs cooked by your personal chef on demand. Even the grapefruit juice gets 11 out of 10! Overnight valet parking is expensive but it's essential and the staff there are efficient and very helpful. You're at the top of California and Mason, and the SF trams tinkle their way up and down the hill all day (a single fare is $6) and you never have to wait long for a ride. You can walk down to Union Square in ten minutes, but get the tram back up! Shopping stores abound - Sax, Macy's, Bloomingdales, Apple, Levi, Nike, Tiffany and many, many more - they are all just minutes from the Hotel. We can't wait to come back 2012 - San Francisco is our favourite city in the world, and the Fairmont Hotel is one of the very good reasons for that!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jenny23454
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely place to stay the service was good in all areas the staff at reception concierge room service and housekeepingwere all outstanding. The restaurants were top quality . This motel is at the top of Nob hill which is ok if you dont mind trolley cars or taxi but the view from our room was great.We were stranded on our departure when executive cars didnt show to take us to the airport. The car company was not connected to the hotel in any yet and the hotel car driver stepped in and got us to the airport without a worry in the world.Service was all of the staffs first priority at this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Fair"NOT" in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: barca212
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at other Fairmont properties, this one is a real disappointment. First, the location on top of Nob Hill is not convenient. One has to take a Trolley Car to the top of the hill unless you feel like climbing up a steep hill. Second the rooms are really dated! I was lucky enough to have a room on the 22nd Floor of the Tower with a great view of the city, but that still did not make up for the absolutely dismal decoration and stodginess of this room. So I can only imagine how much worse it would be if one was in a room without a view and natural light. Third, and the major failure of this hotel, is its staff. It is seems like they are doing you a favor by answering a question or serving you a drink. The conceirge might as well not be there. So unhelpful and always recommending what is right around the corner and complete tourist traps. I used the wonderful apps on my i-phone to find much better places than what was recommended by the hotel's conceirge team. All in all, this is an overpriced hotel that is way past its glory. Don't bother dropping your money on this property. San Francisco has so many wonderful hotels and in much better locations. I regret having stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Dame in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: peonyinlondon
Reviews.Content: Set at the highest point of Nob Hill, the Fairmont is a glorious tribute to a bygone era. Dripping in luxury, the lobby is one of the few which makes me feel like I should be in good clothes in order to pass through it. This would be a perfect venue for a wedding, especially if the ceremony were held in the cathedral just across the way. In terms of modern comfort, however, I was very much missing my in-room coffee maker and I get angry when I'm charged for daily internet use. The minibar prices are beyond outrageous, as are the prices for room service breakfast. It's easy enough, however, to get down to the bowels of the hotel, where you will find a great little coffee shop with very reasonable prices. Go figure. The beds are a little soft, but new and comfortable. The views, especially in the newer tower, are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “On top of the hill”
Reviews.Author: MATTNottinghamUK
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, reasonable price for a big city...I think about $220. We are a family of 4 so $50 each is well worth it. Join the Presidents Club online....its free, you will then get complimentary wi-fi. Its quite a walk to Pier 39 about 40 mins, an even tougher walk coming back its all uphill. The alternative is the cable car but for the four of us for one very squashed 10 minute trip it was $32. There are plenty of small pharmacy/grocery stores within a couple of blocks downhill towards the shopping centres, its certainly cheaper to buy breakfast and coffee than at the hotel. Would I stay again? yes I love the Fairmont Hotels but maybe I would look towards Fishermans Wharf a little more for hotels there. Fishermans Wharf was a little gem..we loved it. The Tower rooms were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Period Elegance. Dingy rooms”
Reviews.Author: keepitnice
Reviews.Content: Lobby is impressive, if you like that style - you'll enjoy this lobby and event spaces. I stayed in a 4th floor room - icky icky ick. I have stayed in a fair amount of older hotels, boutique hotels too but this hotel's dingy rooms are just that - dingy. The Bad: The wallpaper was coming off the walls, not just in the bathroom, but the bedroom too.The vent in the bathroom doesn't work - perhaps part of the problem with the peeling wall paper.Peeling wallpaper though seems like no big deal when compared with the lack of general cleaning.There were marks on the walls and door of my bathroom, many dirty marks, and I really don't like to think of what these may have been because it is too easy to answer this and get more upset. Aside from these marks, which easily could have been cleaned with a rag and some cleaning product - there is the overall dinge. By dinge I am talking about the thick dust layer (we all know what dusts consists of) on everything: a dark, puffy gray film covering floor boards, lamps, doors, corners (don't look at corners), desks - you know all the stuff that is normally cleaned in a hotel. Apparently this hotel hasn't trained their staff to do these things.It is like they just change the sheets and the toilet paper rolls. No real cleaning. Speaking of the toilet paper roll...I had to take the roll off the holder and put it on the sink. The location they have they toilet paper holder in was extremely odd and unless you are a contortionist, you aren't going to be able to reach your TP. And make sure you bring your slippers or flip flops - the floors aren't that clean either. If you plan on ironing, know that your clothes are going to smell moldy after doing so. Not only are the ironing boards dirty, but the iron itself isn't emptied of its water by the staff, so it just hangs out in the iron and gets stagnant and moldy smelling. Also, they have a sign that says they are environmentally conscious so in order to get your towels washed you need to leave them on the floor.Well, I had the DND sign on my door, no towels on my floor (after all,I had only been there for 2 days I didn't need my sheets or towels changed) and they came into my room and changed the sheets and towels. So much for either sign! Lastly, how many lamps can be put in one small room, if you stay here you will find out! Of course, two of the lamps were broken. Really two broken lamps. I guess with all the other lamps they didn't think they should fix them. Again the housekeeping really needs better training. The view was also very bad - view of ducts and pipes - ask for a street view or tower room. The food was okay, but for the price, go to one of the many great restaurants in the area. I would only eat in the hotel if you couldn't get out.Also the little coffee shop at the bottom of the hotel, on Powell, it not so good.I am from PDX so may be a bit of a coffee snob. Positives: Although, not my style the lobby was nice, the function rooms were nice and the staff all were nice and helpful. I really liked the location of this hotel and rather enjoyed walking up and down the hills. Although if you aren't up for the hills, you can take the street car or a taxi easy enough. China town and high end shopping are close by. I walked to Coit tower, the Fisherman's Warf, the financial district, crooked Lombard St, North Beach. SFMOMA - all over! And if after walking all day you enjoy sleeping in a cozy, squishy, expensive bed, this hotel has them. The robes are nice too, as it the selection of television stations. They offer free newspapers and umbrella borrows if you get caught w/o one on a rainy day. The gym is good but costs $15/day unless you belong to the president's club. There is a fridge in the room but it is completely stocked with the hotel's bar - no room for your own stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive prices”
Reviews.Author: Matt C
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Fairmont San Francisco on a business trip for 7 nights, the total hotel bill (room only) was $1800 and that was on a reduced rate! The hotel lobby is one of the most impressive I've seen with its huge marble columns supporting the high roof, comfortable antique looking sofa's and impressive dÃ©cor. The staff are all very friendly and helpful (should think so for the price) and the hotel definitely has the wow factor. The rooms are big, the beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms are also marble tiled; my room had a big glass box shower which was amazing. I was situated on the 17th floor of the "tower" block in the hotel which I think is the newer part. The view from my room was equally impressive overlooking the San Francisco bay area. Everything about the hotel is massively expensive and I would recommend saving a few pennies by eating and drinking outside the hotel. The hotel is located right at the top of nob hill and takes about 20-30mins to walk to the peir39 area which has some half decent restaurants. Its also about a 15min walk to the main shopping areas of SF so it is well situated for exploring the city. I would not recommend this hotel unless you have a lot of cash or your business are paying the bill (like for my trip). Its very impressive but also very expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: kittycarr
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont was a beautiful hotel. The lobby was stunning and our conjoining rooms were very clean and pleasant. It was very nice and the staff were very friendly. The only thing was if you want to use WiFi you had to pay $13.95. Apart from that everything was fantastic.b

Reviews.Title: “Truly wonderful, absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: plodders
Reviews.Content: What can I say, the Fairmont was exactly what we expected and more. Having read some of the reviews we were slightly concerned however any worries we had disappeared in an instant. The Hotel is beautiful, magical in fact. It was the last two days of our stay in San Francisco and my husband had always wanted to stay at the Fairmont so we booked it. When we arrived we were told our room had been upgraded to a suite on the 16th floor. WOW! We couldn't believe that they had done this for us and the room was out of this world, immaculate and beautiful. We had views of the Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz and the city. The Hotel is located on a hill so the views are amazing. For our first evening we ate in the restaurant and the food was excellent and the waiter made our evening perfect because he was so polite, friendly and professional. For our second evening we ate in the Tonga Room, not an experience we would want to repeat. I am surprised the Fairmont converted what would have been a beautiful swimming pool to such an oddly themed restaurant. However, this is only our view, after all it was busy and has been there a long time!! If you want to stay in an elegant, stylish hotel with polite and attentive staff, in a wonderful location, stay in the Fairmont, it is truly wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay here due to the great balcony and view!”
Reviews.Author: AmidaBuddha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont last summer for three nights. We booked online and got a great deal on the Karachi Suite. This is a two room suite which offers an very large private balcony with a great view of the SF Financial District including the TransAmerica Building. Although we were technically only on the 4th floor, due to The Fairmont being atop Nob Hill, we were equivalent to being twenty or thirty stories above the city. We probably would not have enjoyed the stay as much if it were not for this great wrought iron balcony. The hotel itself is full service and offers all amenaties you would expect.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but well situated, convenient and smart”
Reviews.Author: mjfisher
Reviews.Content: It was a nice hotel, but extremely large as you would expect for a city hotel. Our room was big and very pleasant, we have no complaints about that or the cleanliness. The service is good, we found the front desk staff very helpful as was the concierge and the cleaning staff certainly kept everything immaculate. I think a previous reviewer said find a deal - that's a good plan! It is in a very good location so we didn't hire our car until we left San Francisco which I would recommend, you have no need for one in the City as the cable cars are close by and there are plenty of cabs. Much better not to have the hassle of driving so you can better enjoy this beautiful city. Last time we went to San Francisco we stayed at the Westin St Francisc in Union Square, but I preferred The Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service & very dissatisfied”
Reviews.Author: Jeff1234567
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot especially in the US I often try and stay in a fairmont as u until now have had excellent experiences. However at this hotel it felt like an inner city airport hotel in which we were kept awake all night with the noise! At over Â£300 at night I expected more won't be so quick to opt for or recommend a fairmont in the future. When I complained got the feeling they had better things to deal with!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the main building - newer, larger rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ehan31
Reviews.Content: This hotel is my go-to when visiting San Francisco. Positives: - It has a pretty convenient location that is accessible by taxi or cable car if you want. (Parking your car is $ as with all other hotels in the area). - Accommodations are excellent. The rooms are clean, the beds are really quite heavenly, and the rooms in the main tower are spacious. (The smaller, more dated rooms in the other locations of the hotel have equally nice beds and appointments but the bathrooms are much older and the rooms are significantly smaller. Not a big problem if you're going to be out and about most of the time or if you are only here a night, but paying full price, I'd try to stay in the newer rooms.) - The concierge is very helpful and friendly. - The city views are beautiful. Negatives: - Food here is pricey, but it's a Fairmont and it's San Francisco. I didn't eat at the hotel except for a breakfast that was included anyway. The buffet was quite nice quality food, but I wouldn't pay full price for it. There are better places to eat in the city. - Parking, as stated above if you're driving. - Room size if you're staying in the older rooms (specifically the bathroom) Bottom line: If you need just a place to crash don't spend the money. If you are going to enjoy your time, like the finer things but don't want to pay exorbitantly, and prefer a bed that isn't a concrete slab, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here - If you can find a deal”
Reviews.Author: Will Work for Plane Tickets
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel is a great value, IF you can find a deal like I did. I am not sure I would pay upwards of $350 a night to stay here. However, the front desk staff and concierge are amazing. They answered our every question and arranged rides to and from the airport for us. Our room was immaculate and had all the exceptional details covered: magazines, Ipod charger/player, and comfy bed with several pillow types and sizes. The bathroom is perfect with the expected robes, hair dryer, shampoo, and conditioner. I cannot find a single fault with our 6 night stay. I will be back, assuming I find another deal:)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Jm12341
Reviews.Content: On the first day we were placed once floor where all other rooms seemed to be used by people making a film. Unfortunately filming started at midnight and carried on until early morning. It was a struggle to change rooms. The rooms are small and the bathrooms are very compact and hard to negotiate. On one occasion we arrived back at 6pm to find the room had not been cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but a little stuffy & overpriced”
Reviews.Author: lucl2000
Reviews.Content: The rooms were ok but overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and miss!”
Reviews.Author: Elphenstone
Reviews.Content: Great location for us, but climbing up nob hill may be an issue for some. The rooms are dated, but are generally pleasant in appearance. The hallways are not to the same standard and reveal a high degree of wear. Wear in our room was also an issue. The bed was worn to the point that there was a dent from countless people sleeping in the same spot. I kept sliding away from my partner into this dent. The shower didn't work properly. There were multiple broken globes in our room. The main issue it this hotel is cleanliness. Our bathroom had skum on the floor. The drinking glasses were not cleaned and had lipstick on them. There was an ice bucket in our room full of stagnant water. No complimentary tea/coffee in your room. Complimentary tea/coffee in the lobby before 7am only. What a joke. In the hall outside our room there was an area where something had been spilled with lots of crumbs on the floor - very obvious (see photos). This was not cleaned up for 3 days! It was still there when we left and can only assume given the standards of cleanliness is still there. The other disgusting thing was that room service plates etc that are put out are left sitting in the hall for long periods also. This is a big detraction. So in summary - not a high end hotel. Enjoy the magnificent lobby because thats as good as it's going to get. We complained about some of the things above. Others we couldn't be bothered with as we were otherwise busy enjoying the holiday and didn't want to be disrupted even more.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful memories”
Reviews.Author: catbluesky
Reviews.Content: This hotel is THE place to stay in San Francisco. The view from the tower was amazing! The service excellent, and the location unbeatable! We had appetizers and a beverage in the hotel lounge area, utilized the services of the concierge, bought lovely gifts in the on-site shops and thoroughly enjoyed the history and ambiance of one of the oldest hotels in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Winchell
Reviews.Content: Like so many others we had high hopes staying at this hotel, however, we were disappointed. The lobby and public areas are spectacular and well maintained. Service (front desk staff) and attention to detail in general are weak. We were welcomed unfriendly and booked in a smoker's room which we had not requested. Upon returning to the front desk, we were informed that there were no other rooms available. We did not back down and surprise, surprise they suddenly had a different room. Their WIFI never worked properly and after informing the front desk they had me contact an IT specialist with whom I was on the phone for 15 minutes. I think that such a problem ought to be solved by the hotel and not by the guest; in any case the WIFI never worked properly. The staff at their restaurant is very friendly. I am pretty sure that there are better hotels in SF for the price that the Fairmont asks.

Reviews.Title: “On top of Nob Hill of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Carl40Switzerland
Reviews.Content: Old style hotel with very good service level. My room was a bit worn out but the reception area has style. It is nicely located up on Nob Hill and it is easy to go down with the cable cars or walk to either China town or shopping at Union Square or down the Fishermans Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappoining!”
Reviews.Author: 1879fulham
Reviews.Content: Had high hopes staying at this iconic hotel. Only stayed the one night on business (a Saturday) but let's just say left feeling very disappointed. The foyer and public areas of this hotel are indeed spectacular and are very well maintained. However when you get to your room (deluxe room on the 7th floor) you are cruelly let down with a room that has absolutely no view with minimal light. Disappointingly attention to detail also seems to suffer somewhat with the net curtain dirty and also significantly torn, and there were also quite a few areas in the room that had major cracks and flakey paintwork. It is clear that the hotel spend their money on maintaining the public areas and then cut corners on the guest rooms (certainly from my expeience this time anyway). I have stayed at other Fairmont hotels in the past staying at their Santa Monica hotel and the two they have in Bermuda. None of them really come close to the San Francisco site and location but all of them far exceed on the guest room experience by a mile! I guess the major question is would I come here again particularly with my wife and the honest answer is a resounding NO! For the price there are better experiences in San Francisco out there.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful vacation at a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mavipm6
Reviews.Content: We loved the Fairmont San Francisco hotel !!!! We were celebrating our wedding anniversary and had a lovely trip . It is located in Nob Hill which is a very elegant neighborhood and close to every important place iin town. Service is outstanding, we had breakfast in bed very often and always hot and on time. Front desk staff is extremely nice. We rented a car so we could drive outside San Francisco ,and had a dream vacation. We are going back next year for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lesleyLeominster
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a short stay at the Fairmont in San Francisco what a beautiful hotel, loved every minute there friendly staff very helpful, room was so comfortable and clean we asked for high floor and were not disappointed would love to return there some day.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay at Landmark Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cleisha
Reviews.Content: I treated a friend for a night at the Fairmont for her birthday. There were three of us staying in a double queen room. It is much like several 4 star hotels we have visited, nice linens, good toiletries, great view, and comfortable beds. Note that you will pay $52 for parking. The service was equal to our stay at the Wynn in Las Vegas. Well attended and the staff was very pleasant. The only complaint I have is that we had to wait nearly two hours for our room when arriving at 2pm. Take note that even if the staff tells you there is early check in, you may wait. We sat in the cocktail lounge while waiting and had signature drinks which were very tasty and pricy. After visiting SF many times it is worth at least one visit but is a little overated.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem in the city!”
Reviews.Author: 1WorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Really nice. Took a cab from Powell St BART station to the Fairmont. It's a classic hotel. Really nice rooms, awesome lobby, and restaurant. I liked the terrace garden. Overall a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in public, tired in private.”
Reviews.Author: jd294
Reviews.Content: Walking into this hotel is almost magical. The vaulted ceiling coupled with gorgeous velvet sofas and chairs, orchids and marble remind one of years past in which this hotel launched music careers and served as a host for all sorts of diplomatic and social gatherings. But the rooms are tired. Peeling paint, weathered upholstery, dinged furniture, loud air conditioning units, thin walls, and sinking beds feel out of place rather than charming. I would recommend coming here for a drink rather than a stay. Service here was fine but not overly friendly. I was turned off by the front desk agent who replied to my question about breakfast options with a plug for the $30 buffet and no mention of the basement cafe that serves coffee and quick options. Fortunately, I found that on my own.

Reviews.Title: “If you like mold and dirt, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Nominator
Reviews.Content: This time, the doctor booked a balcony suite in San Francisco and hoped for stunning views and a nice grand hotel room. As a first advice, if they offer you "the beautiful Malaya suite", do not take it! Because you pay for the balcony, but you don't get one. The so called "balcony" is covered to 85% in glass, so it's more like a winter garden. As you can see from the outside of the hotel, this balcony is the only one that's limited in that way. But this didn't even make the doctor write this review. He was even willing to not complain about the muffy old room that was quite dusty and should have been remodeled over a century ago... No, what was really embarrassing, was the winter garden/balcony itself. First of all, the balcony had not been cleaned for quite a while and just due to this fact, it was no joy to be out there. The armchairs on the balcony where full of old stains and even mold! So if you wanted to sit down, a muffy, dirty, moldy armchair was set up to your comfort (as you can see on the pictures I uploaded). When I went down to the front desk, to complain only about the armchairs, I didnâ€™t get an apology, but I was ordered to go back to the suite and wait for housekeeping to bring new chairs. After 45 minutes of waiting, I went down again and asked how long housekeeping would need to bring up new chairs, because I didnâ€™t want to spend the whole evening sitting in the suite. Shortly I was told that they told housekeeping to speed up. Again I waited for over 30 minutes, until housekeeping called just to tell me, that they have no new chairs or any other alternative. So for the third time I went down to the front desk and I was offeredâ€¦ nothing. Instead, I was told to â€œtake it or leave itâ€�. So I decided to check out immediately, without even staying a night at the Fairmont. As the pinnacle of bad service, they didnâ€™t offer me help by the bell desk, so I had to carry my luggage all by myself down into the garage. I do not know, what you expect, when you check in at a grand hotel, but this was the lousiest service I ever experienced. What embarrasses me the most is the thing that the personal didnâ€™t seem to be surprised by the fact, that they have moldy chairs and an unsatisfied customer. Overall they just didnâ€™t care. I even contacted Lucas Schumacher (thatâ€™s the one who asks for contact when you write a review like this on tripadvisor) and that was no good either. He apologized, of course, and offered to make the San Francisco Fairmont management contact me, but guess what, they never did. I take that as the last proof that they really do not care about the customers they have and strongly advise you, not to book at a Fairmont hotel if youâ€™d like to enjoy proper service. Thanks for reading and apologies for my bad English.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Public Areas is What Makes this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loungesong
Reviews.Content: We live in San Francisco and attended a wedding at the Fairmont. As a treat to ourselves we also stayed the night, in room 434 (old tower). Hotel snobs and Four Seasons aficionados will not be impressed by the rooms. Although we had a nice view towards the Financial District, the window, bedroom and bathroom are small by modern standards. The weather was considerably warmer than usual for SF and the air conditioning was not completely up to par to keep the room comfortable. The bathroom has pretty standard amenities and was small for a hotel at this price point. I wouldn't say the room was sparkling clean. The closet furnishings were dusty and some of the furniture was pretty beat up in places. The bed, however, was very comfortable, and we had no complaints about noise. Most of the sheets seemed pretty new except for a very shabby worn out bottom sheet. With all this being said, the grandeur of the public spaces...the lobby, restaurants, ballrooms, etc. is where this hotel shines. There are always people dressed up--coming and going to some special event that really adds an exclamation point to your own experience here. This is a great hotel to use as a rally point for a group in town for a special event or an anniversary. The upkeep of this property must be nightmarish and I'm sure that's where a lot of your nightly rate goes. The valet (20 minutes to get car), check in (15 minutes with only 2 in front of us) , room service (50 minutes for a 1AM pizza), and breakfast buffet (20 minutes waiting with only 1 party ahead of us) were slow for the price. You can really feel the "union" nature of the staff here. They've been here forever and pretty much perform only to their own personalities. At the same time sometimes I tire of the painted smiles other properties insist on. The breakfast buffet at $30 was better than I expected. The Tonga Room has last call just after midnight which surprised us since it was still quite busy. I would not recommend this hotel for business travel as the services are not really set up for speed and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “A 5* Hotel - living on past glories perhaps?”
Reviews.Author: badgerfrombristol
Reviews.Content: We were originally intending to stay in another hotel near Union Square, but were advised by our travel company of some potential disruption due to strike action. So we had the chance to switch to another hotel - and managed to get what we thought was a great deal - 3 nights for 2 at The Fairmont hotel. Five stars no less, so we thought we were on safe ground. On arrival the staff were pleasant enough, we were shown to our room and within 15 minutes realised we would get no sleep at all - the adjoining room was occupied by a screaming baby. We asked to be moved - and duly were - no complaints there. However many of the rooms have connecting doors - hence you can hear much of what goes on in the next room. On our last night we were 'entertained' by our neighbours playing load 'house' music at 2pm - and on the whole noise was a big problem for us. At 4-5pm you got woken up by what sounds like delivery lorries. At around 7-7:30 pm you get more noise from the staff starting to clean adjoining rooms - very noisey and loud - do they not realise there are guests who might actually be resting? This is a 'historic' hotel - but its not modern - and I would expect to be able to get a decents night sleep in a 5* hotel. Won't be back here anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and ambiance!”
Reviews.Author: chris50Boston
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers outstanding service and impressive ambiance. I always stay there when I go to San Franciscpo which is at least a dozen times. It's easy access to all the site. It's on top of Nob Hill with unbelievable views.

Reviews.Title: “Character, location, but at a price”
Reviews.Author: bauwens
Reviews.Content: Grand old name, at the best geographical location in San Francisco. Character and history. We enjoy going for traditional places with history. So we loved our two day stay. Got a room on the fifth floor of the old wing, with a view up California. One has to recognize, however, that this comes at a price. A bit of a gap between the heavy door and the frame; plumbing and doors occasionally a bit noisy. Although windows are single pane (same at the Hyatt Fisherman's wharf BTW), and I heard at least one motorcycle in the morning, in the end it turned out to be OK and we did sleep with no problem. Older plumbing worked very well. As to location, it's nice there sitting right on top of the hill, which is why the Fair daughters picked that place up. Some may not find it convenient, since going more or less anywhere will entail walking a couple of blocks up/down the steep hill. OTOH, both Chinatown and the shopping area are very walkable. We even walked to Japantown, but then we are not afraid of a bit of a walk. If going to Fisherman's wharf, the choice is the cable car, which is fun, or a cab. I hesitated between ranking it four or five. Ideally I would have given it a 4.5. Not quite 5 because of these details.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jccatlady
Reviews.Content: It took us 6 hours to get checked in and we were told no adjoining rooms and yet there were. The hotel was beautiful but I dropped a piece of jewlery and found the corners of the room and edges of the carpet to be pretty nasty with bugs and fuzz. They could do better with house cleaning in the rooms and the conference rooms. Located very centrrally and we were able to walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Still the grande dame”
Reviews.Author: Tyger41
Reviews.Content: She is still the most magnificent hotel in San Francisco. I prefer the old part. Yes, it is a splurge to stay here. But from the moment you enter that lovely lobby, you are welcome. Little wonder that it was one of Clarence Darrow's favorite hotels.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing insitution!”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravDaddy
Reviews.Content: This venerable hotel just keeps getting better! We stayed in a balcony suite in the "old" wing and were charmed by the character of the building. The balcony was huge and we decided to order room service so as not to have to leave the view. The food was excellent; I hear they have a new executve chef. The quiet Nob Hill location was a big plus. The service was top notch from the bell staff to the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “A++++”
Reviews.Author: cumberlandga
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff are wonderful. We were thrilled with the location, staff and room. Our needs were met with a smile and the staff went out of the way to make sure we had all the info. we needed to take in the sights of SF. If you even looked confused in the lobby, a staff member would ask what they could do to help. We ate at the Laurel Court for breakfast and I loved the fresh fruit smoothies on the buffet. The hotel has it's own garden and we had fresh fruit in the room that was delicious and locally grown. We were in the newer towers with an exceptional view when the fog wasn't there to obstruct it. No fault of the hotel, just summer in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: georgia5213
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this lovely location 4 evenings in late August, 2011. We were staying in this city while attending a convention downtown. The location within the city made it extremely easy to visit all the sought after sites. The trolley car stops were just outside both sides of the hotel. We enjoyed eating breakfast in the Laural Court Restaurant, lunch in the Caffe Cento and dinner in the Tongo Room all the food was beyond compare. I really enjoyed reading about the history of the hotel. Our room was wonderful and the bathroom was supurb.

Reviews.Title: “I left my heart or was it my savings in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: CruiserDeluxe
Reviews.Content: It was anniversary time and as we have for 38 years, my wife and I spent it in San Francisco. Over the years our anniversary pilgrimage to SFO has always been looked forward to. We travel to "the City" as those of us in California often call San Francisco for a weekend of fun and exloration. Upon arrival at the Fairmont we were greeted by William one of the Valet attendents. He couldn't have been more helpful. Our check in was quick and efficient. We even got an instant upgrade (Presidents Club you know) from a room in the original hotel to a larger room in the tower. The room couldn't have been nicer with two exceptions. No robes (the ladies like the robes) and placement next to the elevators was not so great. Maybe we would have been better off in our smaller room in the main building. Since we were there to party what's a little whooshing sound coming from the elevator shaft. Breakfast on Saturday was very nice. $68.00 for two people. Don't you just love hotel food prices! Scrambled eggs and toast and of course coffee was extra. I don't blame the Fairmont as all the big city hotels do the same thing. It's just the principal. No inroom coffee was a bit bothersome as my wife really needs her coffee in the morning as do I. They have a small coffee house outside the hotel and down a hill called Cafe Cento. Fair prices and decent breads and rolls. That's where we had breakfast on our second morning at the Fairmont. Saturday evening we went to see Beach Blanket Babylon a decades old show held in the North Beach area. Lots of fun. We thought we would take a cab but were pleased when the hotel offered to drive us in the hotel car. Nice touch! Sunday came to fast and it was time to checkout which we did with ease. My only real complaint was the hotel parking. $52.00 per night plus $14.00 in taxes. Ouch! Really! Really! The Union square hotels don't charge $66.00 per day for parking. I think I could have hired someone to feed a meter for less. Walking up and down those hills will either kill you or stregthen your heart. I'd like to think it is the later. Goodbye to SFO for this year. We will be back next year for number 39.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous comfortable hotel - at the top of a huge hill!”
Reviews.Author: claire276
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Fairmont for 3 nights in August. This is a beautiful hotel right at the top of the very, VERY steep Mason St. Essentially you just need to make sure you get a cab there with your luggage and not walk up like we did!!! The hotel is in a great location. Fisherman Wharf is at the bottom of the hill on one side, and Union Square is at the bottom on the other side. Check-in was fast and friendly. The girl dealing with us took the time to point some landmarks and good places to eat on a map of San Fran. The room was clean and comfortable, with a good sized bathroom. The shower was fantastic! Breakfast wasn't included for us and was expensive to have in the restaurant. The Tonga Room bar and restaurant was great. We had a couple of cocktails there each night before bed. There was a live band there each night of our stay. The food in The Tonga Room was very very tasty, focusing mainly on Asian-style and Polynesian cuisine. All in all we really enjoyed our stay in the Fairmont and would recommend it to anyone looking for an elegant, well-located hotel in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - True Luxury, Real San Francisco Experience”
Reviews.Author: MoveableFeastAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with my husband on a business trip. Amazing staff, great room, beautiful view. Its close to everything, We will definitely be back. The polynesian restaurant is so nostalgic - my parents used to go there when they were dating in the 60's. The band floats out on a "barge" - just a fun place. We only had a weekend getaway, but this was really, really great.

Reviews.Title: “If you need to stay at the best place in town, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: baylorwhite1
Reviews.Content: I have been to San Francisco several times. There are more great hotels to stay at than you can shake a stick at. You can be comfortable in numerous locations. You choose the Failrmont because it is, simply put, the finest hotel in the city. My wife and I were warmly greeted, and found all elements of the service to be excellent. It was my wife's 30th birthday and the staff went out of their way to make it special for her. I'm a big service guy (as my other reviews indicate) and at the Fairmont service comes first. The rooms are comfortable, well appointed, clean, and well sized. Ultimately, you pay the price for really one reason. When you get off the cable car at powell/california or california/mason, and walk into that grand lobby, you know you are staying at the best. If you don't need to feel that, stay somewhere else, there are plenty of nice places around town.
