Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JOD1501
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the beginning of September and were really pleased with the room and facilities. Being really picky, there were no bathrobes provided in our room. The hotel is located at the top of a very steep hill, so not ideal if you're not fit, but taxis are cheap enough (and cheaper than the cable car). We ate in Tonga restaurant in the hotel one night, and were disappointed and would not recommend it. It is a Hawaiian infusion restaurant and the food is very over-priced for what it is (USD25 for a basic stir fry). There are other hotels that are better placed down town or at Fisherman's Wharf if you want to be closer to either of those locations, but I would recommend the Fairmont as it's an iconic hotel - just avoid the restaurant and make the best use of pubic transport/taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Tired - an old-fashioned hotel that needs improvements and updating”
Reviews.Author: SMI64
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Hotel has a classic location and buildings, but fails otherwise to get above average. The rooms are big for a city hotel, but they are very old fashioned and really need freschening up. The carpets and furniture unfortunately feel like they have been in place for 5 years too long. The hotel itself is very big, and unfortunately it feels like a huge machine, without many personal touches. To make a classic, large hotel like this excellent requires investment and unrelenting focus on excellence. Raffles in Singapore, the Peninsula in Hong Kong and others manage it, the Fairmont in San Francisco doesn't. In a hotel that is fairly expensive, things like the price gouging on internet, use of computers, and printing in the business centre feel a little unecessary: surely these types of things are now a utility, and should be made available as such? In general, the meeting and busines facilities are not impressive. Food in the coffee shop and the Tonga room restaurant is also pretty ordinary, and I wouldn't eat there from choice. The room service meal I had was also very ordinary. One big plus was the concierge desk, who gave great recommendations. The concierges seemed to be experienced and excellent. This is not a terrible hotel, and I wasn't unhappy at the end of my stay, but I certainly wouldn't choose it for myself. The building and location deserve to be made more of, and they are currently being wasted. I recently stayed in the Hotel Vitale, near the Ferry Building (which I have also reviewed) and it was clearly preferable: a less beautiful building, but great rooms and food, more personal service, and as good a location.

Reviews.Title: “Great use of our Disney Vacation Club Points”
Reviews.Author: russell-benoit
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is beautiful, historic, in a great location, and has wonderful friendly staff. The food on the (granted expensive) breakfast buffet was wonderful, and we all ate too much of it. The view from the rooftop garden is beautiful on a clear day. We were on the 22nd floor, and had an unbelieveable view from our room. We kept the curtains open at night because it was just so beautiful to look at. San Francisco was our night light. We got great recommendations from the staff on places to eat within walking distance...a local small Italian restaurant around the corner (very good!), a restaurant down the hill in Chinatown. The Fairmont is within easy walking distance of Union Square (Nike Store a hit with our teenage boys) which has more restaurants as well. A staff member heard me asking in the hotel shop if they had earplugs, because one of our sons was snoring. The shop didn't have earplugs, but he volunteered to bring us some (for no charge)...and made it back to our room with 8 sets before we arrived. We had a car, and were doing a lot of in and out...the valets were friendly, knowledgeable,gave good directions, and the car always arrived quickly. My only complaint was that they told us breakfast was free when we checked in, but didn't tell us it was only free for two of the four of us. We had to straighten that out at the front desk. Still overall, it was a great use of our Disney Vacation Club points.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the 38 year wait!”
Reviews.Author: Unicorn50
Reviews.Content: I had always dreamed of staying at the Fairmont since I was a little girl, and it lived up to all my expectations. From arriving, the helpful door staff took my luggage and it was delivered promptly to my room. Check in was a delight and fast! With a suprise of an upgrade to the 21st floor of the tower with dual aspect windows over looking SF. Nothing was too much trouble and the concierge staff and Bell team friendly and answered all my questions with humour and knowledge. I had a beautiful chocolate box delivered courtesy of the hotel with a super letter welcoming me to the hotel. A truly memorable trip and worth waiting for.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and overrated”
Reviews.Author: Adkitz
Reviews.Content: There are too many choices in his area for this hotel to charge for wifi and for access to the fitness room. I travel to San fran all the time and I will avoid this one and go back to the smaller hotels with the same size rooms but I get free wifi and fitness access

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, though a little surprised...”
Reviews.Author: LadyBlue67
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Hotel is a beautiful historic place with a gorgeous lobby and ballroom. Our room was very nice...be sure to join the Fairmont President's Club for internet access, or else you will be charged a daily fee. The bell service was excellent, and overall our service was what you would expect from a high end hotel. We had one surprise, however...we were at the hotel attending a wedding, and the wedding party had provided wonderful gift bags for each guest with snacks and drinks. Unfortunately, the hotel staff gave us the incorrect gift bag (it had someone else's name on it), so we called the front desk to inform them of the error. They forwarded our call to several people, then said they would come up to retrieve the bag and bring us the correct one. It was very late at night, and after 20 minutes, someone finally came up to get the bag but did not have a replacement one for us. They said we would have to wait another 20 minutes for someone else to bring ours to us. After waiting almost 30 minutes, we decided to go to bed. The next morning we inquired at the front desk about our gift bag and were told they did not know where it was. We understand that things like this can happen and were not upset, but we were surprised that the only response was a smile and a "sorry". At such a nice establishment, when the error was clearly theirs, we thought it might have been nice to offer us a box of complimentary snacks...instead, we were charged the standard $12 per box of nuts when we found ourselves getting hungry in our room. The gift bag contained snacks and bottles of water which was obviously the wedding party's way of helping to avoid such extra costs. Overall, our experience was nice, but the lack of consideration given in this matter left us with a slightly sour taste in our mouths (and a hungry belly!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Amber J
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the fairmont but beware the charge to park your car is 70/day. The hotel is gorgeous and the rooms are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: Hopefullylost
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first couple days of my honeymoon and was generally underwhelmed with the hotel. While the location is great, and the view from our room was great too, the over all experience was very bland and forgettable and the service of the doormen/bellmen was terrible. Upon arrival two bellmen actually watched us haul our suitcases up the drive and through the doors without even an offer of assistance. Not impressed. Overall, I left with the impression that this is a good business hotel, or if you are a senior citizen but if you are looking for more personal service and an overall more San Fran experience, spend you money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A great sanctuary in the middle of San Francisco but please drop the Breakfast Cover Charge”
Reviews.Author: TheRoadWarrior_69
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont to attend the Salesforce.com Dreamforce Conference, and found it to be a great place to get away from the crowds and relax after the shock-and-awe experience of the conference. The front desk staff is truly outstanding, they worked with my travel plans beforehand, allowed me to check in early after a very late night/early morning flight, and were gracious. The problems I have with this hotel are as follows: 1. Breakfast Cover Charge - OK, it is not really a coverage charge, but gratuity is AUTOMATICALLY included in your breakfast tab if you eat in their dining room. Mine was $4.50 and all I ordered was a simple, middle-priced omelet. It gets better, there is also a BREAKFAST SURCHARGE - yes that's right, there is a charge just for eating in that hallowed dining room. Never heard of such a thing. Don't eat breakfast in the dining room unless you are own-your-won GulfStream rich or you have an amazingly high per diem for reimbursement of dining on the road. 2. Ray the bellman, you need an attitude adjustment hour. Customers make paychecks possible, they are not there to be ordered around.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: wilton3
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week at the Fairmont and was extremely pleased with the hotel. We chose the outside, king room category in the older part of the hotel and recommend it to anyone looking for a spacious, quiet room. There is a second door which closes off the hallway and bathroom (and any noise from the neighbors). Bedding is very comfortable and bathroom is quite clean. Hotel employees were courteous and friendly. The lobby is fabulous and worth seeing no matter where you stay. The neighborhood of my hotel is very important to me and I felt safe here day and night. Other hotels in busier parts of the city did not seem as trouble-free. Food is outrageously expensive--but it's expected in a city hotel. Skip the Tonga Room for dinner--just go for a drink in the afternoon. Cross the street and go to the Top of the Mark in the early afternoon for drinks with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary stay- very good, but not stellar”
Reviews.Author: jandollar
Reviews.Content: This was a first stay for us, and we were celebrating our 35 th anniversary. They were kind enough to upgrade our room to a Signature Tower King, with sweeping views of the bay. This was not a huge upgrade, just the next step above what we already paid for. While it was only the 5th floor, the view was indeed magnificent with a large picture window. We had unobstructed views od Coit Tower, Fisherman's Wharf, Alcatraz, and beyond. Then the fog rolled in, giving us a view of gray. But, we can't fault the Fairmont for that. Plus, as the night wore on, some of the fog lifted and we could take in the city lights. Even only 5 floors up, we were far enough away from street noise for the most part. We could hear the clanging of the cable car bells (they run on both California and Mason Streets, so two sides of the hotel get the effect). But, they do not run that often, and we like the sound of the cable cars. We could not hear the grinding of the cables or the screeching of the brakes, so that was good! The room was spacious even though it was not a suite, and we liked the decor. Too bad there was no telescope in the room and the window was soert of dirty. The bed was comfy and we were able to connect my iPad to the LCD TV to watch Netflix movies. We were disappointed to find we were given a handicap room (no we didn't ask for one), which in this hotel means no bathtub and no shower stall. Yep, this was the full "roll in" shower with a seat accessible by wheel chair. Sort of like a hospital shower, made fancy with marble tiles. Not my idea of romance, but by the time we discovered it, we were unpacked and relaxing. Otherwise, I would have asked for a different room. I had read other reviews, so I knew to look out for this, but the mini-bar goodies are "wired" to be automatically charged to your room as soon as you pick them up. So no looky-loos on the snacks and drinks. They have them set up on a little teeter totter thing that senses the change in weight, and there literally is a wire coming from the pad to behind the TV. The one out in the open even has a little teddy bear in a box, I guess to attract any kids you may have brought along. There is another in the top drawer of the armoire with more snacks. You'd thing there'd be a warning sign on this attractive nusiance, but no. There must have been a price list somewhere, but I did not dig around for it. I didn't even open the fridge to see what was in there. I would think at the rates they charge, they could just have housekeeping keep tabs. Room service was expensive, as expected, but they add 20% gratuity, plus $5 service charge (as opposed to the more typical 15-18%). That said, we had room service for breakfast ($54 for two), and we were pleased with our meal. We had one order each of strawberries, mangoes and banana bread (house made), and a full pot of coffee. There were two large slices of the banana bread, plenty for two people. Sure, we paid more than we would in the Laurel Court restaurant downstairs, but we got to enjoy our million dollar view with our breakfast this way. We had dinner in the Tonga Room, early before the band began because we wanted to be able to talk during dinner. Rather than ordering entrees, we each had seared opa salads, shared an appetizer platter, and a side of fried "shaka" rice. We were given a volcano dessert complimentary for our anniversary. We had read that the food was not very good, but we enjoyed what we ordered very much. We loved the kitchy feel and the fake thunderstorms. The decor was well thout out and not at all tacky. Better than Trader Vic's I think. We got a poolside seat, so when it rained, we actually felt a cooling breeze from the falling water. If you cannot suspend your disbelief to enjoy the fun, I guess you are a snob or depressed. Whatever. The location was very nice, even with the very steep hills (the better to walk off those spring rolls!). We arrived by Bart from the East Bay, getting off at the Embarcadero Station. The Powell Station is closer, but they say the hill is steeper. We had lunch in the Financial District before walking up through Chinatown and on up Nob Hill. Since we were staying only one night, we only needed a small overnight bag each. So, overall, we thought the SF Fairmont was classy, historic, and memorable. But, it was not a perfect stay (handicap bathroom).

Reviews.Title: “Nice, fancy hotel”
Reviews.Author: facebook6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night. Very impressed. Great attention to detail, clean rooms, most important to me was the clean bathroom. And that's not expected from a hotel. Bed was super comfortable. Down side was no refridgerator in the room, no pool if your taking little ones, and no shuttle. take walking shoes ladies, not flip flops! Its a nice walk down to pier 39 but definently need a cab back up those steep hills. Taxi to union square is cheaper than the cable car. We paid $6 to get to the shops! Take an ice chest with your drinks. We will stay again, soon!

Reviews.Title: “I'm paying $230 a night and wake up to slamming doors and chatty neighbors each morning?”
Reviews.Author: Vinsured
Reviews.Content: Yes the title sounds a bit harsh, but it honestly ruined my whole experience at the Fairmont. It's beautiful historic hotel, a touch of class at every turn. The standard rooms are small but this is SF and that's how rooms are, but they are clean comfortable and have one of the best showers i've ever used....but the noise.... The rooms have large thick wooden doors, very classy but very annoying starting at 7am each day when people enter and exit. When the door slams it echoes throughout the hall. And for as thick as they are they are very soundproof. I could hear housekeeping and other patrons clearly right through the door. I also had a room with a door that was shared with another room (a split if someone got it) I could hear couple next door talking clearly as if i was in the room with them. Even better when they left and you could hear housekeeping vacuum and clean as if they were next to your bed. Like i said, it's beautiful and historic. But for the price I'd expect a quiet peaceful morning. I'll go elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Maginificent As Always”
Reviews.Author: guest1420
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent second stay here last week at the Fairmont. The lobby is a stunner and simply glows with yellow marble and generous heapings of gold guilt on the intricately designed columns and coffered ceilings. This time we were placed in a main floor suite which was a very large space with a lovely view of Coit Tower and the Bay. The two bathrooms are not large but very well decorated again with golden marble. I note there is some criticism of the Nob Hill location but I personally liked being higher up in a picturesque, exclusive, quiet neighbourhood above and away from all the noise, traffic and tourist trap activity of Union Square down below. We found some great restaurants in Nob Hill as well: the nearby Nob Hill Cafe and a number along Hyde Street - definitely better than the tourist traps at Union Square and Fisherman's Wharf. Service at the hotel was very good as it should be with a Fairmont. We tried the "happy hour" at the Tonga Room where cocktails were a very good deal and not watered down at all. Tea and desert at the Laurel Room was good. The workout facilities are not offered by the Fairmont and they were not as great as at other Fairmonts. There was the notable absence of attentive service in the gym, the iced cucumbered water and plush towels normally experienced at a Fairmont gym. That was really my only complaint but as it wasn't part of the Fairmont I won't lower the rating for the hotel as a whole. The gym, internet and local calls are free if you sign up for the President's Club membership. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: jndscuba
Reviews.Content: We booked the room online 4 months in advance. Upon arrival, it was not the room as described on the internet. There had been previous calls to the hotel itself confirming what the room looked like. It was a suite they originally tried to put us in but the layout was different from the suite we booked online. Management did tell us that each room was different and reiterated multiple times that this was an older hotel (does that mean unclean?). The room they tried to place us in was dirty. The carpet was dirty and the patio had obviously had many pigeons roosting the night before. Management was not interested in making things right, even though we talked with two managers and called their headquarters by phone. Management even agreed that the photo on the internet was not the same room (bait and switch) We had never been treated with such careless and "take it or leave it" attitudes. The lobby was adequate, although, some couches were stained. The service in the restaurant was slow and the food was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...away from the hustle and bustle.”
Reviews.Author: nrsimmons
Reviews.Content: Just got back from three nights at The Fairmont San Francisco. I stayed here with my three year old daughter. A short little vacation for the two of us. We stayed in the Zanzibar Suite, room 436. The room had a balcony and was very clean. I do not have any names, but the staff was very, very, very, very nice and went out of their way to help me in anyway they could. The hotel is located in Nob Hill which is away from all of the major SF landmarks. Not far, but just a chore because we had to take the car out anytime we wanted to go somewhere. I'd advise walking the city and the area around the hotel if you are up for it. Beware! The hotel is situated in an abnormally hilly part of SF. Since I know my three year old gets tired easily, driving our rental car was the only option. Another beware...valet parking at the hotel is $52 per night! Yikes! I knew this going into it, but I'm just giving everyone else a heads up. Overall, this was a fantastic hotel in San Francisco. I'd definitely stay here again and I will recommend it to family and friends. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Classic luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelloverLondon
Reviews.Content: We ended our US trip with three nights at the Fairmont. The hotel has an impressive lobby, excellent service, well appointed rooms and good restaurants. The concierge service was really helpful - they booked us tickets to see Beach Blanket Babylon (highly recommended) and a table at a R&G Lounge in China Town (good quality food). We ate at the Tonga Room in the hotel on our last evening - this was a really good fun restaurant with live music and even 'rainstorms' at regular intervals. One of the corridors from the main lobby has interesting history about the hotel - well worth a quick look. The only problem was that the hotel is right at the top of the hill - so quite a climb!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmiW95
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of July. All in all it was a wonderful experience which we could not fault. We thoroughly enjoyed this grand hotel which is in a superb setting on Nob Hill. Special praise must go to Rowena and Megan on reception whose levels of customer service were second to none. When we arrived our room was not ready. They upgraded our room to a corner room on the fourth floor which offered wonderful views of the city both day and night. On our return to the hotel after an afternoon's sightseeing in the city our room was still not ready and Megan arranged for free drinks and appetisers in the Laurel Court bar The coffee shop in the hotel was great and we enjoyed the Tonga Room experience.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vin004
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, historic hotel. I've stayed here twice. The room in the new tower was very nice with stunning views of the city. The room in the main hotel was just ok and a bit of a let down after the tower. I will insist on a tower room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great lobby but that's about all!”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaE
Reviews.Content: Booked for our honeymoon based on the Fairmont reputation. The room was average- no coffee making facilities, small bathroom. The shower was appalling, nothing more than a pathetic drip, as a woman with long hair it made washing it a nightmare! You could hear the hot water pipes banging from other guestrooms. I've stayed in many high end hotels worldwide with work for the last ten years, this was a let down. The location was ok if you didn't mind the 3 very steep hills back from union square- you do expect this inSan Fran but there are better located properties for the Union Square area.

Reviews.Title: “Classical Elegance atop Nob Hill”
Reviews.Author: easytraveller68
Reviews.Content: I saw the Fairmont years ago when I had previously visited the city and decided that I would stay there when I finally made it back to San Francisco. I was not disappointed at all. It is a beautiful hotel that is in immaculate condition. With the exception of a disappointing check in the staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms were very clean surprisingly spacious given the age of the hotel, and the beds and pillows were the most comfortable I have ever experienced in a hotel. The location is also nice in that it is very quiet at night and the views of the city are wonderful....note: We also stayed at a hotel in Union Square and could not get any sleep for all the noise at night. Things to note: The hotel itself is located at the top of Nob Hill and as such do not expect to walk from the hotel to the wharf or any other locations in the downtown area from the hotel...it is simply too steep. Also, don't expect to take the cable car which stops very nearby the hotel. Every time it went by, it was jam packed with tourists and would not stop to let people on. We tried walking further down the route in the hopes of getting on sooner but had no luck. Thankfully cab rides are not expensive in the city and we ended up spending only a small amount more than if we had bought an all day transit pass and did not have to wait the 45 min to an hour for a cable car. If you stay at the Fairmont make sure you grab dinner one night at the Nob Hill cafe which is only two blocks away. Fantastic authentic Italian food at good prices and you do not have to travel into the city for once....just be prepared to wait outside for a long time for a table.

Reviews.Title: “Bit out of the way but very, very nice”
Reviews.Author: Blue_Speke
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the final stage of our honeymoon and having streched the budget for 5* up to now decided not to downgrade, we weren't disappionted. This feels like an historic hotel and is very grand inside. The staff were welcoming and upgraded us without our asking, a great start! The hotel is quite expensie, including drinks and good, but you are paying for the grandeur, we thought it was worth it. The only downside is the location, Nobb Hill is a little out of the way on the holl overlooking the bay, great for views of the bridge and the rock, but it does mean you can't walk out of the hotel and straight into a bar or resturant. Having said that there is a street car stop right outside so getting around is easy enough. Union square is walkable from the hotel as it's downhill, but getting back from the there is strenous exercise if you aren't in a cab / street car. We would definatley stay again were we ever lucky enough to return to this fantastic city!

Reviews.Title: “Waste of a great architecture”
Reviews.Author: Pabs_HK
Reviews.Content: Great exterior facade as well as for the lobby and outlets. The rooms are a dive; service is sh1t. Never staying here again ever!

Reviews.Title: “Great! A 4.5”
Reviews.Author: 1ColetteMarie
Reviews.Content: We went through work but it was 99% leisure. Entering the hotel was amazing with the architecture and large, gold pillars. The rooms were very nice, especially the up-to-date bathroom. Great view from the room and very quiet. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. It's doable to walk down to the pier from the hotel. My only complaints -- the carpet could use a good cleaning and every day after housekeeping cleaned we would find multiple hairs in the bathroom that clearly didn't belong to us. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. Great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Of course it's pricey but loved the history and service”
Reviews.Author: MBradbury33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to San Francisco for a couples get-away weekend and had a fabulous time. We had a chance meeting with my sister-in-law who lives in Denver but was in SF for a Napa marathon. She FourSquared at the Tonga Room when we were returning from Chez Panisse and we spent the rest of the night having beverages there and in the main lobby bar. The next morning we had coffee in the hotel's pastry shop and we jumped a trolly car for Fishermans Wharf and an Alcatraz tour. This hotel is historic, beautiful, fun, and centrally located to everywhere you'd want to be. I can't complain about the price because I just expected it since it was in SF.

Reviews.Title: “To quote Flava Flav: Don't believe the hype!”
Reviews.Author: Kostaki77
Reviews.Content: When you first enter the lobby, your jaw drops. It reminded me of the DirectTV commercial with the Russian oligarch (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rkB9OT2XVvA). It definitely was opulent, but that wasn't the case with the room. The room was small, we had a view of the building's a/c units, and the ceiling was falling apart in the room (check out the photos we uploaded). We booked the room using credit card points and wonder if that is why they gave us this sub-par room. One plus about this hotel is that it's close to some pretty neat areas. The surrounding area has real steep hills that are physically challenging. It may not be the ideal place if you plan on exploring the area on foot. Your money can go much further elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Your paying for a name”
Reviews.Author: TravelFoodBeachFun
Reviews.Content: Fairmont Hotel San Francisco The hotel is a 4 star hotel that I got at the rate of $207.00. Rates went up to $695. Parking was $52.00 p/n & breakfast in the main cafÃ© in the mhotel is $30 per person. No coffee in the room so you are forced to purchase in one of the cafes. There is a $!5.00 charge to use the fitness center. My partner used the sauna and was very disappointed in how dirty it was, old and had broken fixtures. He has planned on showering & getting ready down there after his steam but couldnâ€™t bear it. No free wifi unless you are a Presidentâ€™s Club member (I am but forgot to tell them at check in). Show them your foursquare check in & free room upgrade if available. The room 259 has no view. Because of my rate, I got this terrible view. I tried to change it but it was going to be $30-$75. The hotel was almost sold out so, they couldnâ€™t upgrade. The room has very large ceilings, a walk in closet, small counter space in bathroom but itâ€™s nice. I wouldnâ€™t come back here if I was just using the room. The hotel is gorgeous otherwise and very historical. Be sure to go on a Wednesday so you can go to the Tonga Room which has a pool in the middle of the restaurant. The hotel is in a great location, 3 blocks down from China Town. We ate a R&N Lounge which was very busy and had good food, especially their spareribs. Itâ€™s located 25 minutes from the SFO Airport and about 15 minutes from the Golden Gate Bridge. There are two Fairmont Hotels, the other is in Ghiradelli Square and is three times the rate.

Reviews.Title: “breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: wanatue
Reviews.Content: people wait on you in an instant, front desk personel were very professinal and the place is just breathtaking, it has class and we could tell that is the way they keep it. We had a room overlooking the city and could see Alkatraz. This is a place we will never forget. If you like older hotels this is a classic, I checked out the history before we arrived and the place has alot of things that have happened and very famous people that have stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO”
Reviews.Author: david s
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby, But beware Tonga Bar room is a joke, Buffett you can get a Jack in box, no replys from management on complaints, even room upgrades as promised, Presidents club is a Joke. Hotel is for sale and you wonder why? Tower Rest is closed and food needs a lot of help. Housekeeping very clean beds and towels. Front desk needs training on how to fix the bill when checking out, over one hour to correct 600.00 in over charges.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: buffling
Reviews.Content: I love Fairmont hotels, and this one is no exception. It is located walking distance from Union Square and is a stately, grand hotel. I did not see any that would be much competition, so if you want the "best" in SF, my guess is that it would be this hotel. We had a garden view and the view was not great but it was not bad either. The biggest disappointment is that we never got to experience the "thunderstorm" of the bar! If you don't know what I am talking about, the bar there is supposedly great--with fake rain and thunderstorms, etc. It was closed (I think for private events--?) the 3 nights we stayed. I was not happy about that. However, there are other bars in the hotel that are nice. The breakfast buffet is $$$, but it is pretty good. A very famous celebrity was staying there at the same time we were, and during my birthday breakfast I realized he was sitting right next to us, so that was kind of fun. The bath faucet was broken so they comped some of our drinks on our bill, and that was nice of the mgt to do. Also, they had the most amazing mirror that I ended up tracking down and buying for my house (you know one of those wall mirrors that lights up), so I will always love FM SF for that! The bed was comfy and the lobby, as you can see in all the photos, is over the top amazing. BTW, funny story: Our cab driver drove us through Tenderloin to get there from the airport, and I was so scared! I think he was doing a drive by drug deal b/c he called someone on the phone and then threw something out the window to a guy. SF is funny that way; you have this magnificent hotel but if you wonder too far away, you get caught in the scariest neighborhood I have ever seen in my life! We went to the symphony, which was nice and of course I love Golden Gate Park. I did not experience any amazing food in SF, which is too bad. Oh, there is a rental car company in the lobby, which is really helpful! I did not give the hotel 5 stars just because of the bar being closed (I was really looking forward to that!) and the broken faucet (oh and the first room they put us in smelled like smoke, so the door person opened a different room for us. Nice service there. She was a consistently good employee over our visit)...however, it is a great hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “luxurious hotel - beautiful rooms.”
Reviews.Author: NZkiwiGAL
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the one used in the 1980's tv series "Hotel" Our room was beautiful and felt almost opulent. Bed was very comfortable. Separate bathroom was beautiful (marble floor and nice fittings) Everything was top notch. No coffee making facilities etc in the room though as I suppose being such a flash hotel they would expect that you don't want to make your own coffee but would want it made for you. There is a restaurant downstairs and a cafe serving nice coffee. A lovely surprise is the Free coffee they supply in the foyer between 4:30am - 7:00 am each morning for the guests that jog or go to the gym etc. Nice touch for us as one day we left early (6:15am) for a coach tour. Wi fi free only if you join up to their Presidents Club which was very easy to do. Location is ok... at the top of a hill (Nob Hill) so is easy to walk down to Chinatown etc, but you wouldn't want to walk back up! (Too steep) We cab'd to Fishermans Wharf as its a bit of a walk. All staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: B-CRoamWorld
Reviews.Content: This centrally located hotel was great and out of the hustle and bustle of some of the City's other districts. The public rooms were very comfortable and really enjoyed the palm court bar including the service and food at the bar. Note that this is the place to get a late night snack after the other restaurants have closed

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: crs10257
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, it was a great stay. The staff was always pleasant, the views were amazing, the bed was comfortable. Only 2 minor complaints; we couldn't get the room cold enough. I always like my room at about 60, but if you don't mind 65 or above then it's fine. The 2nd was the Tonga room, very outdated, food was just so-so. However the lead female singer was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant stay”
Reviews.Author: Adam M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in May so my experience was somewhat limited. As others have noted, the hotel is elegant with a large, beautiful lobby. The room was very nice but nothing particularly memorable- a large desk to work at, comfortable bed, nice bath. All the interactions with the staff were great- especially very early in the morning as they helped me flag down a car to get to the airport. I would recommend the hotel to anyone that likes a more classic styling/luxury property.

Reviews.Title: “Classic luxury atop nob hill!”
Reviews.Author: Theresafromnorway
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from 19-24th Dec 2010. Originally booked a suite in the more modern Dobson tower, but it wasn't possible to open a window, so I moved to a deluxe room in the older part of the hotel. My room looked out over San Francisco Bay. I couldn't see Golden Gate Bridge, but I had a wonderful view if Coit Tower and could see Alcatraz in the distance. I had stayed at the Fairmont once before, in June 1991, when I was living in Morganhill, for the weekend, as I was running San Francisco marathon. I remember promising myself I would go back some day for a vacation. 20 years on, the Fairmont did not disappoint! The hotel was beautifully decorated for Christmas, with a HUGE tree and a full-size gingerbread house! People were coming into the foyer from the street, just to have their photo taken beside the tree. There was a feeling of being part of an olde worlde setting, in plush, beautiful surroundings, where service was given with effortless ease. The breakfast buffet was amazong, with a wide range of choice to suit every taste, and the letter of welcome in the room on arrival was a lovely touch. The concierge was knowledgeable and extremely helpful, and the whole experience was just unforgettable. If you are looking for a modern, impersonal place to stay, don't stay here. But if you are looking for something classic and special, with more than a hint of luxury, and you fancy stepping into the splendour of bygone San Francisco, then the Fairmont is the place for you. Would go back in a heartbeat - and intend to do so next year!

Reviews.Title: “My second time there but not my last!”
Reviews.Author: nellymty
Reviews.Content: I went last January to attend a Meeting but I also took my husband with me to enjoy the city of San Francisco. The hotel architecture is wonderful and a place to visit even if you are not staying there. The first time I stayed here I booked through Hotels.com and got a great spacious room in the main building. This time we got a small king size bed room but I asked if there were any other available room and immediately another room, with not a nice view but bigger. I also got the chance to see a room of a fellow who got a room in the tower and that was a view! Even it is not that close from Union square and is really uphill, you can always take a cable car and enjoy the ride! The service was amazing, they were always helpful and they got a rental car company in the building. The restaurant was great, I just had breakfast and asked for room service also. Regarding my business trip,The meeting was held there and meeting rooms are spacious and well equipped. If your planning to go sight seeing buy a card that includes muni and cable cars for the days you are staying., it is so worth the value! You can buy this card at Union square of in the Tourists Information office.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, would probably try the Mandarin the next time”
Reviews.Author: Wilderpoland
Reviews.Content: Pros Great view and location, Nice rooms, Cons Valet parking very expensive Slow check in No free wifi Would have rated higher but they missed cleaning our room the first day of three. When I called reception the lady was unfriendly and unhelpful, made it out to be my issue that we must have had the do not disturb sign out. Hotel gave wifi for free, which was not enough, as you can get free wifi signing up to join the Presidents Club.

Reviews.Title: “Tied and trading on the past.”
Reviews.Author: peter1928
Reviews.Content: When you arrive, the reception area, and the restaurant are nicely decorated. the service is prompt and welcoming. But behind that, this hotel is tiered and quite drab, our room was on the second floor, and had two connecting doors, one each side, all the doors were badly fitted, with large gaps all around, allowing lots of light and noise in to the room, we could hear mobile phones and electric shavers from 5am. There are no tea or coffee making facilities in the room, so you have to use room service, which can be expensive, or go on a route march to the cafe. In the morning when we came down to breakfast, we were told there would be an half hour wait, so we found a little restaurant just down the hill, that was very accomodating. However this hotel is well located, and the evening meal in the restaurant was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “I have no idea why anyone gives this hotel 4 stars.”
Reviews.Author: AKN_10
Reviews.Content: Where to begin. The hotel is dated, overpriced, and tacky. I felt like I was staying in the hotel from The Shining. The rooms are falling apart--none of the appliances work, and my sink and shower were clogged. Seriously, I didn't want to touch anything because it all looked dirty. The closet is weird, too. I called to ask for laundry bags, which they said they couldn't do. Seriously, no plastic bags? They have those at a Motel 6. You hear every door open and close in the hallway. I would never EVER stay here again. Pay a little more and stay at the Four Seasons. You won't feel disgusted every time you walk into your room. Oh, and they screwed up my reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel for exploring San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Zeusco
Reviews.Content: Situated on the top of Nob Hill this hotel still retains the grandeur of bygone years and the entrance lobby is well worth seeing if you are in the vicinity. We stayed here for a few days before driving north through Oregon and Washington State into Canada. Our room in the Tower had views out to Alcatraz and we would sit watching dusk fall over the Bay as the lights came on each evening. Hotel service was impeccable and our room was well appointed with a huge bathroom. Strong leg muscles are an advantage as the surrounding hills are very steep but Fisherman's Wharf is only a twenty minute stroll downhill and there are two cable car lines to bring you back at the end of the day. Union Square and Chinatown are ten minutes stroll away and there is valet parking available. We would recommend booking tickets for Alcatraz well in advance of a visit and enjoyed taking the ferry trip across the Bay to Sausalito and climbing to the top of Coit Tower to get wonderful views of our favourite city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: MohammedUAE
Reviews.Content: After a long trip we are glad to have stayed in the Fairmont, location was good, service was nice they looked after us, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for seeing San Francisco if you are a fan of grand hotels”
Reviews.Author: John_mytravels
Reviews.Content: Honesty says that I should start by saying I am not a great fan on large, traditional hotels. That said, the Fairmont does the model very well and the staff were impeccable. It is a classic large hotel. The is little "shelter" for the normal guest from large corporate functions, which upsets some of the classic charm of the hotel. That said, the prices at the hotel are very reasonable. The franchised out gym was a real quality disappointment and the Hawian themed restaurant, an absolute disaster..but then I am sure most people will eat out.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: robertogiammanco
Reviews.Content: really confortable, nuce room, wonderfull hall. Lovely breakfast and perfect service. Go to the last floor, there is a wonderful view.

Reviews.Title: “quintessential San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: PhiladelphiaMom2boys
Reviews.Content: The perfect hotel for enjoying everything San Fran has to offer! Spectacular views, amazing history, beautiful comfortable spacious rooms, lavish lobby, great bar. I really can't think of a bad thing to say. We were upgraded to a room with a view of the entire city, I could have just spent our weekend sitting at the window of our room! Yes, it's on a hill, so is the entire city! Just jump on the trolley car to get where you want to go, it's right outside. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel in a prestige location but disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: K8tylou
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nights as part of our honeymoon. the reception and lobby are very grand. the breakfast was fab, lots to choose from. location in Nob Hill is great as only a short walk to most areas. would definately recommend. only downside was our standard room was small.

Reviews.Title: “Very well run, historic property”
Reviews.Author: MOTraveler010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on business and really enjoyed it! It's such a beautiful building and the views are spectacular. The hotel is very well maintained and feels very grand. Had a signature room in the Tower part of the hotel and it was wonderful - tons of windows with great views, big bathroom, very pretty. I enjoyed the Laurel Court and even grabbed a cocktail in the Tonga Room (which is a hoot and a must see if you are staying here). The fitness center is a nice perk and free if you are in the Fairmont President's Club. Overall - the only drawback - which may not be a drawback for all - the location atop Nob Hill, while quiet, is isolated. There aren't really any shops or restaurants within walking distance unless you want to traverse down the hill (and then back up again). Everything is but a short cab or trolley ride away - but those who prefer to walk to places when traveliing may be disappointed. A great hotel in a great city - a real piece of history!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hilltop retreat”
Reviews.Author: Fredtheneedle57
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 days here as a base for attending the four Wagner Ring Cycle operas at San Francisco Opera House. It was pretty close to a perfect hotel for us. It was built by the Fair sisters (their actual name) around 1900, using their father's silver-mining money, and is the first of the Fairmont chain. It survived the great earthquake of 1904, largely because it was built on solid rock, so you can sleep easy in your bed! It has a classic exterior and interior, and was beautifully restored by the famous California architect Julia Morgan (who also designed the Hearst Castle, San Simeon). The lobby is one of the greatest in the world, and worth a look even if you don't stay there, built of solid honey-coloured marble (real not faux). The breakfast room/bar has been restored back to its gorgeous original state, although the stained-glass domes no longer let in external light. There are several delightful 1930s murals illustrating circus acts in the Circus Room (an old bar I think). There is a large roof garden with palm trees etc from which one can see Fisherman's Wharf and Alcatraz. They have their own bee colony! There is a Polynesian-style bar which is a famous SF nightspot and has been around a long time (more than 60 years I think). Many presidents and other dignitaries have stayed at the hotel, and some of these occasions are shown in a photo gallery. The original charter of the League of Nations was signed here. The hotel is probably the highest structure in San Francisco, on what is called "Nob Hill", yet it is only 2 blocks to Chinatown, and a 20 minute walk to Union Square or the Ferry Terminal. Two cable car lines and several bus lines stop within a block of the hotel. We went to some fabulous restaurants, not too far away, of which the top three were 1.Masa's, 2.Michael Mina and 3.Jardiniere (the latter being conveniently close to the Opera House). The Slanted Door (modern Vietnamese fusion) in the Ferry Building also gets honourable mention (and is much less expensive). We breakfasted in the hotel every day: although it is a tad expensive, we thought the fine food and service and the relaxed setting were well worth it, and they don't mind if you linger and read a paper or do a crossword. Top museum visits were MOMA and the Museum of Asian Art, both must-sees for culture hounds.

Reviews.Title: “Short trip to San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: mtangulo
Reviews.Content: Nice "high end" hotel, slow check in, nice polite staff, good location, No coffee maker in room. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pjb75
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with gorgeous views of the bay! Friendly staff, good service, good location. This was our second visit to San Francisco and our second stay at the Fabulous Fairmont! Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous landmark hotel. Hills abound!”
Reviews.Author: IluvtravNewJerseyJ
Reviews.Content: Great beautiful hotel. So much history - it seems everyone you have ever read about stayed here. The rooms are gorgeous, best amenities. Expensive! Parking is probably the most expensive in the whole city! The area is quiet and the hills are everywhere. Nob Hill! I loved the hotel but would stay somewhere else if you care for being out of breath everytime you stroll anywhere. Pro: Cable car is right outside the door. Con: not much of other eatery choices close by.

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont is history - great history”
Reviews.Author: MCHBurgess
Reviews.Content: After 20 years, we returned to San Fran to celebrate our honeymoon trip of 1991. Where we had stayed in a small boutique hotel the first time, our graduation to the top of the hill (Knob HIll) was absolutely outstanding. This is the original Fairmont. Elegant, rococo, sophisticated. The hallways are lined with the pictorial history of the hotel, and we got a slight shiver from the romance and the passion of a great hotel with millions of stories to tell. The rooms are equally charming. The front desk and concierge smooth and polished. We knew nothing of the Tonga Room when we arrived. In fact, just going for a walk around the block, we chanced upon a side door near the rear of the hotel. Peeked in. A south seas motif, with a large pool of blue water in the middle. It reminded us of the Polynesian Room at the old Ports of Call in Toronto in the 60's crossed with the Tiki Room at Disneyland. It promised a bit of fun, and likely tourist food to boot. Wrong on one front. It WAS fun, the place was packed, and the food was marvellous. And at 9 pm, the reflecting pool (for that's what we thought it was) came alive with music and a band floated along it on some kind of barge. As it turns out, the Tonga Room is the old basement swimming pool area which, in the 50's, had a cafe added around it, so that bathers could stay poolside and enjoy a bite and a drink. This was such a successful idea that the restaurant was expanded and the pool became a thematic centrepiece instead of a place to swim. The Tonga Room is actually famous, and maps of San Fran show it - without mentioning the name Fairmont. Although it's atop Knob Hill, and the streets in every direction are steeply downhill, the rear of the hotel is on Powell Street, and you can catch a cable car right there to go either downtown or to the wharf area. In the third direction you can get a cable car on California to take you to the Pier 1 area on the Embarcadero. If you're inclined (or 'disinclined') you can walk along Powell down to the wharf area and it's all downhill all the way to the water and an Irish Coffee at Buena Vista. We have enjoyed many Fairmonts around the world, but this is the Old Lady and she is a beautiful Grande Dame.

Reviews.Title: “best in p-town”
Reviews.Author: jerrydor
Reviews.Content: has it all! the resort is so clean has pool bars ,great view,great staff

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel. Great view”
Reviews.Author: desertdad67
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a tower room, very spacious and clean. Our room had a fantastic view. Check in was fast and the desk staff friendly. Our beds were very comfortable. Housekeeping left us 3 towels each day, even though there were 4 in our room. So each night we had to call for another. The towel was always promptly delivered. The location of the hotel on Nob Hill was good for exploring the city. Mere blocks to Union Square and Chinatown, also on the corner of a trolley stop. No problem getting a cab either--they were plentiful outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Place--Not The Grandeur You're Led To Expect--But Still Worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: jagtravel
Reviews.Content: It can be difficult to get a good, comfortable location in San Francisco at corporate (i.e., fairly cheap) rates so I was pleased that the Fairmont on Nob Hill was available for business travel. My expectations were probably higher than they should have been but I still had a good stay and would do it again. My pros and cons this trip: The lobby didn't inspire me. The restaurant and bar behind the lobby was generic. The concierge desk is constantly busy, expect to wait up to ten minutes for assistance most times of the day and then get limited results. The door man at the entrance to the hotel will provide the same information you need with some real insider detail--so tip accordingly. Overall, the staff, while busy (there's always a crowd in the lobby) remained professional and courteous. Room: My room was large enough, but surprisingly sparse with standard furniture that really didn't do justice to the hotel's reputation. I had to do some work at the desk in the room and it was shoved into a cramped corner next to the bed. On the plus side, personally important criteria were met: The bed was super comfortable, and the location was surprisingly quiet even with a room over the main entrance. Housekeeping was very good. For the business/conference traveler: The business center was lame--you are asked to pay for computer use even to print an airline boarding pass. Wireless internet in your room has to be paid for, of course, but if you join the Fairmont membership program (free) the service is complimentary. Also, the wireless was quite fast. Side note: The Tonga Room and Hurricane Bar is to be found a few floors under the lobby. I checked it out for a cocktail. It's like Disney's Tiki Room attraction for adults. It's kind of tacky, the food is supposed to be fair, and my Mai-Tai probably ripped a hole in my esophagus--it may have been mixed with rubbing alcohol. In other words, I liked this place a lot and hope it stays around for many years. Summary: If you plan to spend top money on a property in San Francisco, you may be let down a bit by the Fairmont. However, it's still a very good option for a short stay, say two to three days. It's also a good base for a family vacation, and it beats the tourist madness around the Wharf. I had the sense that corporate may be trying to catch up to some of the amenities other brands offer, but give them credit for trying.

Reviews.Title: “Great job Fairmont!”
Reviews.Author: R_Cog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont in SF as the first stop of our Honeymoon, and we were so well looked after. We were very kindly greeted, and after a long flight (diverted to Sacramento, don't ask!) we were very impressed and grateful to be upgraded to an amazing Tower King room. We had a great view, down towards the Financial District. The room was immaculate, spacious and just perfect. Our bags were brought up, an ice bucket was readied... We had breakfast twice in the hotel, once as room service as a treat, the other in the main restaurant. Both meals were superb. Service again was exemplary. The Tonga Room is a good laugh for Happy Hour, certainly a good way to spend a few hours, and yes their Mai Tais are pretty good indeed! Receptionists and Concierge were really helpful and knowledgeable - definitely ask for advice on restaurants, transport etc. I could go on - but let's just say we had a wonderful time and will do everything we can to make sure we stay here next time we visit San Francisco! Thanks to the Fairmont and all of your staff for getting our Honeymoon off to an incredible start.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Ryder78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Honeymoon and we were upgraded to the Bankok Suite. The hotel room was very clean, beautifully appointed and the views from our suite of San Francisco and the rooftop garden were amazing. The location was great, a short walk or tram ride from Union Square in one direction and a 15 minute tram ride to the Pier 39 area in the other. The only downside for us was that the hotel is very expensive to eat and drink in, as can be expected from a hotel of this quality in upmarket Nob Hill. This wasn't a huge problem however as there are many other options for food nearby if you don't want to spend the big bucks for hotel grub. In particular, Sears on Powell St close to Union Sq was a great spot for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and stuffy”
Reviews.Author: ColefamilyCommack
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised we weren't charged by the sheet for toilet paper used. if you thought Starbucks has expensive coffee try their cafe a mile from the room first thing in the morning and wait for minutes to spend $5 for mud.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but a bit past its prime”
Reviews.Author: sjcan8119
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. It overlooks everything that one would like to see during a visit to SFO, but be prepared to work those legs since everything is going to uphill when you want to go back to your hotel. The room was nice and we were lucky to have a suite. The style is the typical Fairmont "old world" style. Not really what I would consider to be in fashion since it has not really really updated to ensure that the modern amenities have not been included. Example: If you are working from your desk, the chair is horrible and not meant for spending much time there at all. The hotel as some noise from the other rooms. Although that didn't really matter to us, we felt that we should speak low and not make too much noise after 11 since we knew the other rooms could hear. The service at the property is okay. We did have some challenges that one of the room service people opened the door before we had a chance to dress and he only knocked once and then didn't wait. One of the managers called the room. I would say that the entire experience was average. We stayed there because we had some upgrade certificates and it was a good deal. Even considering that, we would not take this option again. The hotel was absolutely dead and didn't seem like a place to be. The service was rushed and mediocre at best and not what you would expect from a Fairmont. Until they make some major changes to update, upgrade their service staff and bring some more attention and action to the hotel, this is not for the vacationer or someone who is wanting to have an exciting visit in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: youngyaya
Reviews.Content: I love SF but hate the ugly tourist scenes of Union Square and Fisherman's Wharf. The Fairmont is the perfect solution to this. Perched on Nob Hill, it is close to whatever you want to see but tucked away from the masses. I loved that there was a small park less than a block from the hotel where I could just sit in the sun and read quietly. The rooms are small but typical for an older hotel. The staff was fantastic from the bell staff to the front desk to housekeeping. The only downside was that the restaurants were dated and overpriced but there are much more enticing options within a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance at it's best!”
Reviews.Author: jessers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here late June for 3 days following a Napa valley wine tour. Although we had an interior room without a view, the room was very large, comfortable and well appointed. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I got the feeling that many are long term employees of this hotel and enjoy their work. Loved the location. It is just far enough away from the hustle of Union Square. The only disappointment was their small gym with old exercise equipment and dirty carpets. I was glad that I was a member of the president's club and didn't have to pay. That said, would still highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, wonderful hotel and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Ccs34
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience at this historic hotel. Everything was terrific, we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, A Bit Stuffy”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandGina
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the night of July 4th. We reserved a room with wharf view for the fireworks over the bay. We arrived about 1hr after check-in to find our requested room was not ready/unavailable, and that we were assigned another room. When informed we would not accept this, the desk staff said we would possibly have to wait up to an hour (it ended up being only a 10min wait) for the room we requested. Were they hoping to charge someone else more for our room? It felt that way. While the desk staff was accommodating, with the exception of our friendly bellhop, in general there was no feeling of warm welcome at the Fairmont. Our room (Signature Queen in the NS Tower) however, had a spectacular view of the city and bay. It was bright and clean, with excellent bedding and a gorgeous, large bathroom. Pricey, but worth every penny if staying for a special occasion/event. Note: Easy to pick up the Mason/Powell cable car line right outside of the building (but it will be packed!).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Nostalgic stay”
Reviews.Author: jameswilliamsod
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont a couple of days after returning from the Fairmont in Sonoma. The lobby is as majestic as all the other post's state. We had a room on the 11th floor with a wonderful view of the city out to the bay. Alcatraz was in plain view. It was very quiet. I particularly enjoyed the historical photos lining the hallway on the lobby floor. If you walk out the rear entrance you can hop on a cable cars and travel right into China town. Also, tyhe nob hill cafe was a blockaway and it was good food at a decent price. We received what we expected and were very satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: JamesR_67
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont over the July 4th holiday period. It was at the start of our vacation to California. We stayed for 4 nights in a tower block room which had a fantastic view over the city. We expected great things from the hotel and were certainly not disappointed. Could not fault the hotel in any way. Great hotel in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel but let down by poor service”
Reviews.Author: Katrina70
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for just a night last year on a family trip. As it was the first stop after a long haul flight from New Zealand, I booked us into a suite. I can't really fault the hotel appearance - it was absolutely beautiful, the breakfast room was stunning, the lobby divine, the suite was gorgeous, the Tonga Room a must see. Unfortunately it was let down by the very average service. We had to wait a while for check in (there was only one person on the desk) and the check in person did not smile once throughout the check in process and was unable/unwilling to help at all with questions about dinner reservations. The bellboy was nice enough. There was no complimentary newspaper and no tea and coffee making facilities in the room. It took 45 minutes for a pot of hot water to be brought to our room. The Fairmont needs to learn that it isn't enough to look nice - the memory of superb service and attention to small details (which the Langham and the Four Seasons do to perfection) lasts a lot longer than a gilded lobby and nice flowers. I filled out a customer satisfaction form at the time but never had any feedback from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “room was a let down”
Reviews.Author: bertandernie101
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we wanted to stay somewhere special in the city as we had brought our parents to San Francisco for their 40th Wedding Anniversary. We booked a rather pricy Signature Room for them purely for the views across the Bay as advertised. Unfortunatly they were given a room on level 2 of the Tower, the only view was the next building. We complained but they would not chage the room as they said the hotel was full and the room was in the Tower block so still classed as a Signature Room. The hotel itself is grand, clean and well located. We wanted to go to the famous Tonga Room Resturant but was disapointed it was closed on the days we were staying there. We were also unhappy about having to pay a small fee to use the sauna and steam room at the hotel. Overall we were disappointed. We thought this would be the best place to stay to "splurge" but this was not true. Next time I think its back down the road to stay more centrally around the more convenient and reasonable top hotels around Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely historical hotel on Nob Hill”
Reviews.Author: Leine13
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Fairmont on Nob Hill. Getting to it was a haul as it is situated atop historic Nob Hill, but after gorging ourselves on Chinese in Chinatown and Italian in Little Italy, climbing a few hills wasn't a bad thing. The hotel is beautiful, and has an old style feel without the musty smells and creaking hallways like other establishments have. The ceilings are high and the room we had was quite spacious. The bathroom was the highlight of the stay, with lots of space and THE BEST water pressure in the shower. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and stunning views”
Reviews.Author: RussellERennie
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 nights here during a California road trip. On booking a standard twin room we were given an option for a discounted room upgrade whereby if a better room was available at check in we could have it at a minimal extra cost. This option was accepted. On checking in we found we had been upgraded to a corner tower suite! Not bad for an extra $69 Very large room with seperate bedroom, 2 large couches, dining table, work table and still plenty of floor space. Only problem was our son didn't like the couch to sleep on. Mentioned this to the concierge and a rollaway was promptly delivered - even then still plenty of space. Great views for not being that high up - Pan America building out one side, Alcatraz out the other and looking left the Golden Gate Bridge. Lovely room service and good selection at breakfast. Only issue with breakfast was the slow greeting by same Maitre De on 2 days and being left at our table with no explanation on type of breakfast or introduction of server which is routine for this class of hotel. Most servers we dealt with were very helpful and chatty and can't wait to go back. Shame the pool was converted to a restaurant and that it was closed on the nighrs we were there - not being open 7 days a week

Reviews.Title: “A stunningly beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: museumgoer
Reviews.Content: Don't understand the negative reviews. We stayed for one night in a king-bedded room in the main building and found nothing to complain about. The Fairmont is a stunningly beautiful hotel in the best and most convenient neighborhood in town.

Reviews.Title: “A glamorous encounter, to be repeated”
Reviews.Author: AdriBarre
Reviews.Content: From experience perspective, once you start walking through the lobby a journey into a glamorous and lively past begins. Decorations, marble columns and stairs, gardens and entire corridors with picturesâ€¦ you name it. It really smells â€œlegendâ€�. Also, there are great facilities, services and Nob Hill is a perfect location for both business and leisure trips. Speed of complementary internet is something to be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Awful”
Reviews.Author: JGMoore
Reviews.Content: I booked us at this hotel 3 months prior to our trip -- I remembered staying there years before and having a magnificent view of the city from a balcony, and I wanted that again. Booked the balcony suite, significantly more expensive than the other rooms. I was told upon arrival that our suite wasn't available (and this isn't the only one in the hotel...they have many). So we were "upgraded" (their words) to a room that was the same size as the room we'd requested, but no balcony. I called to complain. Was told that when one of the balcony rooms vacated the next day, we could have it. "And" she added, "you can stay in the room you're in in until the other room is ready". As if that was some kind of favor. The next day we were moved. When my sister and I got to the new room that night, it reeked of smoke. I mean reeked. We tried opening the balcony doors to air it out, but apparently something had died outside and flies were everywhere. Finally my sister couldn't stand it anymore (and given that we were there to run a half marathon I felt the same way). She called downstairs and was told there was nothing they could do, and that they'd see if we could move the next day. It was so bad that even the room service guy commented on it. This experience aside, the hotel was still not great. Never had a doorman help us once while we were there, even as I struggled to get my bags inside. Never got help hailing a cab. No wireless internet in rooms, btw. Given that we paid $700 for that room, the attitude and lack of service were ridiculous. Moved to the Ritz Carlton at 7 a.m. & the difference between the hotels was stunning. I will never stay at a Fairmont again.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the Fairmont, third visit.”
Reviews.Author: DeluxeTraveler
Reviews.Content: The last time we stayed here was back in February of 2006. After reading some of the latest reviews, I was a little apprehensive to stay again. The valets were friendly and the President's Club check was welcoming. They honored my request for a signature queen/queen bedded room in the Tower. I requested a quiet room, away from the elevators and on a higher floor. In my President's Club profile I requested non down pillows. We were given a 20th floor corner room with two large windows with a view of the bay and the city! All of my requests were granted down to the foam pillows!! My husband thought the bed and pillows were so comfortable, I am going to try and order the pillows for home. We loved being able to walk to the Nob Hill Cafe every night for dinner. A definite must eat at restaurant. The food is good and the service friendly. The cable car is nearby as well as chinatown. Be sure to join the President's Club for the free internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Best |Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: 190749Malcolm06
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned after our last stay 5 years ago. Nothing had changed....everything was brilliant. The view had change,as as we paid the extra to stay in a Tower Room with a view across the bay. Money well spent. Everyone did their best to make our stay there special. We could not single anyone out, as every member of staff did what they could to add value to their role. I see the hotel may be up for sale, well I hope that the new owners change nothing!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay.Beautiful views south”
Reviews.Author: mdkohli
Reviews.Content: Good location. Book in advance for a good deal. Walk to fun places

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NoCompromise
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our "summer" vacation in San Francisco. Even though the weather was unseasonably rainy, our stay at the Fairmont brightened our trip. We had a great room overlooking the courtyard and it was a pretty large size considering that it was one of the smaller queen rooms (and that we got it using a TripAdvisor discount). Bathroom was also great. No complaints there. We loved the overall ambiance of the hotel and it's historic decor. It's also in a great location. Very convenient access to the cable cars, bus system and China town. We didn't eat in any of the main restaurants because they were a little too pricey for us (but then again, so is all of the rest of the city). The concierge did a wonderful job of making dinner recommendations. The staff was really friendly and didn't have any snobbiness that can sometimes be associated with higher-end hotels. We would stay again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: San Rafael de Escazu, Costa Rica
Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend retreat in SF”
Reviews.Author: BeccadA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary with a weekend in SF, and the Fairmont was a perfect place to stay. We checked in early (at noon) and were upgraded without asking to a room with a fantastic view of the city, some water, and the courtyard. We found a deal on our stay through travel zoo, and experienced no extra charges or other issues with our discounted reservation (1/2 off). The hotel is in a great location, so close to Union Square, and easy cable car access to Fisherman's Wharf. Our 3 day cable car pass also covered rides on muni, so when our waiter at Gary Danko (fantastic dining experience) recommended Foreign Cinema in the Mission for brunch, we headed there the next morning on public transit! Anyway, the room was beautiful, comfortable, and clean. I joined the President's Club at no cost so that we could enjoy free internet. Awesome experience all around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a tad expensive”
Reviews.Author: dr_mucus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at both the Fairmont and Hotel Rex 3 blocks away on this trip since the Fairmont didn't have rooms for the full length of our stay but we needed to join a wedding party there. The desk staff were superb and very nice. the room was luxurious but a tad noisy. the rooms have heavy doors and you can hear everytime a neighbor goes in or out. we also had no trouble hearing our neighbor's coughing fit or morning conversation. No free internet which is such a rip off in this day and age when you are already paying over $200/night. There was free access to business center downstairs to log in and print boarding pass for airplane trip home. Also free internet in Illy's coffee shop on ground level. I rather spend my money on good food and drink so this was more "stars" than I normally go for. Nothing wrong but not a super value in my mind.

Reviews.Title: “An even handed review from an experienced Fairmont guest”
Reviews.Author: gben88
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont on business in March and found it to be its standard excellent self. I have stayed there over several occasions from the time I was a child and the Swig family owned the hotel in the 60â€™s. Mr. Swigâ€™s penthouse apartment was something to see. No doubt the hotel went through many changes in style and ownership but over the last few years it seems the current ownership group is really working hard to keep the Fairmont worthy of its Four Diamond status perhaps eyeing a 5. The Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons have 5 star rankings but nothing in San Francisco can approach the Fairmont for views, location, history or solid authentic elegance. The Ritz Carlton is a converted girlâ€™s school with very limited views. The Four Seasons is in a less desireable part of town, and the minute you leave to go outside get ready for panhadlers galore. The Fairmont has always been what it is today-a top caliber first class hotel in one of San Francisco's best neighborhoods. It is as much a part of the fabric of San Francisco as the cable cars but still genuinely elegant. I arrived for my last stay at about 1 pm-a bit early for check-in. No problems there. I give Geoffrey at the Front Desk high praise for his welcoming and professional manner in check in, and in making sure I was happy with my room. This time I stayed on the 6th floor overlooking the hotel gardens with a spectacular view of the downtown skyline, Chinatown and the San Francisco Bay. The room, a Fairmont King, was in excellent condition with a nicely sized bath and a great working desk by the window. The wired internet was excellent-the wireless was a little slower though technical support was also very good. The room was white glove clean. Join The Fairmont President's club (free) and you will get Internet for free. The breakfast buffet in the Laurel Court Dining Room is well worth the price-service and the caliber of food actually makes it a bargain. The Tonga Room had an incredible $10 per person happy hour spread that one could have actually made a dinner out of. I entertained guests there before we went to Coi in North Beach and they really loved the atmosphere. After dinner we went back and really enjoyed the band. I think the doorman and bell staff were a little uneven in terms of friendliness and service, and the bar service at the Laurel Court Bar was abysmal. The bartender in his 20â€™s was so occupied with 2 ladies at the bar for the hour we were there that I had to go to the Front Desk to get a manager to take our drink order after 15 minutes of waiting and not even being acknowledged. On the other hand, the crabby older Asian woman in the gift shop had her own kind of charm, but a smile would have helped. No doubt there are going to be some missteps here and there (Iâ€™ve seen it at the Ritz Carlton too) but I think if the hotel were to work on one thing it would be the consistently delivery of service with a smile and an engaging manner as we experienced checking in and at breakfast. The California Street cable car was down for repair though the Powell line that goes from Union Square to Fishermanâ€™s Wharf is running fine. If you go to Fishermanâ€™s Wharf , Scomaâ€™s seems to have gone downhill in food quality but Gary Danko is excellent. What I love about the Fairmont is its feeling of being home in a place where you will have a very comfortable sleep, great access to all parts of the City and being so near yet so far from Union Square and Chinatown. I have stayed in both the Tower and the original hotel. The tower rooms give a spectacular view of Coit Tower, Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge. The original hotel rooms that face Powell and Mason street give wonderful views of downtown and Nob Hill including the Pacific Union Club and Grace Cathedral. I stayed in a 4th floor room facing California once several years ago and did not like the noise or the view of the Mark Hopkins hotel garage. I would stay in a courtyard room if all you wanted was a lot of sleep-especially after an international trip. Iâ€™ll add that in my experience if you are not happy with something ask for a manager or someone above them who can resolve the problem I have never had an experience at any Fairmont where management did not want to do everything reasonably possible to make a guest happy, including finding another room. No doubt, if you want elegance, comfort, location and a wonderful place to work out and walk/run, look no further. This grand old dowager still â€œWowsâ€�.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: prasan68
Reviews.Content: The location is probably the best in the city. A walk downhill to most of the attractions whether Fisherman's wharf , Union Square or the San Francisco shopping center.The service was very good and we really enjoyed the food at the Tonga 'Chinese Restaurant' on our last night at the Hotel. The Lobby is majestic.I was blown away by the old world charm of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull hotel...but unhappy staff let it down!”
Reviews.Author: wrexham123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in may. The hotel is an amazing location with fabulous views over the city. We stayed in the newer part of the hotel in a lovely room,spotlessly clean, very comfortable large bed, large well stocked bathroom and with the most amazing views out towards the bay with Alcatraz in the back ground. A very busy hotel with lots of conferences taking place and delegates milling around. We ate one night in the conga restaurant which was average for the price we paid but nothing special.
