The only complaint I have about the hotel would be the staff, especially in the bar, who appeared totally disinterested in the customers even when we sat at the bar the bar tenders did not enter into conversation with us apart from taking our order

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: roguewaveny
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the newer section based on advice from previous reviews, and liked the room. It was clean and comfortable with a nice view of the city, with nice window dressing. Room service was prompt and good. The lobby was large and beautiful. The food at the lounge was pretty good. No complaints. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Why Fairmont is only a 4 star hotel even with all that history and charm...”
Reviews.Author: Suzanna067
Reviews.Content: 2 families with young kids spent 2 nites at the Fairmont hotel couple days prior to Memorial Weekend. This hotel with such exquisite taste and renouned history should deserves 4 stars, but truely NOT so in there services. No one knew how to smile and welcomed guests in that hotel. From the unhelpful bellman who just stood and watch us and told us to just walk in since our bags were few when we collect our luggage from the shuttle, to the not so welcoming frontdesk , to the concierge who didn't even look up when we asked for a map and cable car directions and just plainly said that caifornia line was out of commission till June still looking down at whatever he was doing, the atmosphere was very unfriendly. If you are going to san francisco, Fairmont hotel is a must see with it's intricate decor and the history behind the place, but consider staying somewhere else. We stayed at Ritz carlton last year around the same weekend, and their superb staff and excellent service was defenitely recommendable. Hotel should not be graded only by it's amenities and conditions of it's facility, but also by their excellence in service. Fairmont deserved a 4 star in appearance, but only deserves 2 stars on it's staff and their services to their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Not our first choice, but wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Elmrosie
Reviews.Content: Due to a mix-up with our booking at the Fairmont Ghirardelli Square - which was handled flawlessly by Fairmont - we stayed here for three nights at the beginning of our trip to the west coast. We felt like characters in the Arthur Hailey novel (in a good way!). This is a wonderful old grand hotel and the tradition shines through in the flawless service and the pride the staff have in working here. I loved that the hotel welcomes dogs. As well as the usual handbag yappers, there was a beautiful white chow visting while we were there. After our long flight and being redirected from the other hotel, we decided to eat in and tried the tiki bar. Amazing food and cocktails, great band playing and I keep meaning to email the hotel for the recipe for their lamb and ginger curry, which we couldn't get enough of. Loved the hotel, location great, views amazing, service and food fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SydTraveller09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 8th May - 12 May 2011. I was upgraded to a bay view room without even asking. The room is very spacious with a walk in closet. The staff are all friendly and helpful. The exterior is quite grand for San Francisco and the lobby is lovely. It is located in a nice part of town. Make sure you join Fairmont President's club as you get to use the gym and it's fitness classes (including zumba which was so much fun!). I enjoyed my stay here, however it is a shame they don't have a free computer in the lobby to check your emails. I don't travel with a laptop when on vacation, so it was annoying to have to pay to use the business centre. Otherwise I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: happysun16
Reviews.Content: I like the old school decor and feeling at this Fairmont. People looking for a modern hotel will not enjoy the rooms here. The bathroom is a little worn, but spacious. The bedroom was equally spacious with a large closet. Our room was quiet and the beds were comfortable. Front desk staff is a little snotty, but I was expecting this. We were here on Easter weekend and a classic car show was going on on the Sunday. The valet staff was very kind and accommodating and helped me get my car out of the masses of surrounding people. The little coffee shop attached has great coffee and is reasonable. It is nice to grab a coffee then walk down the hill. I have stayed here before in a suite (with an amazing view and a telescope to peer out of). Next time I visit I will spend the extra money to upgrade as I remember that stay as more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: julieccr
Reviews.Content: Loved our visit here, the staff could not be any better. I found the bed a bit soft but my husband disagreed so maybe it was just me. We were immediately upgraded to a larger room when the front desk saw we had our child with us, the room was huge and just beautiful, I wish we could have stayed a month! As other reviews noted it is located at the top of Nob Hill so it is easy going anywhere but beware of coming home! The hills are very steep but we enjoyed it after all those great meals in Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “The tower suites have fabulous views across the city”
Reviews.Author: sandra020
Reviews.Content: Can recommend the Tower suites. Very comfortable spacious lounge, great city views across to the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz. Bathroom is large, clean with a huge shower. Best thing about the hotel is the beds. Matress was very large and comfortable I would love to have one at home! Service was friendly and staff were all helpful. Good choice of food for breakfast. The hotel is dog friendly, saw a few dogs staying with their owners. There is a pretty roof garden that has views and it was nice to sit in here taking in the sun. San Francisco is a lovely city, easy to get around and people were friendly. I would recommend getting a 3 day pass if you are staying for a few days you can use this on the local trams, trolley bus and regular bus.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to historical past”
Reviews.Author: SF94597
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a business conference - parts of this historic hotel are gorgeous & front desk check-in was very friendly & efficient. My room was quite small & dated & no view -- so disappointing as I've stayed here years ago & recall a much nicer room. While I can handle a small, older, dated room, the walls must be paper thin as I heard every word spoken from the room next door. While an ok choice, I wouldn't recommend as there are, in my opinion, better choices in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay! Wonderful Anniversary weekend in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: Shel714
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 1 year anniversary in San Francisco and stayed at this beautiful hotel! I did tons of research before on the different hotels in each area there. I am so happy we picked The Fairmont. Not only is it beautiful, but its full of history inside there as well. A lot of well-known people have stayed at this hotel throughout the years- so its also a landmark just on its own. Plus its amazing inside- one of the best hotel I have ever stayed in! It was also nice to stay in a place full of history and charm too! Made the experience that much more enjoyable! The place was decorated so beautifully, especially the lobby area. You really felt like you were in San Francisco while staying there! They also upgraded our room to an amazing view of the Coit Tower and the SF. Bay Bridge. We couldnt stop staring out the window! It was by far the best view I have ever seen! Just beauitful! The room was just perfect with a large bath-tub inside the bathroom also. The room was very large and very nicely decorated. We just loved it! I am so happy to have stayed here on our trip, especially for our anniversary! They really went out of their way to make it a wonderful trip for us! We also had drinks one night at the hotel restaurant, The Tonga Room and it was really neat! Its a tropical themed restaurant and bar that has a tropical rain-storm every 15 minutes or so. We shared a drink made for two- the mai tai which was really good. The atmosphere was really nice there! Also, walk across the street to have dinner or drinks at The Top of The Mark- the view was amazing at night! Anyway this hotel is the perfect place to stay on a trip to San Francisco, epecially for a romantic weekend! =)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CoolMom04
Reviews.Content: Things I liked: The hotel lobby is absolutely gorgeous, and I couldn't stop staring whenever I walked through it. I enjoyed the historic aspect of the hotel. They have pictures along the corridors of construction of the hotel 100 years ago. The room was clean. They bed was comfortable. The elevator was fast, smooth, and quiet. The view from our 22nd floor room was awesome! The location was fantastic, walking distance to many things and a cable car ride to many more. Cable car stop was right outside the hotel. The concierge (actually I think it was the bell hop) recommended an excellent restaurant that my husband and I both enjoyed. Things I didn't like: The trek to the elevator was annoying. It's quite a long way from the lobby. I was disappointed that the decor in our room was eclectic and didn't fit the historic nature of the hotel. Every little thing cost an arm and a leg. We splurged for the room, but I didn't like the drinks/snacks staring us in the face with a hefty price tag. And $60 a day to park the car was quite steep too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: avnv
Reviews.Content: Room in old wing has old bathtubs that hardly drain. Reserve room in the Tower on the upper floors-great views!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in San Francisco - ever.”
Reviews.Author: Albiani
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel is as charming as it is comfortable. I was somewhat weary of staying at an older property, but was pleasantly surprised that the 'old world charm' which greets you in the beautiful lobby is complemented by thoroughly modern and updated rooms. If you book a room here, definitely upgrade to stay in one of the rooms in the tower with a view of the bay. The views are breathtaking - esp the sunsets over Golden Gate Bridge. The hotel is centrally locate and has all the amenities I wanted in a hotel: knowledgeable and helpful staff, spacious rooms, reliable internet, nice spa-like bathrooms, quiet rooms, good gym, etc... We all have our list of wants and the Fairmont hit all mine.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel - Front Desk Service (Elena) excellent”
Reviews.Author: gdeec
Reviews.Content: Checked in part business and one day of non business leisure ...Most impressive elegant hotel. Started with a great experience w/ front desk - Elena secured a room w/ fantastic views for us. Although it was not ready for a couple hours...she personally came and notified us and apologized for the delay. I guess this is 5 start service for a 5 star hotel. She made a long wait tolerable! Now as far as the housekeeping - may want to re-evaluate how you prioritize cleaning rooms that guests are in the lobby waiting for, can't believe it cannot be cleaned in < 4 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Now that's more like it”
Reviews.Author: BLFootInMouth
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont does elegant very well, while remaining a competent business hotel. It's good as a conference venue although the food is typical conference fare. They pull some of the same tricks that other high-priced hotels do - Internet is $14/day, 2 eggs and bacon on room service are $28 plus tax, tip, and room service fee. Small pack of PeptoBismo is $8.99 in the gift shop (there's nothing like a captive market). There is no tea/coffee making in the rooms but room service will be happy to bring you a pot of either for $10. Mini bar is well stocked and if you care about prices don't open it. But the people are super nice and the furnishings are elegant but understated. The bed was uber-comfortable and the bathroom very well equipped. There is as much hot water as you could possibly want, the tub is deeper than usual. There is a nice work desk. On the other hand, my room faced east and the curtains never quite met, so it was like sleeping in a tepee - first rays of light woke me up each day. Also there were no shears so if you want to change you have to close the drapes completely. I was told at check-in that I had a nice view of the rooftop garden and The City. Which means not much of a view at all. "The City" equates to seeing several nearby office buildings. Still, I liked it. For business this is a very nice hotel. I had a bottom-of-the-line room that still had plenty of space. For leisure I'd personally go for a smaller property. Like most high-zoot hotels you can have fun watching the poseurs, but that gets old after a day. Don't forget to visit the Tonga Room on Level T.

Reviews.Title: “Way to big for their britches”
Reviews.Author: Tequila1016
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a business trip to San Francisco in which we stayed at the Fairmont Hotel up on what is called Nob Hill. The hotel is so full of itself. Everything is an extra charge. If you wanted to hook up your laptop in your room, it was an extra $13 a day. There was as workout room, but then again, if you wanted to use it it was an additional $15 per day. There was not a coffee pot in the room. Lots of the rooms are without a view. Just look at brick walls within a square. My room also had a crack in the sink and one of the towels was torn. The organizers of the conference told us that the hotel charges $100 per gallon of coffee that was served during the breaks. Yes, the lobby is beautiful, but the room was 'just a room'. I would not recommend this hotel unless you just have lots of money to throw away. Plus if you had a car, the rate was $52 per day if you were going to use the car, and only $40 if you were just going to park it and not use it....really folks, then why would you bring a car if you were just going to park it.

Reviews.Title: “The worse thing to endure is indifference...”
Reviews.Author: andyhq
Reviews.Content: This was the last hotel on a trip that was to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary. I would like to preface this by saying we have stayed in some of the finest hotels in the world including the Burj Al Arab, Waldorf NY and Goring etc. and so although we all know that hotels can be flawed in many ways, our expectation was reasonably (and not surprisingly) quite high, given the reputation of the hotel chain and the hotel itself. After a loooong flight from Sydney we arrived very tired but really looking forward to our first stay in San Francisco and at the much vaunted Fairmont. On arrival at the hotel we unloaded the bags and a bell hop arranged to take them to the room, this seemed to be very matter of fact and not that welcoming. I went to check in and was met by a lady who gave me the impression that I was definitely an interruption to whatever she was doing. There was little in the way of interaction and virually no eye contact. It was done swiftly and with almost indecent haste and I was handed a room card. I had to ask if that was it as there was no suggestion of "the lift is over there..." or "would you like us to hold a dinner reservation for you?" etc. So we went up to our room and I have to say that is was the smallest room we have ever had in a hotel the US. The bed was a standard double bed and there was no coffee or tea making facilities in the room .When the bell hop bought our luggage up I asked if we could have some coffee making facilities. I was told that they do not put them in the room as a matter of course but they would arrange to send some up. Needless to say it never arrived! In the restaurant there was little distinction between a continental breakfast and the full buffett, which was $30 dollars plus tax and compulsary 15% tip each - this made breakfast $75. Therefore $27 for a bowl of cereal and a slice of toast (which is all my wife usually has) seemed a littel excessive. The buffet breakfast was incredibly poor value for money as, although there was an egg station, where you could have them any style, all the other hot food was kept in trays with hot water troughs underneath to keep them warm - it didn't! The biggest plus here was the Maitre D who was very friendly and welcomed us warmly. The general waiting staff just didn't seem interested and we had to ask several times for things as they kept fogetting or bought the wrong tea etc. When the restaurant was busy (we had to wait twice for breakfast for at least 20 minutes) which wasn't an issue itself but once in there it was clear that they could not handle pressure of any kind as they all ran around frowning and looked frazzled. There was one young lady who served us drinks and food in the lounge for 2 evenings and she was excellent and actually put her more senior colleagues to shame in terms of service and attention. Checking out was met with the same indifference - it was as thoguh we'd never been there. And apart from calling us a cab the door staff were no help at all as I loaded the car myself with the help of the taxi driver. All in all, for the price, it was extremely disappointing and very poor value fo rmoney. We loved San Francicso and will certainly return but I have to say it is unlikely to be at the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Charm and Luxury”
Reviews.Author: jumbos
Reviews.Content: After an overnight trip to Monterey, we chose to spend the final night of our vacation in SF at the Fairmont. We reserved a city-view deluxe room and we stayed in the main building a few stories over the iconic hotel entrance, which provided views of Grace Cathedral and Huntington Park. This room was ENORMOUS. The walk-in closet could have practically been a hotel room in New York City. Our updated room had historic charm with vaulted ceilings, rounded archway, gigantic window, and marble bathroom. The bed was extremely comfortable with very soft sheets. Our room had a ton of sunlight which made the room very inviting and comfortable. We loved the history of this hotel and having stayed at other Fairmont properties, this was one of our favorites. We were very disappointed after attempting to take in some kitsch at the Tonga Room, only to find out it was closed Mondays and Tuesdays. The hotel is located on Nob Hill making travelers very close to many of San Francisco's neighborhoods. Hotel staff were friendly and professional with some warmer than others. Of note, the hotel does not have a pool. Internet is free with a subscription to the Fairmont President's Club. Also, the California St. cable car line running adjacent hotel is scheduled to return to service Summer 2011. We would definitely recommend The Fairmont for its opulence, and old world luxury. Given its history, a visit to San Francisco would not be complete without visiting this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel with superb views”
Reviews.Author: RussellRennie
Reviews.Content: My booking had been made in advance for a twin room. On completing the reservation I was given an "Upgrade" option, whereby for a small increase I could get a room upgrade if that type of room was available on checking in. As the increase was modest I opted into the option. On arrival I found that we had been upgraded to a superb tower suite with stunning views of the Transamerica Building, Alcatraz and th Golden Gate Bridge (albeit it was normally partially obscured by fog!). Th onl issue we had was that the tower suite had only 1 bed and my son had a sofa to sleep on. No linen had been left but on notifying the front desk this was promptly sent up. The sofa wasn't that great forbhim to sleep on and on notifying the concierge the next morning a rollaway bed was sent up. Sill plenty of room in the suite. I considered marking it only 4 stars for location due to the steep hills needed to get to other locations but then it is on the top of Nob Hill for a reason so left it at 5.

Reviews.Title: “great view”
Reviews.Author: malibugypsy
Reviews.Content: We had a view of the whole city- fog, boats, lights. Just a beautiful old hotel with an elegant lobby, but not stuffy. We could walk to Union square, to Chinatown, to the cable car museum, to the cable cars. Very nice to return to the Fairmont every night, and it wasn't that expensive. The room service was the fastest I've ever seen. Beds very nice.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful, historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlmt04
Reviews.Content: the hotel is absolutely stunning. situated atop nob hill, you can be sure to find breathtaking views of historic san francisco here. the staff is incredibly helpful. they were quick to change the lightbulb in my bathroom that went out, and took care of the charge to my room for gym usage (it's free if you're a president's club member). be warned - if you hate walking up hills like I do, this hotel is not for you. though situated between union square and fisherman's wharf, both locations are still lengthy distances to walk, and doing so in the rain (like i had to!) is not ideal. i took many, many cabs. if you happen to be a hiking lover, the location may be just what you're looking for! other than the hills, this place is fantastic

Reviews.Title: “"Grand old lady" of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: nomad66_11
Reviews.Content: I would just start by saying that I have travelled to San Francisco many times and have stayed at nearly all of the best hotels there, 5 & 4 star, except for the Fairmont. Therefore I made a point of booking there to see if I liked it. I can honestly say that I enjoyed my stay very much. The room was large and the bed fantastic to sleep in with soft pillows and good bedding. I loved the walk in closets, and the little alcove area with ledge, seat, and mirror. The furniture fittings were in good order without the usual marks , cup rings and dings. The bathroom although old in design was well maintained, and large, in other words you didn't get the feeling of meeting oneself when you turned. Room cleaning was of a high order, and the bathroom was replenished with toiletries . The Hotel foyer(sorry lobby I forget the hotel is in America) was everything a really great hotel should have, it was large , well designed and classically tasteful, I found myself just sitting there and looking soaking it all in. almost in an Edwardian time warp. What can I add but that in a room just to one side of the lobby, the United Nations was founded. I saved the best to last, each morning I had breakfast in the Palm Court and was exceptionally well taken care of by a lady called Mila ( I hope I pronounced her name correctly). She took the time and trouble to get the kitchen to serve the porridge (sorry Oatmeal) the way I like it and also to discover the way I like my tea (boiling hot water and two tea bags in before serving). This may sound trivial but I can honestly say it was the first time in America , the I enjoyed the tea, she touched an Englishman's heart. All the staff were courteous and helpful, and were not "hunting for tips" I say this because I stayed in the Savoy Hotel in London (another fairmont hotel) before leaving England and I found myself in an atmosphere of "tip expectation". I would say to anyone looking for that special experience to stay in the Fairmont, and give the other quality hotels a miss. I will certainly make the Fairmont my hotel of choice from now on and I hope that Mila will have the tea ready when I arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: emk23
Reviews.Content: We are italians, world travelers, and have been at Fairmont for one week at the end of march . It is an old and historic hotel like Pierre in Ny - Adlon in Berlin - Mandarin Oriental in Bankog . When you are there you feel a touch of class around you . The building is not so beautifull and the fourniture is a little too old fashion but.... we have been very well there . They have also been so kind to make us an upgrade. Thank-you Fairmont

Reviews.Title: “Living on it's name”
Reviews.Author: Sarahlouiselathwell
Reviews.Content: Really really disappointing, on the same trip to America we had stayed in Sofitel LA and Conrad Chicago and were expecting the same standard from the Fairmont, but unfortunately this was not the case. Rooms looked worn and shabby, when we arrived they had overbooked, we had to wait until they found us a room in the reception. That wouldn't have been a problem if the room was acceptable, I felt it was very worn. Food was also very expensive. Not great I have to say. Disappointing end to our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely dissapointing experience”
Reviews.Author: ecs67
Reviews.Content: We checked in and we found hair in the bathtub, the rim of the toilet was soiled and the ice bucket was dirty and wet. Before our arrival we had asked for a refrigerator in our room. It wasn't there. When it was finally brought to our room we put some mineral water in it. The next morning I opened it and during the night it had become a freezer. Several glass bottles had frozen and exploded and broken pieces were all over. I called housekeeping to alert them and they said there were sending a maid. She arrived, barely spoke English and hadn't been told of the situation. She thought she had to make up the room. I asked her to get me a new refrigerator. She said I had to call housekeeping...Terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Valentine's Day love nest”
Reviews.Author: TravelGoddess123
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I'm not ashamed to admit I'm a gal who loves luxury AND a great deal. I had stayed once before at the Fairmont, a standard room for a good rate on a Groupon deal. We live in San Francisco, and having a yummy night or two away as tourists in our own town is a real treat. This time, on our second Groupon stay, when I made the online reservation I checked the option to e-upgrade. I was happy to learn that we were in fact upgraded, but I was thrilled when the bellman opened the door to our corner suite on the 16th floor (the Sutro Suite) and I entered our spacious perch high above the hustle and bustle of the city - with a 260 degree view. I'd never seen San Francisco look so appealing, and I've been living here for more than 30 years! More than a fancy hotel getaway, our two nights at the Fairmont were sanctuary. The lobby is opulent, the Laurel Cafe for breakfast/ brunch is luxuriously quiet and divine. The staff is professional yet friendly. Because we live nearby we took a discreet cooler in with us with our own snacks and libations. The mini-bars at the Fairmont are of the annoying sort where sensors ensure that you get charged for just touching something. The beds and linens both are worth the price of admission. Each time I stay there I fantasize about buying the exact same set up for our home. Being in bed at the Fairmont makes this particular princess very very happy. We had a wonderful time taking photos of our beautiful city, night and day, and celebrated our best Valentine's Day ever. We looked into staying in the same room for July 4th for what would be an AMAZING view of fireworks, but alas, the rack rate was about 3x what we were paying with our Groupon and e-upgrade. I have to admit, the decor is not my style, but it IS the style of the hotel, and we just pretended we were on the set of Mad Men, or in Nancy Reagan's parlor. Parking is very pricey (like 60$ or more a night), and they charge 15$ a day for WiFi. I found that excessive. But all in all, I love the Fairmont and can't wait until Groupon's next discounted package!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: Haugan
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth stay at Fairmont San Francisco on Nob Hill. A fantastic place that has to be seen. Tower room with a spectacular view of the city. I booked a flight/hotel package through British Airways website, and the rates are worth every dollar. Cable car crossing just on the corner makes getting around easy.

Reviews.Title: “First Class!”
Reviews.Author: tuxedofrank
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont gave us exacty what we expected. We were in a historically beautiful hotel, our suite on the 14th floor of the Tower building was great. The view of Alcatraz and Golden Gate bridge from our window was spectactular. So good that we set up two chairs by the window each night. The maid checked our room when we were out and gave us clean towels, glasswear later in the day, besides cleaning the room in mid-morning. Two newspapers every morning. The sheets were the highest count and very soft feather pillows. Free coffee in the lobby each morning. First class!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel steeped in luxury and history”
Reviews.Author: Nat75
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the final 5 nights of our honeymoon. It was a great base for our stay i San Francisco, the staff were amazing and it was a truly awe inspiring hotel. I wouldn't hesitate in recommending it. Try dinner at the Tonga Room.... you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel but oh dear”
Reviews.Author: onthemove008
Reviews.Content: I had booked a very special break in San Francisco for my wife and I to celebrate our 50th birthdays. I booked nearly 12 months out with a UK based holiday company and prepaid everything. We chose the Fairmont because it is exceptional. We arrived at the hotel having travelled for 19 hours. The whole check in experience was a disaster and it ruined our first night completely. I had written a full review of our experience but Trip Advisor keeps rejecting it for use of profanity and I cannot dedicate the time to work out which part of the check in experience constitutes the profanity. All I would say is if you prebook and prepay be prepared with copies of all documents relating to the booking (room upgrades, inclusions, whether you need to submit to credit card preauthorisation to cover breakages and 'other things' amounting to $100 per night etc etc). If you are entitled to a room upgrade make sure you have been given one. If you have breakfast included in your rate make sure the hotel has entered this in their system before you eat breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveller54
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in early December for a work conference and was pleasantly suprised at how good everything was. I would reccomend the hotel for anybody visiting SF due to its excellent position on nob hill and the great standards employed throughout the hotel. Summary: Where to begin? the lobby is large and was well appointed, they had a gingerbread house and an xmas tree as central themes in the lobby while I was there which brought in many familys with children to have a look...a nice december theme I thought. All of the staff I encountered were courteous and very helpful, the bar/restaurant area was compact but the food service was good although the menu was a little limited (lunchtime). The rooms were large and decorated in quite a decadent fashion. I was on a high floor and had trouble getting a good WiFi connection which was a bit of a pain (I'd joined the Presidents Club prior to arrival so received free WiFi and gym entry). I used the gym on two occassions, it had some free weights, some CV equipment and some mechanical weights. There are two jogging routes around the city, reception provide maps, I think they were 2.5miles and 5 miles but I would only recommend regular runners to do these since the last mile or so is up hill (as you would expect) and pretty exhausting. The hotel is in a good central location but unless you are pretty fit you will need to get taxi's to and from city centre destinations due to the harsh trek on foot. Overall I enjoyed my stay here and would definately return next time i'm in SF.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: frans188590
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel. Wonderful service, excellent suite, amazing and astonishing view

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel... Just Ok customer service”
Reviews.Author: RM_1509
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights here attending a conference just before Christmas, The Hotel is steeped in tradition and as a group we were plesently suprised to have an event in the presidential suite. The accomadations as far as the rooms were concerned were very nice. The hotel ammenties are high quality as expected from a Fairmont. Bar Staff and Front Desk always seemed to preocupied or indifferent to your needs. Overall great property. Service at least what our group encountered was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Such a Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: broker1971
Reviews.Content: I have never posted any comments regarding a hotel before but I feel like it was important considering they have not had the courtesy to even contact me with a response.... Below is the email that I sent to the Fairmont: I would like to start by saying that I am a big fan of Fairmont hotels and have spent many business trips / vacations staying at your properties. There are so many things that I love and enjoy about staying with you. The service is amazing, properties are beautiful and so comfortable it almost feels like home. Recently, when planning my travels to the San Francisco area I was pleased to see that there in fact was a Fairmont. So, the decision was easy. I had a need for a suite with a separate room . When I checked in on Friday, Jan 14th I have to say it was not the experience that I am accustomed too. It took forever to get checked in and the woman at the front desk was not welcoming in the least! When I asked about the room that I had originally book ( ns suite in old building) if it had a nice view she said "no" but did not offer any suggestions. I asked if I could get a different room with a better view and she said that she would check. After again waiting a long time she said they did have a suite in the tower available but there would be a price difference. I asked if she could check on my corporate rate for the room and she said that it would be $100 more a night (I wish that she would have given me the total for the room including all the taxes too) it might have been helpful? but this sounded good so we proceeded. She then offered me a roll away bed for the room because my daughter would be staying there too. I thought that this was thoughtful and thanked her for thinking about it . She did not however mention that it would be an additional $35 a night ( In the past I have NEVER been charged for this ). She did not point out any of the ammenities of the hotel (the coffee shop, business center, Tonga) or offer any additional assistance. In my opinion she was not a great first impression on the hotel. When we got to the room ( Sutter Suite) the view was fantastic and for this I was glad for the upgrade! The room was clean and decorated in the special Fairmont style that I love. Although, the room had no extra blankets, pillows or a robe for my 7yr old daughter that I had requested this upon making the reservations. The TV had issues remote barely work and channels would flicker... no big deal since we planned on enjoying the city anyway. After returning from dinner on the first night we came back to a beautiful bottle of wine and cheese platter on the table with a note. I thought how thoughtful of them to send this up .... Wait it was not for us and was intended for another guest. I found this out after I read the card that was left... Oops! everyone makes mistake I completely understand this so I call the front desk to let them know. They inform me that I will need to talk to room service to let them know. .. "ok"? Although she did say that they will probably just tell me to keep it . I explained the situation to room service and apologized for opening the card. They said nothing.... no apology for delivering to wrong room just that they would be right up and asked "if I had eaten any of it..??" When we were in the lobby of the hotel during the duration of our stay (which was so beautiful and has such a wonderful history) I was surprised that the staff did not ask us if they could help with anything or greet us. Usually we are being inundated with cheerful, helpful staff looking to make your stay more enjoyable. That was not the case here! I do have to say that the concierge "Tommy" was fantastic!! Helpful, cheerful and had just the right suggestions for us on what to do or where to go! He is a real GEM ! In closing I must say that I do not mind spending a little more to stay in a wonderful hotel! Especially, The Fairmont for the predictability of the service,quality and experience that is there from property to property. But, I was gravely disappointed by my experience at your Fairmont in San Francisco! And when I return to San Francisco for business/ vacation I will not be staying here! Thank you for listening!

Reviews.Title: “Magical romantic weekend get away, perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: twinsplus1mom
Reviews.Content: Thank you Fairmont for a wonderful stay! I planned a surprise trip for my husband and me to celebrate our anniversary and to get away from work and family responsibilities. We arrived at the hotel late at night exhausted after a tough time getting away from the kids and a long flight delay. Jimmy at the front desk, my new best friend, seemed to notice and gave us a fabulous corner room with big windows and expansive views of the city! The room was beautifully appointed, with comfort, luxury and convenience at every turn. I am so glad I got the bed and breakfast deal. The breakfast buffet was the best I have seen. We were tempted to spend the entire weekend at the hotel, but did venture out for the sights, cable cars and more good food.

Reviews.Title: “The best and charmy hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: LB879
Reviews.Content: When I'm up to the Bay I always stop by at the Fairmont. Best one ever and the service it's just astonishing...

Reviews.Title: “Great location to experience SF. Got a good $ on rooms esp w kids, otherwise nothing to set apart other than history.”
Reviews.Author: Kibo
Reviews.Content: Stayed mid Jan with young family and parents. Huge rooms - easily took our bags and bodies and allowed kids to play in room. V comfortable beds and furnished well. Hotel was doing work to main lobby, restaurant/bar area so this restricted choices to laze, socialise, but not really detract from our stay. Had a simple dinner in the restaurant in the hotel one evening and was OK all round though some of the staff were a little under what would be expected for this hotel. There is a nice cafe housed on one corner of the hotel - Powell St I think - which was great for early morning caffeine fix and quick pastry before heading off to roam SF. More work was being done to facade above hotel entry, so no view from our room - but considering what we paid for 3 nights I have no arguments. Although we had 3 young kids with us and the hotel certainly had a business feel to it - did not feel unwelcome and would happily stay again. Good location, easy walks to lots of places. Great guys on the door. C

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Bay Views”
Reviews.Author: SleepbyWaves
Reviews.Content: As a member of the Fairmont club, I've stayed at numerous Fairmont Hotels around the globe, and have come to expect that they will anticipate my needs. I love the hotel, the lobby, and the views that you get if you book a room on an upper floor. We were on the 23rd with a wall of windows. The room was perfect, and we actually took pictures of the bathroom because we've been trying to describe to our contractor what we're looking for. The views of the bridge and the bay are not to be surpassed anywhere. Though most of the service was very good, we were a bit disappointed at check in. We arrived early, and dropped off our bags letting the front desk know that we were early and didn't expect to be checked in. They offered to text us when the room was ready, and they didn't - I didn't ask or expect them to text us, and if they wouldn't have offered to do so, I wouldn't have expecting anything, but once they told us they would then didn't, I was disappointed. Check in after we finally went back to the hotel went smoothly, but we specifically requested that coffee be delivered to the room each morning, and it was the first, but on subsequent mornings we had to explain again what we wanted. They were always willing to please, but I felt for this amount of money we should not have needed to request again. On the morning of our check out, the bill was not correct, and luckily I woke up quite early and was able to go down stairs and fix it before we left, but again, it should not have happened. Again, the staff was very helpful and patient, and made sure that it was correct before I left. Enough of the downside, they were building the gingerbread house in the lobby the week we were there and it made the lobby just smell fantastic. The brunch is also not to be missed, though it is a bit pricy, but then again, you are in San Francisco. Overall a very good experience, and I'd do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is Dead”
Reviews.Author: MadAboutBaltimore
Reviews.Content: Back in October, I booked (with confirmation) two king rooms with city view through booking.com. When we checked-in and I finally got to my room (the absolute farthest from elevator), it was a queen room with dirty curtains, a toilet seat that appears unsanitary (lots of yellowing cracks - gross), and a non-city view of electrical boxes and four walls. I contacted both the Front Office Manager and the booking.com customer service reps to try to get moved to the room type I expected. What really set me off is that it took two calls to each to finally get an apology - unacceptable as they did agree that a mistake was made and we did not receive what was originally confirmed. Since they were sold-out that night, they offered me a measly $30 for our inconvenience and to move each of us the next day for the remaining three nights of our stay. For a luxury property that advertizes "impeccable service and promises a truly memorable experience," they did deliver on one count - an experience I really hope to forget.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced plus indifferent service”
Reviews.Author: ahung_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Fairmont for work this month. I arrived at hotel very late at night and realized I had forgotten to bring my toiletry kit. I called the front desk who told me they'd bring the toothbrush, toothpaste and contact solution up. 45 min later, no show, I called front desk again who then informed me they did not carry any contact solution. Now it's the middle of the night and I had to walk three blocks up and down hill to go buy contact solution. I am grateful for the toothbrush and toothpaste, but when I complained to the night front desk manager about the misinformation all I got was an indifferent sorry. Not worth it for the price charged.

Reviews.Title: “"A Classic"”
Reviews.Author: anntz
Reviews.Content: Stayed for New Years weekend, while the weather outside was the not the best, the Fairmont was wonderful. Stayed in the older building, room was nice and clean, large, beds very inviting. Couldn't have asked for better service from the check in team, housekeeping, bell boys, staff in the restaurant , Everything that was recommended by the staff was four stars. My only concern was that the walls are very thin and a lot can be heard through the rooms and in the hallways. I also did not like that I had to pay $5.00 for a cup of tea! I think that was a first for me. It would be nice to have a coffee maker in the rooms. I would stay again, location is great, again service couldn't of been better.

Reviews.Title: “Older but nice. Large, graceful rooms make for a comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: BamaGreg
Reviews.Content: This graceful historic property is not for everyone. Like an old tapestry it is fraying in places and may seem dated and worn. Nonetheless, we enjoyed our stay. The rooms in the original building are large by San Francisco standards, and the lobby is quite ornate. Other public areas in the hotel aren't quite as nice. The location is hard to beat. It's a good place if you're in town to tour.

Reviews.Title: “Great Lifetime Experience”
Reviews.Author: whit78232
Reviews.Content: Back in August 2008, my cousin was getting married. She decided to have her wedding at the Fairmont Hotel and reserved rooms there for us relatives and guests to stay. As I entered the hotel, I was fascinated with the lobby, the mezzanine, the little restaurants, spa rooms and the little shops. Two days before the wedding, my mother and I got delicious hot stone massages at the spa, and we ate at the Fisherman's Wharf down the street from where we were and finished the dinner with a late night drink at the Tonka Room with awesome live music on the themed boat. The next night before the wedding, Mom and I came back from the city tour and ate at the Tonka Room and it was buffet night. Food was good and we caught up with the relatives. This place is well worth staying at if can afford it while in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a little flaws..”
Reviews.Author: hm911
Reviews.Content: The fairmont is a nice grand hotel with lovely features, the room was comfortable and nicely furnished, however the bathroom was small and a bit neglected. The location is ok if you catch a taxi or the cable cars. Overall we enjoyed our 4 night stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay with a baby”
Reviews.Author: spritz_e
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at this lovely hotel. We had been worried about travelling with our young daughter, but the staff were very helpful and accomodating. The concierge went out of his way to find us a taxi with a car seat. The servers in the Tonga Bar didn't bat an eyelash when we turned up to happy hour with our 15 month-old, they just found her a high chair. We stayed in a room with an enormous walk-in closet, and actually put our daughter's crib in there so that we could enjoy some television and a glass of wine without disturbing her in the evening. It worked out really well. We had a similar experience as some of the other reviewers with the mini-bar, but all of the charges were removed without a hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Service, But Watch For Extra Charges”
Reviews.Author: Vacation_Seekers77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont in San Francisco (Nob Hill) from Dec 23 to Dec 29, 2010 in the Regency Suite (room 2303, 23rd floor). We had read many of the other reviews on the hotel before traveling so we had some idea of the potential pitfalls to avoid. I'll list the pros and cons: Pros: Great location - the hotel sits on the intersection of all the major cable car routes, so that's a big plus. The hills are steep to walk, but not that bad with good tennis shoes. Room view - from our room, we could see the entire bay, alcatraz, and the golden gate bridge. Fantastic. Staff - very prompt response times and extremely helpful. If it wasn't for the staff, my rating would be far lower. Cons: Hotel Renovations: no where on the reservations did it mention that the hotel was undergoing renovations. We were woken up each morning around 7:30am to the sounds of hammering and scraping. Check into this before booking! Nickle and Dime Charges - we knew about the "automatically charging refreshments" in the fridge and drawers, so we requested they be removed when we first arrived. Sure enough, our preliminary bill had hundreds of dollars in charges on it that needed to be manually removed because "they can't override their own automatic sensors", even though the hotel staff is the ones who removed the products. Highly recommend you do the same and request a guest fridge as check in. Note that you can buy 12 bottles of water from Walgreens right down the street (use the cable car) for the same price as one bottle of water in your room. Honestly, for a $450/night suite, this is just plain silly. This is the ONLY hotel that I've seen that doesn't provide as least some light refreshments for free in a suite. Room Maintenance - TV signals were hit or miss due to faulty connections (after one attempt at repairs by the hotel engineer, we gave up), shower drains were slow (fixed by hotel staff). These types of things should be taken care of before guests arrive. Furniture - the beds are pretty hard, so if you like soft beds, you are out of luck. The rest of the furniture seems run down and fits in well with the antique theme (although I'd swear some of it is old enough to be an antique). Overall, I'd still recommend this hotel just for its location, although I'd caution travelers that a suite here isn't a nice as many other places I've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sweetonme
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. We had a great time here and slept very well. Just 5-6 block walk to Union Square, although on the way back it is up hill. Great breakfast and room service. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Cr1t1c
Reviews.Content: When i drove up to the hotel, i had to wait in my car for 15 mins because someone left there car in front of ours and none of the staff did anything until 15 mins later. Checking in was fine but When I walked into the room I looked out the window, which was quite dirty, hardly allowing you to enjoy the view, then when sitting on the bed I found a piece of gum under the pillows, already been chewed. Also there was a small blood stain under the covers which quite horrified me. When I came down to eat dinner at the resteraunt, the host was terrible, we stoo infront of him for a good 3 mins where he talked to one of his staff, knowing we were infront of him waiting to be seated. The next night we came and left the hotel, coming in at 11, no one was outside to take our car, so webhad to goto the concierge to give them our keys to take our car. This hotel was To me terrible and not something I would recommend to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty and the Beast”
Reviews.Author: 60768WorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was probably the top of the line at one time in its history. The lobby area was very beautiful however, the rooms needed an extreme makeover. Even after opening the windows, the room smelled terrible. The hotel maid tried to sanitize the room to no avail. Perhaps it is time to replace the carpet and the lounge chair.

Reviews.Title: “No way I'd come back”
Reviews.Author: boydpc
Reviews.Content: In all candor my experiences with the hotel go back over a period of years. Our first visit I found the room to be old, dirty, overpriced and without a view (despite paying extra for a view). We decided to give it a second try and came back to spend a night several years later. We arrived and were told that despite a confimred reservation there was no room. They did agree to provide us a room at a different hotel, but in was accross the bay in Emeryville. In short, I've had it with this hotel and will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: CMJCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many hotels in San Francisco and now I can say the Fairmont is my favorite. I felt glamorous staying there. I stayed there with friends recently and we got adjoing King rooms. The rooms were large with beautiful granite bathrooms. And the beds were the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept on. We got a good groupon rate which made it affordable, but it's true that parking cost $57 and room service is very expensive. THere is a little coffee shop in the hotel where you can go for reasonably priced coffee and pastries. We just went there and brought it up to the room for breakfast. I thought the hotel was very clean and unlike some other reviewers said, I thought it was very quiet at night. I will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “The Right Choice”
Reviews.Author: mary1106
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont for two days enroute to Hawaii. We chose this hotel after much research. We wanted the best at a reasonable rate in a great neighborhood; NobHill. The Fairmont was just what we expected. A luxury historical hotel with a grand lobby that is reminicent of a bygone era. Just beautifully appointed. The hotel services were excellant. The staff made us feel welcome and were friendly and knowledgeable. Our room was a newly renovated exterior King which was very spacious and extremely comfortable. The view from our window was stunning. The rooftop garden was beneath us and a cityscape with bay views filled our window. Trolley transportaion was just footsteps away from the hotel entrance. It was a perfect location for sightseeing with easy access to all that the city had to offer. I would definetly recommend this hotel. Thank you Fairmont for a memorable stay. Mary New York

Reviews.Title: “History not to be missed...”
Reviews.Author: joecdn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont San Francisco for three nights after flying down for some weekend fun! The hotel is centrally located at the top of Nob Hill - at the intersection of both cable car lines. This provides a fantastic jumping off point to see all that this wonderful city has to offer! Be aware though - it's a STEEP hill to walk up, and aside from the cable cars - there aren't a lot of other Muni options nearby. As the cable car is more of a tourist attraction, you can expect long lineups and full cable cars going by the Fairmont pretty much all of the time. Taxi's are a good option in the evening - for dinner reservations or bar hopping, but we were stuck waiting in a line about 20 deep of annoying, arrogant consumer attorneys and their "hired" companions!! As far as the hotel goes - the hotel is absolutely stunning, especially the lobby! I particularly enjoyed the antique mail chute, and the way the hallways reminded me of scenes from "The Shining". They have a great tiki restaurant/lounge called "Tonga" in the basement of the hotel (around the old swimming pool which is now a lagoon). They have a very popular happy hour on Thursday and Friday nights which is VERY affordable, and the fake thunderstorms that occur every twenty minutes or so is kitschy but cool. There was a real thunderstorm going on outside when we were there! The long-term plan is for this restaurant to close in a couple years - given how popular this restaurant appears to be (and how incredibly fun it is), I'd say that this would be a fatal error on the part of the hotel management and ownership! The rooms are well-appointed, with warm, comfortable finishes and furnishings. We had booked an Interior Queen in the main building, and were upgraded to an Exterior King with Bay view on arrival. We had a lovely view of Alcatraz and Telegraph Hill. Krystle at the front desk was extremely professional, very outgoing and friendly - and clearly loved her job and the city she lives in. Charlotte at the Concierge desk was also very helpful when looking for dining suggestions. My only cons for the hotel were the lack of pool or jacuzzi, a few operational things that weren't in place in our room (burnt out lightbulbs, slow-draining tub, etc), and the location of the elevators (which is to be expected in such an old hotel). Having said that, I would definitely stay there again, and I would certainly recommend others to do so!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful historic hotel, but in need of a facelift”
Reviews.Author: MigratingBirdie
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Fairmont and I just don't know if it's worth it for the price, especially with all of the fabulous hotels in the city. It sits atop of Nob Hill which means there are great views of the city and the bay, but definitely not near the hustle and bustle of SF and you'll pretty much need to take a cab wherever you go. The food at Laurel Court left much to be desired. However, there is something to be said for the enormous marble pillars, fabulous crown molding, detail oriented wall paper, and what looks like original crystal chandeliers. The newly redone Swigg Suite Penthouse has a mind-blowing view of the Transamerica building and the bay (although most people probably wouldn't be able to step foot unless they ponied up a hefty amount). Like I said, the hotel is historic, code for old. It was a little musty when I arrived, although the smell seemed to disappear or I just got used to it as time went on. Maybe because I arrived on a very rainy day? There was no coffee bar, or water available in the room and the room service prices are exorbitant (and the food is mediocre at best)! There was no turn down service. The walls are thin, I could hear the guy in the room next to me blowing his nose (plus his yappy lil' dog) and I'm sure he could hear my very low volume TV in the am. The saving grace is the great attitude by the staff. Everywhere I went, the staff was friendly and even greeted me and made polite conversation with me in the hallways and elevators. If they could not provide the assistance I needed, they were quick to call someone who could. When I complained about the unattended yapping dog, someone was there to follow up within 3-4 minutes, very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Fraudulent Charges for Everyone”
Reviews.Author: kremlach
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is in a great location and has a friendly staff, but the rooms are very tired and were quite hot during the stay. Do not walk around in your room, or you will trigger the sensors in the "vending machine" area mentioned by other reviewers. You'll get charged for stuffed seals, nuts and wine. EVERY member of our party had these charges added to their bills. This is not an innocent mistake, it is fraud.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: chris50Boston
Reviews.Content: The Farimont was a sensational experience. Outstanding service and a beautiful environment located on the top of Nob Hill. Easy access to all of the sights. The staff was wonderful . The hotel was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyPrice
Reviews.Content: This was my very first trip to San Francisco, and really the first trip myself and my spouse have been on together. I really pumped myself up for it and picked The Fairmont as my top choice specifically. I felt that the location was perfect for a first timer, and being such a well known hotel, that I would be treated special and well taken care of. That just wasnâ€™t the case. The room was smaller than I had expected, but we had a decent view and I really hadnâ€™t planned on spending much time there anyway. The hotel lobby was gorgeous, the lounges and gift shops as well. However, I felt EXTREMELY unwelcome. I guess being under 30 with a spouse covered in tattoos, you wouldnâ€™t expect that six figures would be my salary. We were either treated as though we didnâ€™t exist, or like children. I went to one of the boutiques on 3 separate occasions and although myself and the girl working at that time were the only ones in the room, I was not acknowledged once. I stood at the concierge desk a handful of times on the way out of the hotel with questions and again, no assistance. The two times I was assisted, the concierge gave me incorrect information about how exactly one uses the cable cars, and when I was too exhausted to go find somewhere to eat, I was referred to have Chinese delivered from (what the Concierge described as his 'top recommendation from China Town') a place that sloppily brought me leaking bags of food to my room. When I asked someone about delaying my checkout time by an hour, I was told to call the day OF checkout to see if it could be pushed back. Which seems to defeat the purpose of a later leisurely checkout. Plumbing was clearly an issue when each time I went to brush my teeth, the sink was clogged and quickly filled with water. A man was given the wrong room number at one point and spent 10 minutes outside my door try to pry himself into my room. There was a gap in the seal of the door so the light from the hallway shined through all night. We went down to the Tonga room and ended up walking away after no one ever came to seat us. I called one evening to have a cab ready to take us to the Symphony because Iâ€™ve had experiences with some cabs in other cities not taking credit cards. I was told it would be no problem and there would be one waiting at a specific time. After watching the bellmen hop around assisting everyone coming in and leaving the hotel but us, I stood at the end of the street to flag down my own. Which is not a problem, however if that was going to be the case I shouldnâ€™t have been told otherwise. Ordering room service one night was a complete waste of the overpriced menu food I could have prepared myself; with the exception of the chocolate cake which I must say was phenomenal. I do wish it had been more clear and literally mentioned to me about the room service charge per person with gratuity included when I placed the order. Maybe thatâ€™s naive of me and you're thinking I should have read the fine print, but again this was my first time traveling to any other city besides the state I live in and I expected to be taken care of. Which I donâ€™t feel is too much to ask. Although these were not a necessity to me, I also found it odd that such a higher end facility would not already have wifi and parking included; when even many 3 star hotels do. Just because one makes enough money doesn't mean they should be taken advantage of and sucked dry. I was just really let down with the ever so mediocre experience when I was expecting to have a happily memorable stay there, a fabulous place to call my own which I could continue to stay each returning trip, and a definite place to refer to those close to me. I will absolutely be staying somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Eh...better off somewhere else next time.”
Reviews.Author: JAYWELDON
Reviews.Content: It was overpriced however expedia made that not matter. It has a great location. It's an old hotel however so the usual can be expected. Bad plumbing, no electrical outlets. WIFI is 13.95 per day. THere is no laundry service. Hardly anyone in the hotel speaks english as their first language. The coincerge is overworked and hardly ever available. Make sure you do your planning ahead. You can walk to virtually everything but be careful because it's all hills. I recommend the Sight Seeing Tours in the Double Decker Buses or $35 a piece. It's definitely worth it and you can get on and off at all of the places you would want to visit in downtown San Francisco. The cable cars are $5 a piece one way. Make sure you know which direction you want to go though! The coincerge told me to just jump on one and it would take me where I wanted to go....NOT TRUE! After a $5 dollar ride down the hill I had to pay another $5 dollars to take me back up the hill in the "correct" direction. Overall San Francisco lives up to the hype though. It's a cool place but don't think you are going to be able to have fun on a BUDGET. It's a pricey place and stay at one of the "brand" hotels so you get the amenities at no extra charge and where the hotel staff is a little friendlier because of their corporate structures. P.S. There is no laundry service at the hotel. They outsource it so expect to pay TIME AND HALF if you need something the next day. P.S.S There is no pool and parking is $50 dollars a day. Don't pick up anything in the room that looks like food or beverages. It's spring loaded and will charge you automatically. I feel sorry for someone who tried to clean out the fridge to put in their own stuff =) We walked a block to the liquor store and got a bottle of awesome wine for $20 dollars instead of the same bottle in the hotel menu for $200.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont has good location but 57.00 for parking?”
Reviews.Author: onaroll91360
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the fairmont on 10/31/2010 for business the next day. hotel is centrally located in nob hill. Unfotunately, they charge an additional 57.00 for parking which was not indicated on our print out after booking on-line. It was only reflected in our check-out statement. Lots of homeless people in the area but nothing the hotel can do with that. the room was great, the dinner in the lounge was good and the house wine was fabulous. When we called the front desk, the girl said there was nothing she could do, but we should indicate it to the mamagement. Really? she works there, but we have a better chance of changing a rate?

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm in a Great Location (but choose an outward facing room)”
Reviews.Author: A_Travel_Opinion
Reviews.Content: Wanting a classic SF hotel, we had a room in the original building facing outward. We weren't disappointed. High ceilings and classic features but modern upgrades. The bedroom was somewhat small for today's standards, but not for the era in which the hotel was built. Large walk-in closet. Ok view--the original building isn't tall. Great lobby, fitting for the hotel's history. Tiki lounge was kitsch and fun for a dinner and drinks. We would pick the Fairmont again but would choose the newer Tower, a high-rise with great views of the city. If you stay in the original building, don't pick the inward, courtyard facing rooms if you want any kind of a view. There's absolutely nothing interesting to see, only other room windows across a roofed courtyard. Little light and a little dreary.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: fed83
Reviews.Content: Elegant hotel with spacious rooms. All the amenities that one would expect with one exception : no WiFi in the rooms. The lobby had WiFi but the rooms have only wired connections. Location is great with all 3 cable cars nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Has seen better days, years ago....”
Reviews.Author: traveller20102
Reviews.Content: I'm very surprised to see so many good reviews for this property as I do not think they can be competitive to other 5 star properties in SF. Our room was small with old carpets, chipped furniture, dust all over the room and the paint is peeling off from the window frames.....The walkway to the room is actually an experience, since some off the doors (leading to the back of house I guess) are in the worst condition you can imagine, which reminded me on Airport motels...All this was topped by the breakfast which included the most disgusting buffet presentation I have ever seen in a 5 star hotel (I don't even know why we haven't left immediately, maybe only because of the lack of breakfast options near the hotel), none of the items was even of average quality....there is a chef preparing eggs in the middle of the restaurant, the lady in front of me was asking very kindly for scrambled eggs without putting too much butter/oil in the pan, his reply was seriously: I can't do it whith less oil, so either you stick to it or you will not be able to get any eggs at all!!! The wait staff wasn't better, most of them seem to have retired 30 years ago, which I guess was the time this property was still living up to his standard. Do not bother to stay there, many much better places and real 5 star hotels are just down the road.....

Reviews.Title: “Staying in a vending machine”
Reviews.Author: zatushka
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont has made each room into a revenue generator by installing spring loaded pads under the vast, yes vast, array of stuff it sells in each room so that should you pick up the plush toy, bottle of wine or can of soda you are instantly charged for it. This system is described in the best Orwellian language as "For your convenience, refreshments removed will be automatically charged," so don't dare try to use the very full refrigerator to put your sandwich in. Wi-Fi is $14.00 a day and parking $50.00 plus 14% tax. And there is no coffee maker! Stay where they actually care about your comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this lovely, grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluebell5031
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a grand, traditional feel to it but with an air of opulence. Loved sitting in the huge foyer with a coffee just people-watching-especially as President Obama was attending a huge function in the grand ballroom! Great excitement but didn't catch a glimpse. We paid to upgrade to a corner room in the new tower which had views of the bay and the city. It wasn't a massive room but was large enough for two with a lovely bathroom, beautiful bedlinen and soft furnishings and light colour scheme. It was my favourite room and hotel of our usa trip, well worth paying for upgrade. We liked the location, San Francisco isn't too huge so can walk or take trams. Ate in the main restuarant off the foyer one evening. Meal was very good, only negative was one waiter trying to do everything himself and looking rather harassed! Didn't try the Rainforest restaurant in basement, not our thing! I loved this hotel. Staff were professional, efficient and not unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “Grand elegance”
Reviews.Author: marydomb
Reviews.Content: Recently renovated, the Fairmont exudes luxury and grandeur. The lobby is stunning and expansive, the staff impeccably attentive, and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. The location is good - be warned it is a hike up and down to get anywhere though you are very close to the Powell cable car - I wouldn't say ideal. If you want to feel pampered this is the p,ace to go.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Stay.....”
Reviews.Author: princessxxx
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel . heavenly bed . huge rod iron balcony. excellent prestine location on top of nob hill. close to china town union square, cable cars, singapore suite, when booked in advance great deal. only drawback if I had to say one is the $55 a day parking fee. I am looking to stay again for a whole week.. wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Abifloro
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is ideally situated with trolley stops right behind the Hotel to take you to any attraction you wish. A small european style coffee shop located on the ground floor gives it that home like feel. If you book far enough in advance, you can get great deals on rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great views and a great stay on Nob Hill”
Reviews.Author: traveler21820
Reviews.Content: To conclude our holiday in the U.S.A my wife and I treated ourselves on a 5 days stay in the Fairmont Hotel in San Francisco. A hotel with a history, which you can derive not only from the impressing lobby but also from the numerous photographs of celebrities that stayed, filmed or performed in the Fairmont. The Fairmont Hotel is a majestic building on top of Nob Hill, on of the few buildings that survived the 1906 Earthquake almost undamaged. When we entered our 'Tower room' we where astonished by the views over San Francisco and the Bay. Astonished to a degree that my wife, who has not only problems with heights but also with windows that can't be opened, felt rather uncomfortable. I decided to ask for a room with windows that can be opened and were, without hesitation, upgraded to a superb suite with a balcony on the backside, unfortunately without a great view. A couple of days later my wife decided to control her 'vertigo' to the utmost and surprised me with a second removal: to the Tower room with bay views again! Even now the staff was kind, understanding and cooperative. The Fairmont is located near Powell- and Californiastreet so you can hop on the cablecar any direction you like, if desired after a great breakfast in Cento [a kind of Starbucks, belonging to the Fairmont]. The Fairmont Hotel was superb place for us to spend a wedding anniversary in San Francisco , thanks to it's kind staff, everyone included!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: hbbrigham10
Reviews.Content: This was a very beautiful, well kept hotel. We loved our stay there, San Fransisco is a wonderful city to visit!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, great views”
Reviews.Author: missD07
Reviews.Content: This hotel is grand with some great history. It has spectacular views atop Knob Hill. It's just a little difficult to walk back up to the hotel if you're wearing heels. Better to catch a tram or taxi back. Our hotel room was lovely and spacious with a great view of the city. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful too. A beautiful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Overlooking Downtown”
Reviews.Author: atropiano
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night at the Fairmont San Francisco while we were in the Bay Area for a wedding. We took BART into the City from the East Bay (exit at Montgomery Station) and then a cab to the hotel since the walk would have been all up hill. Given the steep slope it is a walk to get downtown, but if you are prepared and wear comfortable walking shoes it shouldn't be a problem. After resting at the hotel we walked down to Pier 39 and back which wasn't bad since it was such a nice day out. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful, the service at this Fairmont lives up to the brand's reputation. The queen room was spacious and had a great view of downtown. Our check in and check out were flawless and I would definitely recommend any friend or family member coming to San Francisco to stay at the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: KB002
Reviews.Content: A stunning hotel. I had a Deluxe room in the Tower building with a fantastic view of San Francisco. Location was perfect. The room was very spacious, especially the bathroom which had both a shower and tub. Of the Fairmonts I have stayed in, my room here was by far the best.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelmum3
Reviews.Content: A beautiful historic hotel with very friendly staff who were always willing to help. THe cable cars stop outside so it is very easy to get to and from Fishermans wharf and union square which is a quick 10m downhill walk. The beds were very most comfortable and the pillows heavenly! POssibly not the best place to stay with young children who would prefer to be around the wharf but my 10yr old daughter and I loved it!. The hotel does have an 'old world' feel to it but that is where its charm lays. The rooms were very spacious and the large luggage room was a great place to store and hang our clothes without crowding the room. Definately reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing...!”
Reviews.Author: WoodwayGreenwich
Reviews.Content: Staying in the Fairmont for 3 nights at the start of our 2 month honeymoon, we couldn't have kicked it off any better!! The location is perfect, with amazing views over the city. Arriving after a 10 hour flight, we were checked in quickly. Our room (8th floor) overlooked the garden, but there was a business party there with music being played so being so jet-lagged we asked to move rooms. We were upgraded to a room in the towers (15th floor). It was brilliant!! We had panoramic views of the city and didn't want to leave the room!! Excellent all rounder. Would definitely recommend it and hope to go again!!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: loubinky
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I had a package air/hotel deal for San Francisco that included the Fairmont. It is considered the "off-season" in early June; not as warm as some prefer, but we thought the high 60s, low 70s weather was perfect. I joined their President's Club (free) online before we left, and upon arrival, we were immediately upgraded to a much larger room by the President's Club check-in person. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms immaculate, and everyone from the bellboy to the concierge was amazingly helpful. All the streetcar lines converge right outside this hotel, so, no matter where you want to go, you can catch a trolley right outside the door. Union Square, Chinatown, Ferry Market Building, North Beach are all very close. Buy a MUNI pass at the airport and get unlimited rides during your stay, instead of paying $5.00 per ride. The hotel bar, Tonga, is not to be missed, and has great drinks. Again, if you are a President's Club member, there is no cover charge to get in. The Fairmont contributed a great deal in making this the best vacation I have ever taken.

Reviews.Title: “Most Beautiful Hotel I've Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: Travelmad1955
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont was the most beautiful hotel I've ever stayed in. My husband and I went there to celebrate our anniversary. We stayed in the original portion of the hotel on the 5th floor. The rooms were beautifully appointed and very luxurious. The bed was super comfortable and I have a bad back. The only problem was that on the second to last night of our stay we were awakened twice, first by guests on the west adjoining room who were apparently having some kind of business meeting then the guests on the east adjoining room started having a major fight and I had to call security. It was pretty bad! The hotel offered to move us to a different room which we graciously accepted and they put us in a tower room which was a corner suite. Fantastic views! Although we plan on going back, we will definately stay in the tower next time for all of our stay as apparently the walls in the original portion of the hotel have very little if any sound barrier. We actually suggested that they might want to call Mike Holmes of "Holmes on Homes" and get some suggestions from him as to how to fix the problem. All in all though our stay was excellent and the staff were top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Historic Hotel of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: love2travel28146
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Fairmont for 5 nights. We thoroughly enjoyed this grand, old hotel. It really gave us a sense of what old San Francisco would have been like. We booked a standard 2 queen bedroom on expedia and got a great rate. My husband contacted the hotel directly and requested a room with a view since it was my 40th birthday. They gave us a room on an upper floor with a great skyline view. The room was nice (adequate), and the view gorgeous. We enjoyed the lounge for cocktails on several occasions and ate once in the Tonga Room. I would recommend the Tonga Room for the appetizer menu and happy hour drinks. We loved the location of the hotel. It is right at the intersection of all 3 cable car lines, allowing easy usage. We enjoyed dinner 2 nights at The Nob Hill Cafe ( a short walk) and had drinks/appetizers one night at the Top of the Mark next door. If you want to be close to the hustle and bustle, stay in Union Square, but if you want to stay in one of the "grand landmarks" of the city, stay here! We would definitley return here!

Reviews.Title: “Over rated!!”
Reviews.Author: hikerprincess
Reviews.Content: We were booked with Vermont Biking Tours for an extended weekend at the Fairmont. Our room was tiny and faced a cement wall, we noticed water dripping from the window edge, condensation form the air conditioner. We called and ask for an upgrade. We were more than willing to pay, but nothing other than a room by the elevator was available. The noise beat out the leaky air vent. After dinner, six of our group tried for last minute cancelations but no luck. We had stayed at the Hyatt Embarkadaro the prior weekend for half the price and a beautiful room with a view of the bay. On future visits this is where we will return!

Reviews.Title: “plus and minus”
Reviews.Author: Countrylawyer
Reviews.Content: Overall the experience was average. The "wow" factor of the lobby doesn't carry through to the rest of the hotel.
